"HAHAHAHAWHAHAHATHAHAHAHA?" you try and speak, but the tickles continue forcing you to laugh even more.

"Anyway I'm going to give you a choice, seeing that my current stewards have let my house fallen into disrepair" the voice states, "So either I moving in with you and go where you go, until I find a new place to live, or..." it stopped as the feather-lights subsided, still giving you the occasional tickle. "Or you help me regain control of this city."

"WhatHAHHAHAHAHAHNOAHAHAHAHHASTHAHAHAOPAHHAHAHAHAH" you try to speak, but the being suddenly starts up the tickling again.

"Either way I'm going to enjoy playing with you" it chuckles, "so what's it going to be camp?"
1423221.title: Quietly look for the artifact (very quietly)

choices: You wake up to the sound of voices approaching
Wake up in something warm, wet, and slimy
1423222.content:
Suddenly...footsteps! The shuffling of monks' sandals is getting closer!

You duck back, squeezing behind a musty shelf crammed full of old books. Your back and head press against the wall and shelf painfully, but you are out of view by the time the crowd of monks ambles into the room. They quickly kneel down and pray in their peculiar silent fashion towards the table, you can see through a tiny space between two books. Then they walk out in a line and around the corridor. You wait until you can't hear them at all to get out of your hiding spot.

Before you can pick up the scroll again, a voice rings out behind you.

"Hello there, my thieving friend."

You jump a foot in the air and whirl around, attempting to draw your long dagger on the bearded, hunched old man who called you out. Before you can stab at him your dagger lifts itself out of your hand and clatters to the floor. "Dispense with these primitive tools," the kindly monk says, "It's obvious that you have come to delve to the catacombs".

"Are you going to stop me?" you ask him.

"Stop? Of course not! Any man is welcome to try for the treasures hidden in the depths below. But with treasure comes danger. None have made it back yet." he admits. "Some say they can still hear their tortured laughter."

Shaking your head, you think about what he's told you. If the monks don't even try to stop enterprising thieves from entering, it must be very dangerous. But you let your bravado get the better of you. You tell the old monk that you'll take up the challenge. He stares at you gravely and shakes his head. "Don't say I didn't warn you. Come, follow me."

He walks with you down a stone corridor lighted by torches, to the left, forward, then down a thin stairway. You both reach a heavy wooden door with no windows or bars, but several locks. The monk fumbles in his robes and withdraws an iron key ring, with several brass keys. Swiftly, he opens each lock and pulls the door ajar. Inside is very black, and impossible to see. You stand in the doorway and peer in, but your eyes have not adjusted to the darkness.

"Perhaps you will find some of the other adventurers. Some came last week." says the monk. With that he plants one wrinkled hand between your shoulder blades, and gives you a hard shove.

You yell and claw in the air as his shove sends you spiraling off into the black pit, as there is no floor at all in the room. You plummet for what seems like a whole minute before hitting the ground and getting knocked unconscious.
1423222.title: Wait for one of the monks to find you

choices: Seek out a fence and sell the amulet
143.content:
Either you're lucky, or just that damn good.

A colorfully-dressed noble had grabbed your attention the moment you stepped into one of the bustling, loud streets of New Forazio. It was easy to creep up on him, and even easier to rummage through his pockets. Something metallic grazed your fingers and with a speed that would make the wind jealous you had taken the object from him before hurrying off.

Now, in another street, you have time to see what you had pilfered.

The object is an amulet. A gold chain holds up a circular medallion at the end. Etched on to it are two twisting feathers which form a yin-yang sort of look, but what interests you more are the dozens of tiny diamonds that sparkle on the amulet like stars at midnight.

"I don't know whether to fence this or wear it," you quietly say to yourself, grinning. It'd surely fetch a great price, but there was also this urge to try it on.
143.title: The Magical Amulet of Murgoth

1431.content:
“What?!?”, you exclaim, flabbergasted, “Not even a farthing for the thing?”

“Not so much as a prayer-note for what you hold, friend”, grins Grovtin, the stooped over old fencer of goods known to many in your line of work.

“And why is that?”, you reply, incredulous.

“You really don’t know, do you? You must be brand new to this town”, laughs Grovtin.

“Okay, true, so—“

“This is an Amulet of Murgoth, my young friend, and you didn’t take it. Rather, it has taken you! You can’t sell one of these in New Forazio, and you can never be free of it until the Festival of the Fountains, which is held at the Palace of Janux the High Pasha a mere two nights from now.”

“B-But why ME?”, you sputter.

“Oh, it’s a great honor indeed! You’ll play an important role in the feasts and pageants commemorating the coming of Springtime! Why, should you survive—“

Exasperated, you interrupt, “Should I survive?!?”

“Shhh! Hush!”, and Grovtin listens intently, an ear towards the door to his shop, “Quickly! Behind the counter! They are already searching for you!”, and it’s then that you too hear the commotion in the alley outside.

You swiftly dash behind the counter and down a trapdoor in the floor that Grovtin holds open for you, wondering all the while what exactly you’re getting pulled into, and whether you’ve made a single good move since arriving in the city, as you are plunged into total darkness, clinging only to the iron ladder at the top of a circular shaft.

Then, you hear the shop-door open above, and the muffled greeting of the old fencer Grovtin. The muffled voice of the visitor is too low and sinister for you to hear, but it is obvious from long into their conversation that Grovtin is nervously backpedalling as he tells the guest loudly, “Oh, them! Yes, of course! I sent them on their way a good ten minutes ago. I purchased this amusing trinket from them, for the orphans -- of course. Ahem.”

Then you hear the visitor to the shop quite clearly, as if they are leaning over the counter, sniffing you out, “You had better not be lying to me about the Chosen of Murgoth, old swindler, or it will be my pleasure to devise any one of a number of hideous, unthinkable ends for you!”.

You hear the door to the little shop slam shut, as the visibly shaken Grovtin helps you out of your temporary hidey hole.

“You must leave here immediately, friend. You are indeed one of the Chosen of Murgoth, and your fate is already aligned with the Festival!”.

“So, I’m cursed to be at a palace full of feasting and fun? Why again is it I am running away from this?”, you inquire, a tad sarcastically.

“Few of the Chosen have ever survived the Ordeal of the Feathers, as the Amulet unerring points to those who are of a particularly sensitive nature, matched only by their excellent physical conditioning. I must say, I would not have taken you for the later, as you look far too slender to endure the entire lengthy Ordeal.”

“Enough of this nonsense. How might I be rid of this cursed amulet, then?” You question.

“You can either try to leave the city and make a run for it, hoping not to be caught by the select Seekers such as Rondor, my last visitor, before the Festival commences.

Or, you might try the Oracle of the Tombs, who it is said can provide an answer to every question.

Finally, You can try to stay moving for the next two days, hiding in the sprawling city, hoping the Seekers don’t catch you. Heaven help you should they catch you.

Now, be gone from here and all fortune to you, young thief. You’ll need it.”
1431.title: At Grovtin's Shoppe

choices: Wait for her to get her fill of your odour to give you an answer
Put down that apple and make a break for it!
14313.content:
"I've hidden from alerted guards before, and can fit in with any crowd inconspicuously, even though I still DO get the occasional stare, but only because of my good looks. Besides, if I am able to enter the Palace with this necklace, I'd have access to riches beyond imagination!" You debate with yourself after exiting the fencer's shop.

"I think I'll wait out the next two days, I have a good feeling about this!" You think as you pull the amulet out for a quick peek, admiring its craftsmanship and beauty, a sudden slight urge to wear it washes over you before you snap out of the trance, slipping it back into one of the many pouches that cling to your lithe, athletic body in a hurry.

Later that afternoon, you're at a market stall picking out an apple to munch on when you hear an odd sniffing right behind you. Turning around, you jump at the sight of an old lady's head just next to your underarm, your outstretched arm still handling an apple, leaving your bare, sun-kissed armpit exposed for her. Her eyes are focused intently on it, and her nostrils are still twitching and widening with each deep breath she takes.

"Errr.. Excuse me, old lady? Is something the matter?" You ask, slightly embarrassed at the unwanted attention, when you notice she has a similar amulet to your stolen property around her neck, except that the chain is made of a dull bronze, and the feathers are not decorated with any gems.

A few more awkward seconds pass, as you ponder over your options
14313.title: Hide in plain sight

choices: Everyone has an insatiable urge to tickle you.
Everyone is forced to obey your commands.
You are forced to obey any command.
1432.content:
Such an item would look better on you than on a shelf to be sold by one of your fences. With a triumphant grin, you lift the amulet up over your head and place it around your neck, making sure that it rests against your chest comfortably.

"Hmm, very nice," you remark to yourself.

You begin to turn, but something grabs your attention. The amulet is beginning to feel warm against your chest. Frowning, you look down at it, confused. You grab it in your left hand and lift it up, but just as you do the heat fades. Was it your imagination? You aren't sure, but the fact remains that the feeling is gone and you are one amulet richer than this morning.

Little do you know that the amulet is, in fact, cursed. The very nature of the curse has been muddled over the years, but you will soon discover its true purpse, which is...
1432.title: Put the amulet on

choices: Try to lose them in an alley
Try to hide in a shop
14321.content:
Nothing seems unsual at first. With the market in full shopping-frenzy during midday, the side street you're on is much less empty. That also makes it easier to notice when a woman walking past you suddenly stops at your side. Her expression becomes neutral and her eyes widen.

Judging by the simple beige frock, ragged sandals, and disheveled long brown hair, she is one of the unlucky, but becoming more common, lower-class of the city. Perhaps she was on the way to the market. Slowly, she turns to face you, and you turn to match her, a brow rising.

"Uhh... can I help y-" you begin to ask, but you're cut off. In a flash, her hands dart out and dig in to your ribs. You burst out laughing and stumble backwards out of her reach, hugging yourself.

"Heehehee! What the... hey, lady, what the hell is your problAAHHAAA!!"

In mid-sentence, a pair of hands from behind grab your hips and squeeze them. You twist violently and manage to break free, with your hips still lingering with tingles. Stumbling aside, you spin around to your new attacker, seeing it's another woman. Unlike the first, she is garbed in an extravagent emerald gown with wide hips, and a black corset on top. Her red hair is woven tightly into a bun. Both of her arms are still outstretched from the tickling she gave you. The only common trait between her and the other woman is their wide-eyed, neutral expression.

Speaking of which, the first woman begins walking towards you, and the second woman follows in suit. Their arms are outstretched for you, fingers wiggling menacingly.

You're bewildered, and quite scared. This is not normal behavior for any person, and especially not in this city. You take a few steps back before turning and sprinting away...
14321.title: Everyone has an insatiable urge to tickle you.

choices: You try to climb a building, but too late and they catch you
143211.content: Since you figure there could be more people in the shop, you dart into the nearest alleyway. Turning a corner, you expect to see a quick escape route but are greeted with a the cold wooden face of a dead end. You turn around to face your pursuers and see that a few more people have joined the poor woman and noble lady. You see that the noblewoman is wielding a luxurious, fluffy powder puff and another woman, a barmaid, has a large soft-bristled scrubbing brush. The small crowd advances quickly as you look for a way out.
143211.title: Try to lose them in an alley

choices: the crowd staring at you, waiting to begin your torment again.
yourself on the side of the street, the amulet in your hand.
143212.content:
You can't really tell with your back to them, but it doesn't seem as if the two women are trying to chase you. Just to be safe, you turn a sharp corner and jump immediately into the neares shop.

The one you chose isn't very big, having only two shelves and a counter near the back. As far as is seen, it appears to be a family owned business probably aimed at visitors and the needy. The room is empty apart from a couple customers and the woman behind the counter, with occasionally someone coming in or going out.

You take the opportunity to peak out onto the street, relatively small and filled with only a few dozen people. Still, no sign of either of the women following you, and you don't hear any running anywhere. You congratulate yourself and step back into the store.

Only to be met with five women, staring wide-eyed at you.

Suddenly, you feel someone behind you grab your arms and pull you back. You're caught off guard, and before you can find your footing two women pounce on your shoes. Pulling the footwear off, they begin reaching for your exposed feet.

You suddenly get a very bad feeling.

"Ladies? Please, what are you doheHEHAHAHA NOHOHOHAHAHAHAHA!" Laughter escapes your lips as nails glide up and down your arcs. The women, both dressed in noticeably unkempt clothing, each hold Your ankle with one hand and scratch your foot with the other. With the man behind you still holding your arms back, there is nothing you can do to dissuade them from tickling your helpless feet.

You barely notice as more women come towards you and reach for your trapped body. Fingers are suddenly squeezing your hips, dancing across your belly and sides, digging into your ribs, and softly scratching your underarms. Combined with your already intense foot tickling (their techniques are starting to vary: one women is scratching your heel and the other is exploring your toes), you can do nothing but break down in helpless laughter and squirm as much as you are able.

Noticeably drained, the edges of your vision begin to fade and air is reluctantly pulled into your lungs. You are on the verge of passing out, a merciful moment if there ever was one. Slowly but surely, you black out of the incessant tickling.

You wake, fully rested, to find...
143212.title: Little Shop of Tickling

1432122.content:
You wake with a start, looking around quickly to survey your surroundings. You're in some alleyway, devoid of any people. It's night, and you can see the street lamps lit around the corner on a main boulevard. You pull yourself back into the shadows behind some sacks, trying to make sense of what happened to you hours before. You rub yourself defensively, the intense tickling still vivid in your mind, your skin still practically tingling from the memory.

"What was that?" you say to yourself. "Has the town gone mad?" You think about what happened a step at a time. You put on the amulet, then suddenly some beggar woman began tickling you, then a rich woman, then finally five women in a shop. Was it the amulets fault? What is it's power? Somehow, putting the amulet on made everyone around you mad, wanting only to tickle you. Or maybe the effect is limited to women? And somehow the effect ends once you lose consciousness, the amulet falls off you somehow. You realize you need more information. You pocket the amulet carefully, wrapping it up in cloth and careful not to let it touch you as you walk out onto the street and consider your options.

You know someone in town you could talk to, a Forazian woman named Chella. She knows a little about enchanted things, and might be able to help explain what just happened to you. Knowing Chella, she'd be at the Curious Crow, a large decommissioned naval ship at the docks that now serves ale and lodgings instead of cannons and sails. You could even have her try it on and examine the effects. But this would mean telling her about your little mishap, which she'd be sure to find amusing. You're not sure you want to deal with her teasing.

Alternatively, you could just try putting on the amulet again. There are fewer people out now, and you'd likely be able to handle them better. You could also take off the amulet at the first sign of trouble. If you can, that is. You eye the main street, seeing no one walking around, but a few young beggar women huddled by a small fire in an adjacent alley. Mulling your options, you decide to...
1432122.title: Hours Later

14321221.content:
You decide that this amulet is more than you alone can handle, and that you'll need help if you want to figure out what's going on. You head to the docks, and the Curious Crow. The deck of the Crow is filled with outdoor tables, with a long bar running across the center. On a nice night like this, it's quite the location, and a number of tables are filled with patrons drinking and talking. Below decks are a number of rooms for simple lodgings, passed out drunks, and those seeking a more pleasurable endeavors.

You walk around the deck, finally spotting Chella alone at a table along starboard. She's sipping a drink and reading over some manuscript, inattentive to the world around her. Her complexion is common for Forazians: dark raven hair and sky blue eyes along with a tanned skin fitting for this southern city. Her hair is cut short at the neck, and falls around her face as she pours over her writings. A small pair adorn the bridge of her nose, and it seems a wonder that they stay on at all, but you're pretty sure she couldn't see a thing without them. A loose cloak is wrapped around her, entirely unnecessary for a warm night like this, but you're fairly certain it's to hide her attractive figure from lustful men at the bar. Also because you know she doesn't like wearing much underneath, and has never cared for the fashion conventions of the city. You can only imagine what she is or isn't wearing underneath that cloak tonight. Some ridiculous fashion from a long dead exotic kingdom, you guess.

"Chella" you say to her, getting her to look up with a start. "What's the fascinating papyrus tonight?" you ask her as you sit down, getting a mug of the local brew to sip on. Chella looks up at you, grinning at you familiarly but with a bit of a smirk. She knows you only come to her when you want something.

"Conjured silks of the Isle of Ja-o. I'm thinking of having some replicas made, although the silk wouldn't be magicked like it should. Not that I can figure out what they did it for, either. Not much is known about them, the island is completely deserted now. It actually sounds right up your alley, oh skilled adventurer. You should take me treasure hunting down there. All you need is a ship that can cross the southern sea."

You begin to reply, to change the topic to the amulet, but she does have a point. Maybe you should just toss the thing and hear more about her mysterious island?
14321221.title: The Curious Crow

143212211.content:
"Yes, I'm sure we'd have a great time. I'd be hacking through the jungle while you lay on the beach getting a nice tan, right?" You say to her with a smile, as she just grins back at you. "But you know I've got something for you, I always do. Take a look at this..." you tell her, getting the amulet out of your pocket, gesturing for her to be careful not to touch it.

"Wow, and just how did you get this?" Chella asks you knowingly, pushing up her glasses to get a closer look. "Hmm, I've never seen a gem like this before. The facets aren't cut in Forazian fashion, and it's not like in Coninze either... I have no idea where it's from! But I can tell it's enchanted somehow, at the very least because you won't let me touch it. What's the story?"

Taking a deep, reluctant breath, you tell her what happened to you today. You describe all those women tickling you, unable to escape until finally passing out. Chella, as you suspected, finds your story extremely amusing, and by the time your finished, she's grinning ear to ear at you, much to your chagrin.

"Hehe, so, my thief friend here can be foiled by a little tickling? Well, now I know how to persuade you to go along with my next scheme..." she tells you, wiggling her fingers in a mock tickle. "But I've never read about an amulet like this. There are some that control the mind of the wearer, like some kind of slave collar, but none that control everyone else's mind! This could be an incredible find!" Chella forgets about her teasing for a moment, lost in the possibility of understanding the strange thing you've stolen.

"Well, I have an idea about that. I want to try an experiment. We could go get a room below deck, and see what happens under more... controlled conditions." you tell her, and Chella nods enthusiastically, excited for the chance to see the magic in action. The two of you buy a room for the night and head below deck. You make sure to pick a fairly isolated room, so no one else might overhear hysterical laughter. The two of you enter the room, a fairly basic wooden chamber with a queen sized bed and little else. Still, it'll be more than sufficient for your purposes, as you lock the door to keep anyone else from entering and potentially falling under the amulet's spell.

"Ooh, locking the door? I didn't know you fancied me that way!" Chella jokes as she takes off her robe, hanging it on a hook on the wall. You look over at her and stare at her strange garb she was wearing underneath. Her top is a long sleeved, tight fitting black garment, sleeves down to her wrist. But unlike a shirt, it stops just below her bosom, clinging tightly to the underside of her breasts, and doing a marvelous job of accentuating them, despite being completely covered by the form fitting cloth. Her middle is completely bare, showing off a tanned stomach and alluring curves. Her bottom piece is little more than underwear, another tight fitting black cloth that hugs her hips and rear but does nothing to cover her legs.

"What?" She says defensively, noticing your stare. "This was what the Archons of the Hawan Empire wore five hundred years ago!" She tells you, not that the information means anything to you. "Anyway, let's get that amulet on you!" She says, moving towards you.

"Wait, wait! I was planning to have you put on the amulet, so I can see the effects on someone else!" you tell her. "I've already experienced the amulet!"

"What? Me? I'd... rather not. I think you'd be much better for it. It already likes you!" Chella says, nervously pushing her glasses up.

This only makes you grin at her. "Oh, I thought you said a little tickling was silly? Seems like you're just as ticklish as I am, huh?" You grin, glad to be able to tease her back for once.

"N-no, I'm not even ticklish!" She says, although the way she says it makes it hard to believe. "That's why it need to be you!" Chella wraps her arms around herself, and you notice her clothing would offer little protection against a determined tickler, if the amulet effects you. Still, maybe you should be nice and let her go. With her intellect and knowledge, she might be able to notice things you wouldn't. But do you really want to you through that again? Making a decision, you tell her...
143212211.title: Tell her about the amulet

choices: Being tied down to the bed. Revenge of Chella!
Chella has breakfast for the two of you and eager to find out more.
1432122111.content:
"Chella, I need you to put on the amulet." She opens her mouth as if to protest but you cut her off. "Look, you already said that it controlled the minds of the people around the amulet wearer, so things might get fuzzy anyway and you might not notice anything. Besides, with as smart as you are, you'll probably have an idea of where it comes from by observing how I act when you put it on."

Chella ponders this for a moment before sighing reluctantly. "Okay, I'm trusting you on this. I'll put on the amulet. With any luck, something about your behavior will give it away." She then holds out her hand, and you put the amulet in her open palm.

"Remember this. If the tickling does get too overbearing, try to get it off of you, okay?" She nods before securing the amulet around her neck. And that's when you black out.

~~~~~~~~

When you come to, you feel a bit hazy. You're sitting on the edge of the bed, and when you turn around, you get a big shock. There, with her hands bound to the bed posts, is Chella. All passed out. With the amulet resting on her belly. You quickly grab it and toss it on the nightstand before untying her and getting her into a better position. You curse your luck. You had hoped that while under the amulet's power, you'd be able to notice stuff. Maybe hear a voice or see an illusion telling you to tickle her, or being able to notice what's happening even if you can't control what's happening. Even just being a little fuzzy would have been nice. But a complete blackout? Dammit.

You hope that Chella noticed SOMETHING. Looking back at her and note that she seems to be deep asleep. She is also quite beautiful you observe with a big yawn. Guess you were more tired than you thought. Doing your best not to wake her, you remove her glasses and put them on the table with the amulet before climbing into bed and putting your arms around her, and smile as she snuggles in closer. With one last yawn, you drift back to sleep. You then wake to...
1432122111.title: What happened..?

choices: "I'm in... But I need a little more incentive."
143212212.content:
You were about to pull out the amulet but it's suddenly old news- this is far more interesting. "Just a ship, huh?" You ask with a raised eyebrow and a wry grin. "Is it really that simple Chella?"

Not that you don't trust her but- it's just that Chella has a habit of telling half-truths and not being completely accurate with her research. Remember that time in the mountains stealing abandoned snow-dragon eggs? Tickle dragons. And two angry parents. Or the time you were in Dormduo after a long lost treasure, "just behind these cobwebs?" An Arachne called Phoebe with a less than healthy obsession with tickling. For both her mental state and your ribs.

"Yes! I mean there's actually crossing the Southern Sea- and I don't know what exactly it is we'll find when we get there- not for certain but-"

"So it's not that simple?" Chella opens her mouth to say something then thinks better of it. Sheepishly she shakes her head. The first obstacle is getting a ship. Hiring a crew is way out of your price range- Chella's too most likely. But stealing a boat...

Then there's crossing the sea. You stole a book on the world's oceans once. The South Sea got a mention. And it convinced you not to go anywhere near the water again. Pirates, sirens, sea witches, harpies, sea monsters- the list goes on. The tropical corals and reefs might be worth the risk for some people but you- not so much.

The island itself is a worry. Chella's knowledge comes from scrolls that look years old which means years out of date. For all you know it could be home to fleet Coninzine marines now- which reminds you that your bounty there is still ten thousand crowns. Queen Catherine obviously hasn't seen the funny side to that little heist yet.

"How much do you know about this Jayo place anyway?"

"Ja-o. For two hundred years a small cult of spell casters lived there. Amongst other things they used the silk of dragon moth larvae to weave these enchanted silks and-"

"Enchanted how?" You interrupt.

"They granted some sort of power to the wearer. Invisibility, magical protection, the power to see in the dark, just stereotypical things." You lean forward slightly more interested than before. "Then twenty years ago they all disappeared and only a few have been back to the island since."

"Uh-huh." You nod expecting the worst. "And what happened to them?"

"Some reported strange visions, some remembered nothing and others nothing out of the ordinary. They came back if that's what you're worried about."

"And these wizards are just- gone? 'So long world feel free to take are stuff' gone?"

Chella nodded. "So far as all the scholars believe."

"And what's there now that has been looted?" You ask dropping the million septim question.

"Oh the looms were too big to move and couldn't be disassembled because of a spell the cult members cast. I can make them work though I can 't replicate their properties- I am convinced the way to do so is still on the island though."

"You sounded just as certain in Dormduo." You say. Chella smirks then quickly covers her mouth. "Yes. I was probably right. We never got to the end of the ruins."

"Maybe we should have asked the spider woman." You say sarcastically. "Please Miss Arachne- could you check to see if there aren't just a few ancient mythical times back there?"

"If nothing else it was a fascinating insight into the psychology of the arachne as a species." Funny because you didn't. And you might have been a bit lightheaded but Chella didn't seem to get a chance to have an insight into anything beyond the effects of arachne nails on the naked human body.

So a trip to Ja-o island? Everything screams no but something inside you- call it the spirit of adventure or whatever- says yes. Then there's the part of you that says, "What do I get out of this?"

"A free item of Ja-o crafted silk wear and whatever else I have that I can give in gratitude." Funny- she'd said those exact words before and you were just as broke then as you are now. But hey. Maybe some time away might make the traders and merchants drop their guard for your return.

"Ok." You say finally.
143212212.title: So about this island?

1432122121.content:
"Excellent!" Chella beams throwing her arms around you and almost making you drop your drink. "I knew I could depend on my thief."

You quickly look around to make sure nobody heard that. Fortunately the few who did are known pickpockets and thieves anyway- not that that stops one from snickering at you. You shoot a rude gesture at him before turning back to Chella.

"So step 1- ship, crew, supplies. Are you making them all a silk scarf?"

In true Chella fashion she simply hand waves your suggestion. "We don't need anything but a ship." She declares so certainly of herself you have to wonder if she heard you properly.

"Supplies, food, fresh water? We don't need any of the above. I mean I'm just a mere mortal but..."

"I mean the ship I want is no ordinary ship." Chella points out over the harbor and directs your gaze to a green-sailed ship with a dragon roaring on the bow. "That ship there, the Greenscale, just arrived yesterday. It belongs to a northern merchant. And it's enchanted- it will sail itself to wherever you desire."

Huh. That so? You take a second to ponder how convenient that is and how easy something like that makes life- especially for lazy writers. "We still need food and fresh water." You begin to say before Chella stops you with a raised hand. "Magical parlor?" You ask.

"Of course not. Don't be silly." Of course. However could you be so silly? "He's been stocking up on provisions- he sets sail tomorrow at dawn."

"How do you know all that?" You ask suspiciously. Chella just shakes her head and taps her nose mischievously. "I have my sources."

It occurs to you that Chella must have been expecting you to drop by and have precisely this conversation and precisely this answer. She was certainly leaving a lot to chance- and screwing up the pacing

"The hardest part'll be getting past the guards. There's two on the dock and one on the boat. Sounds like light security but they're all his hand picked troops. "Fighting them won't end well."

You look across the harbor to see the two armored men on the dock. No sign of the third- must be below. They both wear heavy plate armor and even from here you can see their red faces sweltering in the heavy. You don't know whether to feel sorry for them or laugh at their stupidity. But still- they look mean enough. Chella's right on that.

"Don't sweat it." You grin. "I just have to...
1432122121.title: Chella's plan

choices: Straight to Ja-o, past the Siren Den.
West, through Great Southern Harpy territory.
14321221211.content:
"Only two guards on the deck?" You ask dismissively. "No sweat. Stand back and watch a pro at work, Chella. No one can resist my feminine wiles." Chella just grins and rolls her eyes at you as you head towards the deck. You don't try to be sneaky at all, in fact quite the opposite. You head straight for the guards on deck, waving at both of the heavily plated patrolmen.

"Hello!" You call out loudly. "Could you men help me?" Both guards slowly walk their way towards you, and you get a better look at them. They're from some northern country, their skin is fairer than yours, making them stand out even more than you in swarthy New Forazio. They're sweating quite a bit in the still night air, clearly not used to the southern heat. Aside from being excessively armored, they don't seem too threatening. "I'm new here, and these Forazian docks go on for hundreds of paces! Could you fellows give me some directions?" You say, trying to make your voice sound as sweet and innocent as possible.

"Look, miss." Says one of the guards, now standing shoulder to shoulder on the gang plank, passively but clearly barring entry to the deck. "We've sailed here from farther north than you've ever been, so how in the six skies do you think w-!" The guard abruptly cuts off as you deftly take a small pouch from your belt and toss it at the guards, smacking one in the shoulder. Instantly, a cloud of dust rises from the point of contact as the pouch loses some of its contents. You're careful to hold your breath and not breathe in a whiff of it, but the panting foreigners aren't able to react in time. They only have a moment to take on a stern expression before their muscles soften, and they both slump heavily to the deck, beginning to snore loudly.

"Nice work." Chella applauds with a soft clapping. "What is that stuff?" You carefully pick up the pouch and tie it shut in just the right way before looping it back on your belt.

"Sidhe powder." You reply. "Hard to come by, but it'll put a human to sleep in seconds. Too bad it doesn't work on supernatural creatures. Learned that the hard way when I ran into that mimic…" A shiver ran up your spine as you recalled how an exact replica of you tied you up, tickled you for an hour, then made off with all your cash. Somehow being you made it know exactly where to tickle you too… "Anyway, help me drag these guys onto a lifeboat, and then we can gang up on the one below deck."

"Actually, how about you do all the heavy lifting, and I'll take care of the last guard?" Chella replies coolly. You arch your eyebrow curiously, Chella always said she was a lover, not a fighter. At the very least, she's infinitely better with a nigh unreadable tome than a simple short sword. But you shrug and let her go as you slowly drag the heavy bodies to the nearest life boat, thankful for the concealing darkness of night. By the time dawn comes and these guards wake up, you'll both be miles at sea!

By the time you've placed the guards in the lifeboat, you notice Chella at the stairs with the last guard, dragging the unconscious man up the stairs. "Hey, we agreed you'd do the heavy lifting!" She says in a strained voice, and you hurry to help her carry the last guard to the boat. You give her an extra inquisitive look, wondering how she took care of him so easily, but Chella merely bats her blue eyes at you mysteriously. "A girl's gotta have a few secrets, right?" The two of you lower the lifeboat into the harbor, freeing you of the three sleeping guards. Step one; get boat? Done.

"Y'know Chella, it's a bit late to be saying this, but are you sure about this? Once those guards wake up, our faces will be on wanted posters all over the city. We won't be coming back to Forazian territory anytime soon. Another bounty isn't a big deal to me, but you grew up here."

Chella shrugs, "I've actually been thinking about leaving here for a while, and this is the perfect opportunity to do it in style. Besides, you don't think I have a plan? After we plunder Ja-o of its secrets, we'll head back across the southern sea. But this time, we'll make port in Uzien, not New Forazio. Since the Forazians trade heavily with Rylestia, and Uzien has an alliance with Coninze, I don't think the Uzien guards will care if we're pirating a rival's trade ships." Chella notices the look on your face when she mentions Coninze. "And don't worry, Uzien's treaty with Coninze doesn't apply to bounties. I remember the story about your little heist from the royal palace. I'm sure Queen Catherine would love to get her hands on you.

"Besides." Chella continues. "Uzien is perfect for our needs: with its geography in the river delta, housing is ungodly expensive, but we have a whole merchant ship to live on now! And there's a high market for soft things in Uzien: silks, exotic down feathers… we might even sell our stuff to the Duchess herself! I hear she's even more beautiful than Queen Catherine, which you'll have to be the judge I suppose…" Chella nudges you in the ribs playfully, earning a yelp of protest as you bat her hand away. "And it's a major port where a certain thieving companion of mine doesn't have a bounty. So if you can keep your nose clean we can set up base there. I might even be able to get a position at the Great Library of Uzien, which'd give me enough tomes to give us adventures for the rest of our lives!"

You hold up your hands to stop Chella before she keeps going. The politics is making your head spin, and you don't need any more of a lesson on how great Uzien is. "Alright, alright! I'll leave the planning to you, Chella. But first things first, how are we getting to Ja-o? The southern seas are supposed to be full of monsters and who knows what. You're not just going to point the ship straight at the island are you?"

"Well…" Chella says slowly, making you think that's exactly her plan. "That would be the fastest route. The only obstacle on the way there is a Siren's den. But I figured since this ship pilots itself, it doesn't matter if we hear the siren song, the ship will just keep going until we're out of ear shot!" You give Chella a dubious look. No one can resist a siren's call, and their hypnotic voice has gotten sailors to do all manner of unwise behavior. Although if the whole sea is dangerous, maybe the straight shot has its merits. Its true the ship does steer itself magically.

"But if you really want alternatives, we could detour west. That avoids the Siren Den, and isn't too much longer, but does put us in the territory of the Great Southern Harpy. It's apparently a larger and more intelligent species than its northern sisters. But harpies aren't so bad, remember when we ran into the Coninzian red harpy?" You do remember, and it reminds you just how ticklish harpy feathers are, and how damnably curious the bird-women can be when they find a human in their territory.

"And if you really want to play it safe, we could steer east. That'd be a much longer trip, but we'd avoid sirens and harpies. We would be passing through the mermaid waters, but everything I've heard about the mermaids of the southern sea is that they don't harm humans. They seem to delay travelers, but there are no reports of anyone being harmed. It's the longest but easiest route. So, partner in crime, where do we steer the boat?"
14321221211.title: Feminine Charm

choices: It's plain sailing all the way to the harpies' waters.
Turns out, magical ships have magical anti-theft devices.
143212212112.content:
Passing within spitting distance of the siren's den is just asking for all kinds of trouble- self-steering ship or not. On the other hand though, minimizing the time at sea sounds like a good idea given the nature of the waters.

"West it is." You decide. As soon as you say it the ship seems to jolt underneath your feet and you and Chella grab each other before either of you can fall over.

"West it is." Chella repeats with a short laugh as the ship begins it's voyage.

Sooo- harpies. Thinking back to last time, you can't help but feel a phantom tingling on your skin. Regardless of where they touched or how heavy or light the contact was, or even if it was accidental, harpy feathers could reduce anyone to a giggling wreck. As you had found out at the hands of the Coninzian harpies. The flip-side to this was that your current outfit afforded slightly more protection than the skimpy garments Chella had called a disguise last time. Consisting mainly of dark leather, pants and boots keep your lower body safe, whilst a jacket conceals most of your torso. Granted, your jacket and pants waistband don't quite meet and expose some skin around your center- well everything from the top of your hips to your lowest rib. That and underneath the jacket, your only line of defense is a bandeau top which means your front is slightly more exposed than you'd like in the circumstances. But still- better than last time.

And better than- whatever Chella's wearing. "Archonwear of the Hawan Empire. The height of fashion five hundred years ago." She announces when you shoot her a questioning look as the two of you make your way to the bow and the wind blows at her cloak, giving you a view of her alluring and scantily clad form underneath.

"Riiiiight." You say with folded arms and a skeptical expression. "And given your oh so vast knowledge of harpies are you sure that's wise?"

She chuckles and looks out over the dark waves as the ship clears the harbor and ventures out into the open ocean. "An odd question from my little thief who possesses first hand knowledge of harpy interaction- yet forgets how much her tummy shows." Chella counters. Her fingers dart out to wriggle over your midriff as she does so and you jump back with a shriek and giggles. "Perhaps some endurance training is in order?" She suggests with a sly grin. "Never mind the harpies imagine if Queen Catherine's new tickler gets her hands on you."

"They'd need to catch me in the first place." You reply smugly-but keeping your distance from Chella's fingers.

Grinning, Chella leans forward on the bow of the ship as it ploughs on through the waves. Two cat-like leaps later and you too are posed dramatically, hanging from the rigging and looking out over the horizon as your jacket and hair flap in the sea breeze.

To the west. To Ja-o. To adventure.
143212212112.title: West to the harpies

choices: "Looks like one harpy for each of us. Easy, right?"
"Good luck Chella, I'm going back to bed!"
1432122121121.content:
The Greenscale pulls out of the harbor and into the open ocean, moving swiftly and quietly over the waves. You and Chella stand at the bow, the cool night breeze off the ocean wafting through your hair. As you head west out of port, you look behind you at the receding features of New Forazio. At the rate your new plundered ship is moving, the two of you should be able to outrun the Forazian ships, which tend towards the slow and well armored variety. By the looks of things, this magical boat could get you away from just about anything short of a Coninzian Corsair.

The two of you take turns on deck, watching the waves for pursuing ships or anything else dangerous. Despite how amazing the magical vessel appears, both of you decide to keep an eye on it just in case. Whoever isn’t on deck wandered back to the captain’s quarters, which happened to have a very nice king size bed, much nicer than the simple cots reserved for the sailors down below deck. You had gotten the last rest of the night, and noticed the sunlight coming in through the windows as Chella started shaking you awake.

“Hey, wake up sleepyhead.” Chella says to you softly as she shakes your shoulder. “The suns up, and it looks like smooth sailing. We should head below deck and check out what provisions we have.” It’s a very sensible idea, and one you’d tend to agree with. But you’d been up half the night stealing this ship and then making sure no one came after you, and the bed was really comfortable…

“Mm, five more minutes, Chella.” You mutter sleepily, trying to roll over. As you’re on your back, you feel Chella stop you as you’re on your back, grabbing your shoulder as she hops onto the bed next to you. It takes you a long, sleepy moment to realize what she’s doing, and remember that you threw your jacket on a nearby chair. “Wait, Chella…” you protest, to no avail.

“Looks like a certain little thief needs a wake-up call!” Chella tells you in a cheery voice, as her fingers descend to your bare belly. It’s certainly an effective wakeup call, as you open your eyes and let out a surprised giggle. You try to brings your hands up to protect yourself, but your sleepy reactions can’t match Chella’s wide awake ones. As you raise your arms, Chella skitters her nails up under them, teasing the exposed hollows with a playful scratching as she grins down at you. “If you want to stay in bed I suppose we could stay like this for a while…” Chella teases as she keeps curling her fingernails under your arms, wriggling a little faster in her encouragement.

“Hehehe ok! OK! I’m –hehehe- up!” you tell her, sitting up and shooing away her hands. Chella lets you up with a grin and lets you put on your jacket. Feeling better with at least some more protection from Chella’s fingers, the two of you head below deck to take stock of your supplies. Finding a good supply of dried fruit and nuts, you munch on them for breakfast as you wander past the supplies. The Greenscale was definitely fully stocked, you have salted meat, dried provisions, and potable water for months. At least for the two of you. You also notice more than one barrel of Forazian wine, and another filled with Rylestian firewater. “Well, this’ll be a good way to celebrate our new boat!” You muse, realizing drinks are on the house for some time.

“Careful,” Chella tells you with a wry grin. “Remember the last time we both had too much to drink?” You grunt in acknowledgement. You had successfully fenced some kind of jewel, and had wanted to celebrate. Next thing you remember you and Chella woke up in your underwear in a dryad’s glen, with the dryad none too happy with you. On the plus side, you learned that dryad sap is great for curing hangovers. On the other, it has the disastrous side effect of sensitizing skin.

“Well, there are no dryads out on the open ocean. Anyway, let’s get back above deck. Shouldn’t it be about time for us to swing south?” You ask, thinking that the ship has probably sailed clear of the siren’s den by now.

“I already turned us before coming to wake you.” Chella responds. “So we’re heading due south now, and at the rate this ship moves we should almost be in harpy territory by now.” The two of you get above deck, wanting to know about any harpies noticing your ship as soon as possible.

You grab an eyepiece and scan the sky, looking carefully for any harpies. For a moment, you start to think the two of you might get by un-noticed. But then you see them: two figures slowly flying northward, heading straight for you. You can see the long white wings and tanned skin of the southern harpies through the magnification, but they don’t seem to have noticed you yet.

“We’ve got two harpies.” You tell Chella, waiting anxiously next to you. “And they’ll see us any minute.” You try to think about what to do. It might make sense to have Chella hide below deck, and deal with the harpies yourself. At the very least, then only one of you would end up a ticklish mess. You’re pretty sure you could convince them this magic ship only needs you to pilot it, as that is true. Then again, misery does love company, and keeping Chella up here with you might come in handy. You’d only have to deal with one harpy each, at least. Or you could try to weasel your way out of this and make Chella deal with them, but you’re not sure that’ll go over well at all.
1432122121121.title: Smooth Sailing

choices: The harpies are curious about the ship.
Unfortunately they were looking for amusement.
14321221211211.content:
"Get below deck Chella." You say trying- and failing- to sound more confident than you actually feel.

"You don't have to-" She begins but you cut her off.

"No offense Chella, but your wardrobe isn't meant for harpies."

"Neither is yours!"

"I'm trying to play the hero here Chella." You sigh. Partly because of her stubbornness and partly because- why are you trying to play the hero here? "Just get down below deck before I tie you to a mast and sacrifice you to them."

Wisely, Chella nods and makes a dash below deck. Crap- part of you hoped she'd remember at least one favors she still owed you. But it's too late for that now. The harpies have spotted the ship and they adjust their course to meet you. And as Chella closes the hatch you're on your own.

This can only go well, right?

As little reassurance as they are you make sure the two daggers at your belt are present and easy to grasp if you need them. You make a point of taking the helm and looking the part of a sole captain without a crew. It's lacking a hat and anything that would make your attire anywhere near sailor like but it's the best you've got- besides improv is your thing. That's how you got the amulet in the fir-

The amulet.

Yesterday's brief frenzy seems a decade ago but you recall it in detail and suddenly remember the amulet inside your jacket pocket. You feel the bulge within your clothing and the clink of the chain. An idea forms in your mind as you consider your options. Nothing solid- just a vague idea that tugs one side of your mouth into a wry smile.

Flapping wings over the flapping sails reach your ears and you look up to see the two, scarily large harpies soar overhead. Their wings are massive and their bodies tower well over you- easily twice as tall even. They watch you as they circle scanning the rest of the ship for signs of any other life. When they find none they descend.

"Morning." You smile as the two land on the quarterdeck behind you.

"Fair winds to you human." The taller of the two greets you. Both could be described as pretty and both look youngish- it's always hard to tell with spell-casters and non-humans. Neither wears particularly much either in fitting with harpy culture and the temperature round here- even the morning sun is quickly warming.

"Tell us pretty little human." The shorter one says. "Are you alone on this ship."

"Yep- just me. I prefer the solitude." You lie without hesitation. "Especially on a beautiful day like today." The harpies exchange a look that you can't quite gage the intent behind.

"Yess. A beautiful day indeed..."
14321221211211.title: What we do for friends

choices: You manage to get the amulet out of your pocket!
Before you can act, the harpies literally tickle the pants off you.
Chella comes on the deck, to the... rescue?
143212212112112.content:
"But on a beautiful day like today…" the shorter harpy says, as both of them slowly saunter towards you. "Aren't you just a bit lonely for company?" As they move closer you examine their features more closely. You weren't expecting these Great Southern Harpies to be so… tall. Chella really should have mentioned that fact to you, something you'll have to remind her about sooner or later. The 'shorter one' is about twice your height, and the taller one is about a head above her! But it's all the same you didn't know, as there's no way Chella could've taken on one of these big birds had she stayed. Nor you, for that matter… as you realize your daggers are completely useless against an enemy of this size. You'll have to use cunning, not force.

Their bird features begin just above the knee, transitioning from the smooth skin of a human thigh to feather and scale of bird feet, which you note are webbed, befitting a seabird. Their skins are tanned a pale milk chocolate color that contrasts with the white feathers. You note that they'd be attractive women were they human: their forms are thin and graceful, with gentle swelling of curves at the hip and breast. While their breasts aren't large considering their size, for a normal human like you their bosoms are impressive nonetheless. The harpies wear little, similar to their northern kin. A loincloth covers their nether-regions, and their tops are covered by a thin wrap that does little but cover the essential parts. As with their legs, their arms fade to bird wing at the bicep, transitioning into immensely long wings able to propel them across oceans. Their 'hair' seems like shoulder length wispy feathers that almost resemble the real thing, white like the rest. Their faces make them appear as young, pretty women with deep red eyes that look at you curiously.

You stop examining them when you realize they're standing right before you, waiting for an answer to their question. "Lonely?" you ask. "Oh no, I'd rather be alone. Gives me time to think and appreciate the view!" You say, although as you expect it does little to discourage them from getting closer.

"Really?" the taller one asks you. "Wouldn't it be better to have company to appreciate the view?" As she asks this question, her wing reaches out as if innocently stretching. But the tips of the long wing manage to lightly graze your side. It all looks perfectly accidental, but you're positive she knows what she's doing. But you can't help but flinch as you feel those tickly harpy feathers run against the bare skin of your side.

"I agree, Axa." The shorter one replies, as her wing also reaches out in the same casual manner to stroke along your other side. It's even harder to control yourself from this second contact, and as the feathers barely make contact with your other side you twitch noticeably and take a step back. "More fun to spend the time together, chat… have a few laughs?" The harpy gives you a questioning look, and while you all know where this is going, the harpies seem to be enjoying this prolonged game.

"W-what?" You stutter, trying not to let any sign of laughter pass your lips. "No, sorry. I much prefer to spend my time in seriousness and solitude!" You say, trying feebly to dissuade the harpies from what you know is coming, or at least delay it as long as possible. You're sure Chella can hear every word of what's happening, maybe even watching through a peephole. You can only imagine the teasing she'll give you once this is all over.

"Do you hear that, Nafi?" The taller one, Axa, tells her companion. "To be so serious and alone? That won't do at all, pretty little human. You need to relax, enjoy yourself! Smile and laugh!" Axa tells you, her eyes glittering with a sense of play, as her wingtips brush against your side, much more deliberately this time. As the feathers drag along your skin, your belly sucks in and you let out a surprised yelp and try to move away…

…which only brings you closer to Nafi, who wiggles her wings against you more firmly as well, dragging the feathers down from your ribs down to your hip. You can't help but snicker and squirm in obvious ticklishness, which causes both harpies to smile broadly. "Yes, yes! Smile and laugh, pretty thing! Let us help you relax all that tension you seem to have!"

You try to protest, but Axa's feathers start to stroke along your belly, midway between your side and navel, running right along the line between inner and outer abs. Instead of making a coherent reply, you splutter as snickering laughter overtakes you despite your best efforts to contain it. Even the gentlest touch of a harpy's feather is irresistibly ticklish, and if anything these southern harpy feathers are even worse then the ones you've felt before. The touch along your tummy makes it flutter and your breath catch, all the more impressive for how light the contact is.

"Mmhmm, let us keep you company and entertain you for today, human!" Axa tells you in a playful voice that brooks no dissent. You curse internally at the thought of spending all day or more with these harpies. You're not sure you could take it! Axa and Nafi press closer to you, now caught between these two voluptuous forms. Axa continues to brush her feathers over your belly and side, causing you to recoil into Nafi, who grins as you press against her bare taut belly.

"Why Axa, I think this pretty little human is ticklish! Look how much she giggles from our feathers!" Nafi says, reaching around you to drag her wings against your exposed lower back. It makes you arch and squeal girlishly before starting to giggle, the soft feather strokes over your back teasing you into a ticklish haze. But as you do so you only stretch out your stomach more invitingly for Axa, who grazes her feathers across your belly in a wide sweep that sends you into even louder laughter. They make you wiggle back and forth like this, slowly overwhelming you as they playfully tickle.

"Oh yes, a very ticklish human!" Axa agrees, as the two continue to play with your laughing form. "I think we'll all have a lot of fun today! But it's too bad she's so covered up… maybe we could convince her to remove some of those nasty clothes!" All you can do is groan through your laughter, as you feel feathers stroke all across your midsection. You can't even tell whether they belong to Axa or Nafi at this point, you're enveloped in their wings. Feathers stroking against your hip make you jump and laugh uproariously, only to bounce into more of them skittering against the small of your back, then still more dragging their tips along your waist line suggestively.

You realize if you don't do something soon, the harpies will be able to coerce you into just about anything, including stripping down for more tickling, just for a moment of reprieve. At the very least, there is something pleasant about the harpy feathers… the soft touch sending an electric tingle down your spine and making you ridiculously giddy. In a way, the harpies are right, there's almost something relaxing and fun about letting go and giggling yourself silly… but then you shake your mind clear of the thoughts. Perhaps its some magic in the harpy feathers that makes one start to crave it over time. You really do need to do something fast.

You remember the amulet in your pocket, and despite your ticklish haze get an idea. If you could just get that amulet to slip onto the floor, perhaps it would get the attention of the harpies! If you could get one of them to wear the thing, the spell might take hold. One harpy would turn against the other in a ticklish frenzy. It'd probably effect you too, but you'd enjoy the chance at payback, even if it was magically compelled of you. You're not positive the charm would work on harpies, but at this rate you have little to lose.
143212212112112.title: Unfortunately they were looking for amusement.

1432122121121122.content:
'I think you're right, Axa.' Nafi replies, her feathers stroking lower down your back. They swirl and dance circles right at the base of your spine, forcing you onto your tiptoes. You fall forwards, your balance failing as you giggle helplessly. Axa catches you, her feathered arms pushing themselves under your arms inside your jacket. The second they connect with your armpits you positively explode with laughter. Axa laughs with you, wiggling and pulsing her wings in place, the sensation unbearable. You automatically slam your arms down to your side, but it's absolutely useless. Her feathers remain in there, fluttering against your skin, torturing the hollows there. Your flight reflex tries to kick in, and you plant your heels, forcing yourself backwards. Of course, you make almost no headway as you smash back against Nafi's body. She doesn't even falter, and as you flatten yourself against her, she wraps her arms around your middle, her wings connecting with your sides as they stoke and tease the skin there.

You have absolutely no leverage now, and you're getting desperate. You need this to end. Axa's assault of your underarms is forcing deep laughter out of you, interspersed with giggles from Nafi's softer assault of your sides. You're just barely able to wiggle in defiance against Nafi's strong form, You're getting breathless, but it just won't stop.

'OKhahaha OK!' you scream, barely able to catch enough breathe to speak. The harpies make eye contact over your head, smiling as they slow down their assault. It doesn't stop completely, Nafi still wrapped around your middle, fluttering slowly along your sides, but Axa does one last wiggle before withdrawing her arms. Giggles won't stop tumbling out your mouth, but at least now you can breathe a little more.

'Little lonely girl, you are turning out to be most amusing, but this is only the tip of the iceberg. We can still have more fun. All we have to do, is get rid of these boots. Doesn't that sound like a good idea? Don't you want to have more fun?' her face is so close to yours, you can see her smiling eyes just above yours. You want to shake your head no, but you know that won't do any good. Maybe if you just go along with it, the whole thing will be over sooner. Yes, they will have their amusement, and then they will leave. Yes, that's an excellent plan. You nod your head, and Nafi loosens her grip infinitesimally around your waist. You've just enough leverage to bend over and start unlacing your boots. It’s fiddly, and they seem to think you’re taking too long. You feel gliding across your stretched back, tingling and tickling in it's wake. You squeal and bolt back upright. ‘Hurry, tickly girl. We don’t like to be made wait.’ You feel a shiver race down your spine and bend over again, attacking your laces with renewed energy. When you feel them loosen, you start to kick them off, but before you can, you feel a tingling on your back again. You rocket back up again, giggling from the residual feeling on your back. ‘You’ve just been too slow. Penalty. You’d better take those off too.’ Axa gestures to your trousers, and before you can refuse, Nafi’s feather’s flutter threateningly against your sides. Without any further prompting, you reach for the button and zip and push the lot down, kicking off your boots and letting the trousers fall to the floor. ‘Very good.’
1432122121121122.title: Before you can act, the harpies literally tickl...

14321221211211221.content:
Axa smiles down at you, her wings fluttering threateningly beside her, but she doesn't reach out for you. Yet. You suppose she needs't have too, with Nafi still clutching you from behind, feathers still for the moment but their contact still sends shivers down your spine.

'You know Nafi, there's something I haven't done for such a long time.' Axa says conversationally, stepping slightly closer so her feathers make contact with your leg, not enough to tickle but enough to raise goosebumps.

'What's that, Axa?' asked Nafi, leaning down so her breath ghosted across your neck. You try to lean forwards, but a rustle to your middle and sides send you slamming back with a chuckle.

'Hunted down my prey. Wouldn't that be fun?' She asked, looking you in the eye as a shiver runs down your spine that had nothing to do with the sensitive touches.

'Oh yes, let's play. Wouldn't you like to play with us?' This didn't sound good for you, but maybe it was the chance you'd been looking for to escape. But then where would you go in the middle of the ocean? No, you had to use this opportunity to come up with a plan. And implement it before their caught you. No pressure there then.

'What are the rules?' you asked, only to be answered with full blown laughter. Both harpies released their grip on you, walking round so both were stood in front of you. Leaning forward, Axa whispered 'run' in your ear, and you didn't have to be told twice. Your feet took off before your mind had even caught up enough to plan where you were supposed to be running to.

Hiding didn't seem like the best idea, so your legs took you across to the rigging and you immediately started to climb. The rope ladder was difficult, but clambering higher a sense of calm fell around you as no sounds of rustling wings started behind you. Until you'd reached the top, that is. Almost as if they knew what you'd been planning, two figures descended from the sky and you ducked quickly. Not fast enough, as two claws captured the jacket you wore and pulled you from your roost. Your arms wrenched up with the sleeves of the jacket and wings immediately latched on, vibrating in the hollows. Screaming laughter was pulled out of you as you squirmed in mid air. You didn't know who held you and who was tickling, but it didn't matter. They were merciless in their assault of your underarms, taking full advantage of your lack of ability to cover yourself. Looking down, you quickly realise you aren't too far from the ship and if you could just wriggle free, you could drop from your jacket, and that was the plan all along. You would have to give up your jacket, that extra layer of protection. Harpies were experts at this game, you didn't stand a chance, but you had to keep trying. You throw your weight down and out of the jacket, rolling when you hit the deck and taking off as fast as you could.
14321221211211221.title: Let's play a little game

14322.content: The amulet fits you quite well. Surprisingly so, in fact. If you knew a little bit more about magic you'd realize that most items have the ability to subtly reshape themselves to suit their owners, but you do not know this, and so you write it off as a minor coincidence. Amulet firmly attached, you head off to...
14322.title: Everyone is forced to obey your commands.

choices: To try looting the place. (Get caught/Get more money!)
Wait for Anastasia. (Have tea/ seduce her/ see the amulet work.)
Look around the house. (Meet people/ find secrets!)
1433.content:
"Oh, good sir/my lady!" The noble ran straight to you, smiling and looking incredibly relieved. "You found my amulet! The mistress Anastasia will be so happy!" He said, swiping it out of your hands. "I don't know how, but I must have dropped it. It's a precious family heirloom that needed to be re-enchanted for m'lady Anastasia." He explained.

You knew of the Lady Anastasia. She was about your age, and was incredibly sweet. She was the de facto ruler of this area, and a distant relative of the King of Rylestia. Many wished she were the Queen instead. While she was very cheery, she never seemed to ever laugh, which some found odd. "This amulet, I should tell you, is something she wears in private. I know it sounds silly, but it seems it's the only way to make her laugh. Her father owned it before he passed. Good sir/ fair lady, wherever did you find it?" He asked, grinning at you.

If he was talking about Anastasia, it told you he was King Jerris, her most faithful servant. He was almost as kind as Anastasia, but was sadly also rather naive, which explained why he so easily assumed you were a good Samaritan. You quickly told him you found it on the ground and was about to ask around if anyone had lost it. Knowing he wasn't THAT naive, you also admitted sheepishly that you did want some small reward upon returning it. He nodded his head and quickly dumped a small sack of gold in your palm. "Here, here! You deserve it! And more! Two hundred gold pieces simply isn't enough!" He said.

You nearly did a double take. Sure, that wasn't a lot for a rich person, but for a thief, they could live off this for two years! However, King continued. "I insist, good sir/ fair lady, that you come with me an accompany Anastasia and myself to tea." Anastasia was known for often letting the common people dine with her, no matter how poor, should they do a good deed. "And, even further, you may see it in action!" He said, indicating the amulet.

You couldn't believe your luck. Before you knew it, you were suddenly within Anastasia's lush, comfy housing. She tried to be as modest as possible; while the building was the largest in the city, it was only three floors and looked only slightly better than most buildings on the outside. The inside was a little less modest, with chandeliers and paintings, but by royalty standards, it was bare. You were quickly led into a sitting room by King. "Now then, feel free to walk around and see the sights, but please be here by tea time. If not, we'll have to look for you, you must understand." He said, leaving the room.

You decide...
1433.title: You're a stand up guy/gal!

144.content:
You look across the dazzling city of New Forazio, a place where traders come and sell goods, princes and princess come to dine on the cuisines and riches from around the world come and bask in the glory of the King and his royal family. You though are not here for all of this, you are here to steal it but where to start

The royal houses? These are where the King, his family, and other respectful dignities reside and place their valuable treasure. What about the Market Place? where traders and vendors sell all kinds of assortments from tools to slaves. Another place to steal from is the Museum of Natural Enjoyment with its female-majority staff. So where to......
144.title: There’s a new thief in town!

choices: She notices you in her mirror and pounces on you
You take the brooch and make towards the window
1441.content:
The Royal houses! Why settle for small coinage in the market when you can steal huge sums of money from rich nobles? You look towards the Silver District, named because of the large amounts of silver and precious metals contained in the houses there. You make a plan to sneak in that night.

Later that night you lie on the rooftop of a Royal house, and look for openings or other ways to get in. Suddenly seeing your luky break, you shimmy across a clothesline before silently dropping in through an open window and crouching. You seem to be in the dressing room of some rich woman, and you gape at the jewelry and gold surrounding you. Not wasting any time, you shove some rings and necklaces into you pockets. But then,hidden, you peek around a corner and see a woman sitting at an ornate dressing table. She is using a boar-bristle hairbrush to comb her hair and a powder puff to whiten her face, perhaps for a decadent late night party.

You're about to leave her when you see it! A massive, diamond-studded brooch hangs from her back pocket. You must have it. Taking slow, careful steps you make your way over to right behind you. You reach out and grab the pendant.

Then...
1441.title: Royal Houses

14411.content:
As you are about to take the brooch, She then notices your reflection in the mirror, and quickly turns and pounces on you, pinning you on the floor by sitting on your belly. As you take a few seconds to get your breath back,

"Aha! Trying to steal from me, you petty thief! Although, i didn't expect to meet such a ...
14411.title: She notices you in her mirror and pounces on you

choices: ..but since you've not been eating your spinach, you fail.
144111.content:
Well, you can't fault her observational powers. Your target can see that under your 'work clothes' of plain, sleeveless leather jerkin, black trousers and simple boots there is a swan. Under most circumstances, you'd appreciate that a woman of such refined taste had paid you a compliment. Unfortunately, you don't really have time to take it in when she has pinned you to the ground under her weight. If you don't act quickly, the only compliments that you'll be receiving will be from your guards.. or from the public when they put you in the pillory. You get the feeling that they will be a lot less kind and decide to act.

Reaching for your dagger, rope and other tools is out of the question. Reacting on pure instinct, you buck wildly and attempt to throw her off but your would-be target seems to have anticipated your maneuver, catching your flailing wrists and pins them to the ground. You seem to have messed with the wrong noblewoman. You thrash around wildly, trying to free your hands, but she merely shifts her weight a little and keeps you trapped.

"Get off me! Don't make me hurt y-" Your empty threat is cut-off by your least favorite sound in the world: the shrill sound of a noblewoman screaming for the guards.

"Guards, Guards! Thief! Help me!" She sounds dainty and helpless, as if she's not just easily subdued you. The noblewoman leans closer to you, as you caught her while she was changing, her long hair slips loose and brushes against your face. She fixes you with an possessive, sadistic expression. The expression seems to go with her whitened face, creating a very chilling effect.

"It is such a shame that someone so pretty can act so brutish and rude. You will never get ahead that way, little thief." Her tone is sweet and condescending, with a strong hint of menace behind it. "You will not have to worry, though. Once you are all snug in the dungeons, I will be sure to personally educate you in manners.."

Being the smart sort of rogue, you determine that her terrifying stare and sinister tone indicate that these aren't the sort of lessons you should be enthusiastic about taking. You can hear the guards storming towards the room and you know that if they get there, you're in for one hell of a schooling. You muster one final, heroic burst of strength and make a desperate attempt to throw her off...!
144111.title: Beautiful Lady!

choices: She gently teases your neck and feet with her fingers
She goes to retrieve a tool and begin seriously punishing you
1441111.content:
More of your captor's hair brushes against your face as she forcibly pins you down once again, her piercing stare becoming even more sadistic. You'd never have thought you'd be grateful for a scrum of guards but you can deal with being roughly apprehended more than the noblewoman's frightening gaze. She releases your wrists, only for one of a dozen guards to take over. You're almost dragged out from under her and roughly pulled up to your feet. Your would-be victim takes a few paces back, regarding the whole spectacle with a smirk as you are almost lifted off your feet by the armored men-at-arms holding your upper arms. You swear and thrash, but there are at least four of them holding you tightly.

"Lady Reanna ! Are you hurt?!" One of them asks urgently, while his comrades fan out across the room, hands on their swords as if assassins might leap out from one of drawers any at any second. You are roughly frisked, your blade, rope and jewelry haul are quickly seized.

"No.. thank you.. you got here just in time.. this terrible woman would have robbed me.." She has affected a fragile tone, as if the experience of subduing you with comical ease was particularly traumatic. "Make sure she is bound tight! If she gets loose she could throttle me in an instant.. she has the eyes of a madwoman!"

This Reanna seems particularly theatrical. The guards handling you seem to be skeptical, casting glances at one another but all seem to be too afraid to say anything. You realize that she's been staring at you, perhaps the entire time, with a predatory expression. The guards comply, tightly binding your wrists with your own rope.

"Elbows, thighs, knees and ankles. She's not to be able to move." She seems to break character to bark an order, her voice snaps like a whip. Their is a brief and terrible pause, before you are forced to the floor. They comply with her order, tightly binding together all the areas she named. In order. As the guards begin to tie your ankles, you hear her icy voice once again "Boots."

The noblewoman is only young, in her mid-twenties you'd guess, and rather small. However, she is able to radiate a particularly terrifying presence. The guards quickly remove your boots, and you feel the air against your bare feet as your ankles are tied together, then connected to your wrists in a firm hogtie. The guards quickly back off, leaving you helpless, able to do nothing but squirm.

Lady Reanna affects that damsel-in-distress wounded tone of voice once again as your struggle futility on the ground. "I..think I want to interrogate her personally.. please post sentries in the hallway and on the perimeter. You will have to tell the guests that I shall be late.. I know it is dangerous but.. I have to know why this woman would want to hurt me.."

It becomes clear to you that you have messed with the wrong noblewoman. Even her own guards seem to be afraid of her, immediately following her orders, going along with her little game and too scared to challenge. Her guards file out and your heart sinks as you are left alone with her.

You're too frightened to speak as she sits down beside you and begins running her fingers through your hair. She idly traces her manicured fingernail along your neck and you flinch with the ticklish sensation.

"Now, we begin our first lesson in manners."
1441111.title: ..but since you've not been eating your spi...

choices: Leaned forward and straddled you, facing your feet
Dug her hands into your sides
14411111.content:
"A girl as pretty as you..." She accentuates her remark with a poke in your neck, causing you to squirm. "Must be taught to appreciate your gifts" Reanna accompanies this with a nail along the side of your heel, your ankles pulling at your wrists. You dare not even look at her. "You clearly will not do yourself justice, given your life as a common thief."

Her cold tone has softened slightly, as if you had somehow pleased her. Your mind raced with thoughts of why exactly she would keep you like this, rather than throwing you in the dungeon. You strained your head slightly, hoping to watch her without being noticed, holding yourself deathly still.

"Take your feet for example." Her eyes turn toward you briefly to acknowledge yours. Her stare is hard. "They're awfully pink. You've clearly been on them."Reanna continued by dragging two nails down your heel causing you to bite your lip. "That will not do."

Her eyes turn back toward your feet. Her mouth turns a wide grin in turn with her eyes as if she's fully taking in the situation. " A beautiful girl like you...must be taught responsibility" Reanna spoke with disturbing conviction.

Your blood ran cold. It became clear she had your boots removed for more than just preventing you from getting away. You DEFINITELY crossed the wrong noblewoman, one who had far more than a passing interest in your bare feet. You hadn't been really been tickled before, but Reanna' s touches made it clear you were sensitive.
