151111.content:
You wake up slowly, feeling as though you've been asleep for days. Perhaps you have, it's impossible to tell. Cracking open your eyes, you find yourself in a dimly lit room. Sunlight is coming in from farther away, but just enough to see. You can't tell what time it is other than daytime. The next thing you realize is that almost all of your clothing has been removed. Clad only in your undergarments, you feel some kind of fine wool blanket underneath you. You would expect to be cold like this, with no blanket to cover you, just one below. But something large and warm is pressed against you…

A snow harpy. Now you remember. Opening your eyes fully, you see white wings in front of you, wrapping you in a gentle embrace. That warm feeling is a harpy cuddling against you, spooning your sleeping form. Obviously, the larger creature would be the big spoon. Her skin is quite warm, enough to keep you comfortable despite the arctic conditions. You can feel her form pressed against yours, her bare chest pressed against your back… ah, now that's a sensation you can't easily ignore. The harpy's soft, warm breasts, which given her Amazonian stature feel quite large to you, rub against your back.

You try to wriggle your way out of her grip without waking her. However, that's easier said than done. Even asleep, those large, feathery arms are still stronger than your own. Slowly inching your way out, the harpy stirs in her sleep, and with a sleepy mutter her grip on you shifts. In doing so, the feathery wings brush along your front. The feel of those feathers against your bare stomach causes you to flinch and catch your breath. It tickles! You try to remain motionless for a minute to maintain your composure. You knew you were ticklish, but you were sure it wasn't that bad! That absent minded little stroke almost made you laugh out loud. You try not to think about what the harpy could do if she tried to tickle you.

"Mmm. Finally awake, little one?" The harpy hugging you says sleepily. Apparently your efforts to get out of her grasp undetected were a failure. "You were asleep for some time, through the day and the night. I am the second to share a bed with you." She says, and gently let's you out of her grip. Sitting up, you turn around to look at the harpy as she stretches lazily. She's not the one who rescued you, you can tell that much. This one is shorter, although still around eight feet tall. Her 'hair' and feathers aren't just white, but also speckled with little black spots. Her skin is also a deeper shade of blue than the harpy from before, and you notice a bit of freckles on her face and chest. Which also reminds you of the fact that her only clothing right now is a pair of fur lined shorts. Her firm breasts hand tantalizingly in the air as she stretches, and impossible not to stare.

You shake your head to clear your thoughts. "Where are my clothes? And what am I doing here?" you ask her, getting straight to the point. The harpy grins at you, and you note that she seems younger than the first one. If she were a normal human woman, you'd say she'd be in her early 20's. But you can't say how old she actually is. For all you know, she could be 100.

"Your tattered coverings? Those won't do you much good anymore. I'm surprised you made it as high up the mountains as you did with them." She tells you. You begin to wonder what you're going to do about clothing, but she continues. "And Zriya saved your life. Which means you belong to our flock now! You'll help us do things only hands can do, and we'll take care of you!" The harpy continues happily.

You groan, your world swimming. You're property of this harpy clan? This trip hasn't gone at all like you expected. The shock of it makes you feel light-headed, and reminds you that you can't even remember the last time you've eaten. You feel yourself falling over-

Her warm skin feels so nice against your own, and you notice your face is pressed against her large and irresistible bosom. Perhaps your predicament isn't as bad as you originally thought. Another distraction also presents itself, as you notice her feathers brushing against your bare back. Each little movement brings with it a new ticklish feeling, each stronger than the last. You can't help but start to grin. If you stay in this embrace too long, it might tickle beyond your ability to keep your composure.

You awaken with a shiver and find yourself upside down!

You are hanging in the middle of a small, ice-walled cell, by a solid set of well-rusted manacles.Another set of similar manacles clasp your wrists, anchoring you to the snow-strewn floor.

Tugging mildly at your wrist cuffs coaxes a deep, gurgling growl from somewhere nearby. You gulp nervously as you notice the cell in which you find yourself is strewn with all manner of gore and carnage: severed limbs, splintered bones, iced over pools of blood.

You manage a sharp squeal of terror as a towering, thickly hirsute creature shambles into view: a yeti! The massive beast cocks its head at you and sniffs the air, its thick black lips parting over rows of glistening, red-stained teeth.

But then you hear a lilting unmistakably feminine voice: "Well then, is our guest awake now?"

You stare at the hulking monster, momentarily nonplussed, when a gorgeous, impossibly pale woman steps from behind the yeti, stroking the fur of its shoulder with a strange familiarity.

The woman is gorgeous, tall and well-shaped, with strong cheekbones and copper-hued eyes. Her long white hair falls in loose ringlets well past her shoulders and she wears a terrifically impractical, gold flecked corset - open at the front clear to her stomach - and a long, opalescent cloak. Her tall, silver-heeled boots clack on the icy floor and her ample breasts bounce invitingly as she walks into the cell.

"You don't look like one of those dour northerners." She says, circling your body inquisitively. "I wonder what would bring an outlander so far into the mountains."

She pauses momentarily, thinking with her hand on her chin.

"Ah, some sort of crude assassin for those scheming princes, no doubt. Here for coin, without a conscience to speak of."

She narrows her eyes at you and you are about to speak when she continues: "I respect that, of course. But I have no need of assassins."

She kneels in front of you and places her hands at your sides, just below your ribs and begins slowly and expertly spidering her fingers up your torso.

The woman smiles evilly and begins tickling you in earnest, moving her hands slowly toward your incredibly sensitive, and totally helpless, underarms, watching you closely for your reaction. You are extremely tickling and this treatment is unbearable!

15122111112111.content:
As you prepare to tickle even more, a thought comes to you. "You said I could ask whatever I wanted, right?" You asked the woman, curious about something. She looked at you, a seductive smirk on her face.
"So long as you work it out of me. I'm very tight lipped and it's hard to get information out of me. But I'll give you an answer for free, this time." She explained.
Shrugging, you decide to ask the obvious question. "I've annoyed your yeti. I've made my capture incredibly difficult for you. We've been one upping each other for at least an hour or two. So...why do you want me to do this to you? Isn't this the equivalent of giving in?" You ask her.
"I remind you who has ice around their neck. No, I'm in control here. I just...I like your ingenuity. You're not an idiot. At this point, most people either escaped, only for me to have my yeti quiet them, or they were already eaten. You weren't. You kept pulling new tricks. And honestly, that's rather impressive. I think little of many people, but I know when there's someone who deserves slight respect. In all honesty, if you were to bind me enough, I'd still be able to stop you if I didn't want you to escape. There are few in this region with magic as great as mine. The Castle proper has SOME magicians who could stand up to me, and there's the outpost with that Edea woman...But not many mages match my skill. So I don't feel threatened at all. That being said, if you were to give me a good time, I might give you a choice on whether you can leave or stay." She said.
"It might please you to know I don't believe you to be working with the princes anymore. No, they'd be less subtle about wanting me dead. I know secrets about them that no one else does. I should: I'm not exactly human, and have lived...longer than most, though by your scale of time, I'd be in my....mid-twenties, I'd think. As a matter of fact, I do believe I could be of much aid to you if you make it worth my while. Arcane magic to teach, frozen friends, help going through the mountain..." She offered, waving her hand. "That being said, though, I believe I've answered your question."

He's a sweet Yeti...but he isn't what I always want, you know? You are a son/daughter of man, much like myself. I can relate to you. As powerful as I am, the country hates me because of horrid rumors spread about me. I could kill many of my opponents, but there's a reason I only send Cedric to eat more...recent villages. I...I know these people. Well, I knew their grandparents. I can't bring myself to kill old citizens, but people such as yourself, new to the territory...well, you almost got eaten. But you prevailed, and now...I'd like human interaction of the more...physical kind." She blushes further. "I mean not sex! That's rather extreme, but...I've always wanted to submit a bit. You look at her, processing all she just said. "...Wait, you're a-"
"Of course there are legends. The sickly King's Grandmother, the last Queen...she had a sister who was not born normal but one day disappeared as a child. Her name was Hilda, and she was said to grow slowly due to her magic. It was the indication she'd be a mage of awesome power in adulthood, but still, she'd grow at only a fourth of how normal humans would. Hilda didn't disappear. The Queen's mother didn't want to kill Hilda, but she feared that Hilda would grow too powerful and would start doing...unpopular things for the kingdom. So, she left her on a cold mountain, hoping she'd die, or would get away but forget her life...She never thought a Yeti would find the duchess, take her as a child, bear a son that would be like a brother to Hilda, and would then die, leaving Cedric and Hilda to live life in a cave here. Of course, legends say something quite different, but the Princes know the truth. Can you make a guess as to why they want me dead?"
You thought for a moment. Considering all this was true...
"If you are alive, and you decided they didn't rule well enough, they fear you would take the throne, which you could then do with magic and proof of your identity. If you are of Eisbrecher royalty, you could summon a sigil on your left foot, correct?" As if on cue, she lifted her left foot...and you saw the sigil. It was a well-known mark for the royalty.
"Do not mistake me: Vals and Caljer are getting hunters to kill beasts of the mountain to legitimately help the people. I've heard talk they even wish to help other kingdoms with their problems to establish a friendship of sorts. There are rumors they wish to help the Coninze and Rylestia kingdoms stop their fighting and come to a peaceful consensus, and they wish to help catch the Pirate Queen...Sapphire...? Emerald...?"

There was an outpost on the mountain controlled by a well known mage by the name of Edea, her brother Mario being her second in command. They owned the outpost to help travelers, though they were also famous for hunting dangerous creatures and mining for precious gems to donate to their country. Edea herself had spent most of her life to the far north in Stalt, and had quickly picked up the accent, while her brother Mario lived down south in Qur. They had only about five years ago built the outpost, though already they ran a brisk business. 152.content:
After her last pillaging, Ruby was spotted heading west. You recognized a pattern in her attacks before; everytime she attacks a town, she then docks somewhere to reward her crew and find more members if any were killed off.

It was the middle of the night when you finally arrive at the port town and find out that you were entirely correct. Rocking gently in the docks is her ship, the "Red Devil." Even at the edges of town you can hear the raucus coming from the tavern.

Lowering your eyes to appear as though you are just an innocent traveler, you quietly make your way to the three-story-tall tavern and duck into an alley beside it. You peek into one of the windows.

Inside, the tavern is filled with an assortment of ruffians, hooligans, and just plain not-very-nice people.The rum was flowing more quickly than a river, and even though barmaids were being pinched and grabbed left-and-right, the bartender didn't seem to mind as the coins piled up on the counter.

Movement towards the stairs inside catches your eye. You position yourself to get a better look.

Descending down the stairs are four beautiful women, each wearing identical red blouses, black trousers, and black corsets, with their jolly roger emblazoned on the front.

They are Ruby's elite. The ones she taught all her tricks to so that they would always be able to keep up with her should trouble arise. If they are coming from upstairs, then most likely Ruby is up on the second or third floor.

If luck is on your side, she may even be alone. If your luck was good, perhaps you can even capture her and escape without anyone downstairs noticing.

Looking up, you see there is a downspout leading all the way up to the raingutter on the rooftop. Perhaps it can support your weight. You rest a hand on the sword at your hip as you ponder your choices.

You're in a large, open room with three doors: one appearing to lead back outside, one with a note pinned to the door, and the last seeming to be locked, with a large and menacing keyhole. Against the other wall is a window, and a hammock gently swinging beneath it. But inside the hammock is another pirate!

You reach for your sword, but as you do you notice she seems to be fast asleep. A near empty bottle of rum is on the floor below her; she appears to have passed out from a night of heavy drinking. Some guard... you take a closer look, confident she won't wake up. Her corset lies on the floor next to her bottle, wearing just the red blouse and black trousers of Ruby's elite guard. You can see why she decided to, after all that rum, the hot summer night must have gotten unbearable. A light sheen of sweat coats her olive skin; strands of her short, black hair clinging to her face. Her blouse is crumpled and bunched from fitful sleep, revealing her fit, smooth midriff. Her boots also rest on the floor in a heap, her bare soles airing themselves in by the window. She's quite vulnerable, and likely not a threat to you tonight.

Tiptoeing to the door with the note, you see its a command from Ruby to her lackeys: "No one is the enter Mesmera's room but Ruby. Anyone entering will have to deal with the consequences!" You wonder what this means... who is this Mesmera? And why can't anyone enter her room? She might have valuables in the room, or maybe she's someone valuable to Ruby... maybe you could make her turn her self in exchange for her.

You look over to the other door. You could peek through the keyhole and see what's inside, it might be big enough. While looking through the keyhole, you'll be exposing yourself to attack. The sleeping pirate doesn't seem like a threat, but you're not completely sure. She also might have the key to the lock. At a glance, you can't see it anywhere on her, but that doesn't mean she isn't hiding it somehow. What to do?
