Fay flutters back up and takes a seat on your right shoulder, legs crossing daintily.

"Such a ticklish human... helpless... unable to stop us. You should be thankful that it's just the two of us. Imagine if we caught you closer to our home! But the two of us is all it takes to make you let go..."

While she speaks, Ali begins to stroke the feather along the length of your limp shaft. You gasp and your lips quickly turn into a smile. It tickles immensely, but at the same time it also stirs feelings of pleasure deep down.

"You can't hold on forever, human... Ali is going to keep tickling you... just tickle tickle tickle... kitchy kitchy koo... can't you feel it? Doesn't it make you want to laugh?"

You aren't sure if it's Ali's touch or Fay's words but you burst out giggling much quicker than you would have liked. The feather continues to glide up and down your shaft, from the head down to the base. Your hips squirm side-to-side, but nothing can protect your sensitive parts from her.

Fay leans over closer to your ear, allowing her to speak both quieter and more sensually. "The best part about this is, the more excited you get... the more space we have to tickle! And if you really like it, well, let's just say it's impossible to hold on during the 'finale.' So... tickle tickle...!"

There's no way you can resist the sensations down below even if someone promised you your own kingdom. You feel your manhood stiffen, and Ali's feather brushes and swirls just below the head, both to speed up the process and elicit a fresh wave of helpless giggles from you.
155231121.title: "No man can resist what we have in store!"

choices: You fell into the blackness below, hoping for the best
you grit your teeth and pour all your strength into pulling yourself up
1552311211.content:
Fay whispered right into your ear, "It's hopeless. Even if you could hold on forever, we would just tickle you forever." This was punctuated with a brush with her nails against your neck. Ali's feather twirled round and round the head of your manhood, but you didn't even bother squirming. Wherever you squirmed to, she was already there anyway. You felt electrical feelings of pleasure slowly building.

"Don't worry! It's almost done, human!"

Your grip was rapidly loosening, but you were doing all you could to hold on. For all you knew, these fairies had something lethal down there. You wanted to scream, but you were too overwhelmed with laughter to do anything. Suddenly, your grip loosens, the torment is replaced by pleasure, every muscle in your body relaxes, you go into a daze. However, one brain cell still seems to be yelled not to let go, but the weight of your body and the fatigue in your arms seem to be too much. The fairies back up to examine the product of their "labors." For several seconds, all is still, except for your slowly slipping fingers. The stillness breaks as...
1552311211.title: The "torment" continues...

15523112111.content:
It's just too much for you, or anyone, to handle. Your strength finally wanes and you lose your grip on the root, causing you to fall. As the sight of the hole shrinks, you hear one of the fairies shout down after you.

"Happy landings!"

-----

Darkness.

At first, you think you've just woken up during the night, only it's not a bed you're laying on. It feels more like spongy moss.

You gasp and sit up, remembering what just happened. You look straight up and see the distant light from the top of the pit you fell into. It's hard to estimate, but it looks like it's a few hundred feet up. You run your fingertips lightly over the moss which has saved your life.

"I will never rip you off the side of my home ever again," you mutter before fixing your pants and pushing yourself up on to your feet.

Bit by bit your eyes begin to adjust to the darkness. Though details are hard to make out, you can faintly see the outlines of your surroundings. You seem to be in a small chamber of sorts with a tiny stream of groundwater running down the slight slope.

At first you're worried that there's no escape, but then you notice that there are two spots darker than the walls around you. Tunnels! Two of them, to be precise.

One tunnel seems to slope upwards, while the other slopes downwards. In caves, it's not easy to tell which can go where, and either might lead to the surface... or get you lost.
15523112111.title: The descent into darkness

choices: Had enough adventure for today (Take the Left Tunnel)
I gotta know what's down there... (Take the Right Tunnel)
155231121111.content:
You take the tunnel going upwards. That is where you came from, right? It's the more obvious choice. You continue along the narrow tunnel for what seems like forever, and it's not getting any brighter. You stumble and bump through the passage, tripping several times, bumping into stalactites and stalagmites, and you're pretty sure you stepped in something wet and squishy. You can't see the nose in front of your face, and you're likely to be eaten by a grue.

After what feels like hours, you finally see light! You start running to see what lies up ahead, an you're greeted with a fork in the tunnel, both seem to be lit.

The tunnel to the left takes a sharper turn upwards and is much brighter, likely the way to the surface.
The one to the right seems to even out a bit. The light is dimmer, but substantial. You make out strange, red symbols painted along its walls and a few bones scattered about its floor.

Are you headed for the friendlier looking choice, or are you feeling adventurous?
155231121111.title: Tunnel going upwards

choices: To try to find your way back home
1552311211111.content:
You decide it'd be best to avoid whatever's down the other way at all costs and climb out the left tunnel. Just as you thought, it leads to the surface! Though you aren't quite sure where you are. You survey your surroundings, the tunnel emptied out into a wooded area near a small lake, a fairly pleasant setting. You sit for a moment to relax after the long trek through the tunnel.

Your feet are aching after all the walking, so you decide to take your boots off and cool them in the water. After sitting for awhile enjoying your surroundings, you decide
1552311211111.title: Had enough adventure for today (Take the Left T...

choices: "I'd rather die than you let you tickle me"
1552311211112.content:
Stepping into the tunnel, you look at the symbols on the walls which look like they're made from blood. It would make sense considering the are bones on the floor "someone was unlucky". Making your way through the dimly lit tunnel, the many symbols the walls intrigue you as to what they mean. Gradually going deeper, the tunnel becomes darker until its gone completely black so using the walls of the tunnel to guide you. They soon end as well leaving you completely lost in the dark "crap, where am I?". After much searching, you find a wall which seemed to curve up above you, possibly making the room a dome shape "now if I can only find the tunnel back". Turning back, you're met by 2 yellow eyes that look down on you "whoa" frozen to the spot, you wasn't sure what to do. Whatever was looking at you, you didn't want anything to do with it so stepping to the side, the eyes follow your every move.

"Just stay calm, make no sudden movements and you'll get out of this". Edging around against the wall, you was hoping to reach the tunnel "come on where is it?". It was then the eyes moved away from you and stopped opposite your position "I'm afraid I can't let you leave human". Whatever those eyes belonged to, it could talk "I don't want any trouble, I got lost" a loud feminine laugh fills your ears. "They all say that human" with a click of fingers, torches light up the room, yourself and the inhabitant opposite you. Not believing what you're seeing, you blink a few times before you realize you are in fact staring at a woman with a snake's body for legs. "Welcome human.......to the end of your life" you put your hands up in front of you "whoa just hold on, I'm sorry for entering your home. I can only guess that those symbols in the tunnel and in this room are warnings of some sort".

She smiles "a smart one, and yet you still entered so prepare yourself human because its dinner time". Gulping, you look around trying to find a way out but to your dismay, the only one was being blocked by her "can't we just talk about this?". Her tail moves toward you "there's nothing to talk about human, you're in a place you don't belong and now you must pay the price". Her tail wraps around your left leg and proceeds to move up your body "there's no escaping now". Her tail suddenly goes up inside your top making you shiver but as it glides up your ribs, you giggle and squirm making her stop "you're laughing......why do you laugh when you know I will eat you?".

"It was involuntary.........I'm nervous" she stares you in confusion "someone doesn't laugh at there own demise". Her tail then pokes your ribs making you giggle again "interesting......I've never met a ticklish human before". Slipping her tail out from under your top, she then moves toward you until she's a few feet from you "the subject had always fascinated me" lowering herself down, she becomes eye level with you "I'll make a deal with you human, if you let me explore this ticklishness you have, I'll let you go". "And what if I refuse?" she smiles "I think you know" nodding. you gulp "well..........."
1552311211112.title: Something that slithers

15523112111121.content:
"Suit yourself human, I'll enjoy this meal" her body starts to coil around your legs before she lifts you into the air, hanging you above her "any last words human?". "I hope you choke on me" she smiles then opens her mouth to 10 times the size of what it should "looks like this is the end". As she lowers you down to your inevitable doom, you close your eyes and wait for your end. After waiting for a good 10 seconds, you open your eyes to find her staring at you "it just occurred to me that you'd rather die than be tickled". "Yeah so just get it over and done with" as she stared at you, it looked like she was formulating a plan "why would anyone want to be eaten than be tickled?".

"I have my reasons, now are you going to eat or not?" you got your answer when she lowers you back down to the ground but still keeps you within her coils "does this mean you're letting me go?" she smiles at you "no human, I have other plans for you". As more coils move and envelop around you, you find she coils her body around your arms before raising them above your head "what are you doing?". She stays silent until you tightly restrained leaving you vulnerable against her "you won't be need this". Grabbing your top, she uses her nails to rip it from your body leaving you topless from the waist up "much better". Dragging a nail down you body, you gasp and shiver "wait please not that, I can help you........I'll get you money, jewels anything you want". She continues to lightly tease your body "I have no need for treasures" becoming desperate, you was hoping your next idea would be more to her taste "what if I lure people here so you can eat them".

That idea gained her interest for like a second "its a good idea.......however I need no help with that". Her hands stopping, she smiles at you once again showing you her fangs "now human where should I start with you?......maybe your underarms or that toned belly or yours". She then looks down toward your feet that are sticking out from her coils "or maybe I go for those sensitive looking feet of yours" All of that sounded horrible, you didn't want to be tickled anywhere "now I could let you choose but being in the position you're in, you get no say" Wiggling her fingers at you, she laughs "oh human this is going to be a most joyous day for me..........now laugh"
15523112111121.title: Is this the end?

155231121111211.content:
As she starts to scratch and poke at your underarms, you flinch and gasp from every sensation "such a sensitive human" although she was taking her time, you surprise yourself by keeping back any laughter. "You may be able to hold your laughter human but when I'm done with you, there will be no resistance". She starts tickling you faster, digging her nails into your vulnerable underarms but still you manage to keep yourself composed, only letting a few giggles and shrieks. "The more you hold out human, the sweeter it is when you finally succumb to me" you couldn't believe how resilient you was to her attacks but the smile on her face could tell you was close to breaking.

"Not long now" you face red and sweating from the amount of effort you was putting in to stop yourself from laughing, it would be all in vain when she uses one hand to attack your side bringing what she wanted "NO PLEASE HAHAHAHAHAHHAHA STOP HAHAHAHAHAHAH" she smiles in joy "there we go human, laugh it up, don't hold back". No longer able to resist it, you let loose and laugh your head off much to the delight of your captor "HAHAHAHAHHAAA NO MORE HAHAHAHAHHAHAA ITS TOO MUCH". Shaking your head side to side was all the movement you could do as she continues to assault your body.

"Are all you humans this ticklish, because if so then I may have to do this to others" her relentless tickling was having a major affect on you as you was getting close to passing out and there was the matter of you becoming aroused by your situation. "Are you close to passing out human? do you want me to stop or should I continue until you do".
155231121111211.title: Is it possible to resist such torture?

15523112111122.content:
You aren't dumb; getting tickled and free is WAY better than being lunch. Of course, you have no idea how bad you might be tickled, but surely it's better than death.

"Wise choice..., human," she hisses as she began to coil around your body, forcing your arms above your head and binding them as well. You're a bit nervous. You love to get tickled, but she could betray you and eat you anyway. Whatever the outcome will be, you can't back out of it now.

"So..., explain how this ticklish thing works..." she said

sigh. "Basically, if you make a light brushing feeling on my ticklish spots, then I'll laugh, squirm, and try to defend myself," you explained, "Different people are ticklish in different places, and some not at all."

"Okay.... Let me try this 'tickling'..." she replied, "But you probably won't be needing this!" she hissed as her nails cut through your clothing, exposing your upper body. "Now then..." She began to lightly scratch your armpit. You were already having trouble keeping in your giggles, and a lopsided grin formed on your face. "I'm liking this..., human..." She then started to furiously scratch both your armpits with her hands. It took you off guard and sent you into a fit of laughter.

"NOOHAHAHAHAHAHA PLEHEHEZE STHAHAP!!!!" the snake women only smirked.

Her experiments continued on for a few more minutes before she finally stopped. You were beginning to get sweaty already. "Care to share any other ticklish spots...?" she wondered.
15523112111122.title: Laughter Over Lunch

155231121111222.content:
"Well my tummy is pretty ticklish if you tickle it right" she said.

"Oh really, well then, lets have a look at that belly of yours" With a quick motion, she moved her hands from your armpits and moved down to your belly. She started to knead your tummy, causing you to giggle. WIth short quick motions, she moved up and down your tummy, tickling your ribs and your sides and you are doing your best to contain your laughter.

"What gives?" The snake said "I thought you said your tummy was a ticklish spot"
"It is, you just need to tickle it right" you said "Try making my tummy more taut and then use your nails to scratch it "

The snake thought about it and agreed. She pulled you tummy tighter, making the skin taut and making it so you couldnt move an inch.
She then flicked out her nails and lightly began to scratch your bare tummy, sending shockwaves of laughter through your body. Trying to contain the laughter was even harder then before. With her nails dancing across your tight vulnerable skin and you not being able to move an inch was driving you insane.

The snake, sensing you about to lose control, increased her speed. Her nails were sharp but delicate, barely just scraping your skin.
"Awww is the human girl ticklish on her tummy?"
It was too much, you were about to burst out laughing until the worst happened. 1 nail accidentally dipped into your deep navel, causing you to yelp. The snake was taken aback

"Well what do we have here" she smiled "It seems this little hole of yours is ticklish as well"
"No, please don't tickle my belly button" you wimpered "Im sorry but you asked for this: its time to exlore this hole"

WIth 2 nails, she placed them on either side of your navel and stretched it. She then slowly lowered her nail into the navel all the while you were deseratly trying to move away, but it was no use. The nail began to lightly scratch the insides of your navel and that was it.

HAHAHHAAHAHAHAHAH oh plEASE HAHAAHDOHANT TIHIIIKLE MEEEEEEEEEE THERE HAHAHAAHAHA
The snake was in bliss. This was so exciting. Much more fun then just eating her prey. She wondered if she could use what she learned on other parts of her body.....
155231121111222.title: "My tummy is ticklish too..."

155231121112.content:
You decide to travel downwards. Why? Well... might as well, you think. You place your hand along the right wall, and slowly make your way into the dark passage. The path is quickly becoming too dark to see, as you leave the faint, mossy opening behind. You make sure to keep a grip on the wall as you carefully step forward, wary of tripping or running into something. Your mind wanders as you slowly make your way forward, remembering the fairies that got you into this mess... you shudder, recalling what they did to you, your body still tingling from their touch, although part of you almost wishes for it to happen again...

You shake your head, clearing your mind of such thoughts. Who knows what those fairies had planned? And did they have anything more in store for you than just falling down here? What is this place? Your mind ponders these things in the inky black... as you keep walking, ever downward. Unfortunately, the passage doesn't seem to want to head up anytime soon. Maybe this was the wrong passage to take...

Rounding a corner, a faint light flickers far ahead. After all this time bumbling in the dark, its a welcome respite. As you get closer, it appears to be a fire, or about medium size. But who or what is keeping a fire lit down here? Some magic trickery? Mythical creatures? More fairies? ...More victims of fairy mischief like yourself? Almost anything could be there, but there's not sense turning back now. At the very least, your eyes have completely adjusted to the darkness, but anyone near that fire shouldn't be able to see you lurking in the shadows.

You squint ahead, trying to make out any details, and manage to see...
155231121112.title: Tunnel going downwards

1552311211122.content:
Creeping forward slowly, you notice two figures standing beside the fire. While you can only view them from the waist up, you start to make them out. Unless your straining eyes deceive you, they both appear to be female, judging my the curvature of their bodies. One of the women appears to have her arms high over her head... gesturing? Holding something? You can't tell. The other has her hands on her hips... puffing out her chest? Sucking in her stomach? Neither appear to be moving, what are they doing? You have no idea, and you realize you'll need to sneak closer.

Moving as stealthily as you can, you inch closer to the two beings, wincing each time your feet scuff clumsily against the ground. You notice their skin seems completely gray... if they aren't wearing anything. Maybe they're covered in paint, or have some strange clothing. They still aren't moving... are you witness to a stand-off?

Approaching the edge of the firelight, crouching behind a large rock, you're finally close enough to see clearly. The two figures are...
1552311211122.title: Two Figures

choices: You hear snakes hissing in the distance
Someone or something grabs you from behind
15523112111221.content:
The dancing light from the fire is enough for you to notice the rough texture covering the gray bodies. They're female alright, but they aren't alive... they are just statues.

You frown and stand up from your hiding spot now that the present danger is gone. Curiosity gets the best of you, and you step over to the statues to inspect them. After all, it's a bit odd to pose statues in such a dark cave. And, of course, there's also the matter of the fire that someone must have lit.

The statued women are facing each other, with several feet of space between them. You step in the middle and turn to the one with her arms raised above her head. Was she originally carring an urn? Or a pole of some kind? Perhaps it had fallen loose when the statue was dragged down here.

There is a soft cracking noise, like a stone being chipped.

You instinctively spin around and stare at the other statue. She is still in the same pose you saw her last; her hands on her hips, chest puffed out slightly, and a sly smirk carved into her facial features. It unsettles you.
15523112111221.title: Statues

155231121112211.content:
You tense up and looked for the source of the sound. You never really liked snakes, and you did your best to avoid them. As you scan the cavern, you realize you can't make out any details too far from the fires light. You make your way passed the statues searching for a way out.

As you feel along the walls, you hear the snake hissing once more and slow down. It was much closer that time, too close for comfort. You decide it might be a good idea to see if you can't find something to make a torch from the fire by the statues.

The moment you turn around, you're met with two large, cat-like eyes in the darkness, and you suddenly feel very cold and scared. You try to get away from whatever the thing is, but you realize you can't budge. You can't scream, you can't breathe, you can't even blink. You feel the thing grab hold of you and drag you toward the light. As it drags you closer to the fire, it comes into view.

A Gorgon, a scaly, serpentine woman with hair a nest of snakes, her gaze piercing and cold. You'd always heard gorgons were hideous, hag-like creatures, but she was actually quite beautiful. Or you might think so if you weren't so terrified at the moment.

She finished dragging you to the fire, and rights you next to the other two statues. It dawns on you that you were every bit the statue they were, now. The gorgon grins at you and moves in close, and you feel her begin to tear your clothes off your stone body.

Wait

You felt that. Despite your stone skin, you can feel her touch. You can still see and hear as well, you might be able to smell if you could draw any breath. It seemed all your senses had remained intact. Come to think of it, your mouth does taste a bit like concrete.

You're fearful of what she has in store for you. Suddenly, you feel her sharp nails skitter along your sides. You try to squirm away, but you're completely immobile. She holds herself close to you, her forked tongue flickers along your neck and she continues tickling along your ribs. You try desperately to move, but to no avail. You couldn't even laugh. You felt an intense NEED to laugh as she kept tickling, but you couldn't. You suddenly wish you were back with the fairies, at least you could move and laugh then, but this was just pure torture.

You try desperately to think of any means of escape, but it's hard to focus through the constant tickling.
155231121112211.title: You hear snakes hissing in the distance

choices: Try to tip one of the statues over
155231121112212.content:
With your attention focused on the statue, you are caught completely offguard when something strong slips its arms under yours and clasps its hands on the back of your neck, trapping you in a full nelson. It forces your arms to become raised and forced out to your sides while your head bends slightly forward.

15532.content:
It has been the center of your attention ever since you found it.

A book. One, small book that is barely big enough to be a book. The edges are worn, the color is faded, and the spine is barely holding it together. It looks fragile in the extreme, too delicate to be handled, too old to be of much use.

And yet, you feel, something. Something about the book grabs your attention, making it stand out amongst the thousands upon millions of tomes within your library. Just a dusty old book, sitting on a desk in the corner, busy collecting dust. That is the first time you have ever seen it.

Strangely, you have no recollection of ever purchasing the book. It may not sound worrying, there being thousands of millions of books and tomes stored in your vast, nearly mile-long library. You memory is photographic however, and you have personally purchased and read each and every book in your library.

Except this one. You are positive that you have never bought anything even like this book, it being so small. There is no other way you could've acquired the book, as you would never steal - it is dishonorable (yeah you're a necromancer, but you didn't get where you are by pillaging and plundering. Besides, it's bad for business). That only leaves it to someone putting it there, but no one besides you can access your enormous mansion.

At the moment you are staring at the small worn book, wearing extremely loose black robes, a pair of black socks made of the softest silk money could buy, and black laceless shoes that fit your feet exactly, allowing you to slip them on and off with ease. The faded black cover bears no title, and the front and back are firmly clasped together by a lock that outwits even you.

The table it lies on is tern with all sorts of magical apparatus and thick tomes, all assorted and used with the intention of breaking open the lock keeping you from opening the little book. Unfortunately, none of them worked, and you are just too focused to bother reorganizing them.

"Master, I have brought the boy you asked for."

You turn to see your favorite minion push in a small boy around the age of sixteen. The minion is a deadly looking thing, being revived from an era where two vast empires warred over five thousand years ago. His entire eight foot tall body is encased in black and silver heavy plate armor, with wicked spikes jutting up out of his shoulders and barbs covering each joint of his gauntlets. In his right hand he holds a massive zweihander, almost as large as the knight himself. His head is covered in a helmet with no visor, sharp points extruding from the top and a black void where his face should be. He is, in a word, terrifying.

The other figure, the polar opposite of the awesome knight, is too busy being terrified to be terrifying, not that he'd be too scary anyway. Cowering at a rather short five foot eight, he immediately gales when he sees you standing before him. His shoulder-length brown hair whips back as he bows, pretty much flattening himself on the floor. His tattered clothing reveals a lot of skin, tanned from exposure to the sun. A slightly athletic build, he strikes you as wiry guy, whose lean body would be better suited to acrobatics than combat.

The boy is no longer shivering, now in awe of your presence. When you're known throughout the entire world of Zenith as the most powerful necromancer since the creation of the magic art, you tend to have that kind of effect on people.

"This is the one you sought, master," says the giant minion. "The thief who tried to break into your mansion the day before last."

"That wasn't me!" the boy protests. "I swear, I saw the man who did run off into the market..."

The lies pour from his mouth like water from a fountain, painfully noticeable to one as practiced in the dark arts as you. You try to hear him out, but you cannot put up with it for more than ten seconds.

"Enough!" you shout, silencing the boy immediately. His face visibly pales, and his gaze slowly turns to meet yours. "Do not deny it, I know it was you," you continue. "I can easily detect lies coming from one who's so bad at telling them. You broke past three of my ten safety enchantments and locks, and you would've broken through the fourth had my guards not noticed you." Calming down, you begin to explain why you brought him here. "Before you, no one has ever been able to get past even the first one. I brought you hear to ask for your services."

You gesture towards the locked book. "I have been trying to open that for days. Unfortunately, I have more experience in making locks than breaking them. I brought you here to offer you a solid reward for helping me open that book."

The boy gets up - slowly - and approaches the book. You step aside, allowing him to pick it up and inspect the lock. After about a few minutes, he sets the book down and turns back to you.

"The lock is fairly simple," he starts. "Extremely effective, but simple. Many people, like you, would think that the lock would be complicated, and try clever ways to open it. Really, all you have to do is overpower and break the lock through sheer force. But a lock like this needs a lot of power to break, which is why it is effective against someone like me." He makes eye contact with you. "But for someone like you, opening this should be effortless."

Genuinely impressed, you motion back towards the door. "Well done. Exit this room, take a left, and the third door on the right will have your reward; a chest of gold trinkets and some fine clothes. From there, my minions will show you out. And don't snoop around, for I know all that goes on within this household."

Nodding gratefully, the boy turns and runs down the room. His quick exit is almost stopped by the knight, but a motion from you gets him to stand down. It will be a while before the thief spends all his money.

"What are your wishes, master?" asks the giant figure, awaiting your next command.

"Wait here," you say. "I may have need of you." Clutching your staff (a beautiful artifact of gold, painted black willow wood, and encrusted onyx), you send a small yet focused blast of pure force at the lock. It makes contact, and suddenly the book flies open, pages turning rapidly.

You approach the book, trying to discern the meaning of the flipping pages, when suddenly it stops. Standing at the table now, you look down and see the name of a very formidable demoness. In fact, you are so shocked you unconsciously whisper her name.

Now, most necromancers need aid from their appendages and items and concoctions to summon a demon. Not you. No, you are so powerful that simply speaking the demon's name is enough to bring it to this world. Also, if the demon is trying to come into this world, they may come unbidden to the most powerful necromancer who knows of them.

In both cases, it doesn't take much to bring Serelia into your home.

A vortex between worlds opens, filling the room with pure darkness and unspeakable energy. Slowly, a figure emerges from the twisting shadow, and you are at first surprised at the demoness' beauty.

Her body is very shapely, with curvy hips and an hourglass form. Two small patches of cloth are all that is on her supple breasts, magically held in place to offer what modesty they can. Her legs are long and end in cute feet, surprisingly small compared to the rest of her body. Her face is that of a rare beauty's, and her flowing long black hair nearly reaches her butt, broken by two long ram's horns protruding from her forehead. Long nails extrude from each finger, and each comes to a dull but pointy claw. Her skin is a very light red, clearly a demon but not crimson, and all she wears besides the patches on her breasts is a loin cloth that can only be described as skimpy at best.

All in all, her looks are perfect.

The vortex closes, the darkness ceases, and you are left upright, gaping before Serelia, the most beautiful and possibly most powerful demoness in existence.

Suddenly her eyes open, revealing green irises the color of moss. Her mouth opens, and in a voice that sounds more than human she says...
