You stand stock still with your mouth slightly open, never in all our years have you heard of a true demon submiting itself to its summoner without a fight. You have heard thousands of stories that say demons destroy their summoner (hence your minion) and you yourself have seen the damages they can cause. So why would Serelia do your biddening with out a fight and you say that to her

She looks straight at you and says "I am bored with the demon world, Males have grown fat and females lose their taste after a while," she said. "I need something new and I think you can do that while else would I give you the Book of the Concubines" she finished

"And what is the thing I could give you" you say

She response.....
155321.title: "I am here to do as you please, master."

choices: Show her what you're made of
155322.content:
"Foolish human, now you belong to me!"

Had it not been for the apparent threat that her presence causes, you probably would have sank to your knees in submission right then and there. Her voice is deep, and yet retains a sensual feminity that seems to wrap around you. It tingles with an unearthly power which causes not only the hairs on the back of your neck to rise, but a sudden tinge of pleasure deep within yourself. A shiver of anticipation runs down your spine for but a moment before you regain your composure. This was no time to let your mind be distracted by dirty thoughts.

Your snap your head over towards your loyal minion still standing by the doorway, suddenly finding it absurd that you even have to give the order. "Get her!" you shout, swinging one arm out towards the demoness to make it perfectly clear on who you are referring to.

His own head turns towards the demoness, his armor clanking together as sharp bits scrape and slide over the plates. With a seemingly calm demeanor, the armored creature strides towards her, effortlessly lifting the large zweihander in his right hand hand. Serelia slowly turns to face the oncoming foe, an amused smirk tugging at the corners of her lips. Even as the armored man brings the two-handed blade high above her head, her posture merely shifts to one of slight-interest, her hip sticking out to one side as a hand dropped to settle upon her hip.

And then, he strikes.

The blade swings down with such velocity that it appears a blur to even your trained eyes... but stops only inches from Serelia's head. One of her slender hands is pressed up against the sword, her long fingers having curled around it. She doesn't even appear to be straining. Had your minion still retained his face, you're sure he would have looked as surprised as you were at that moment.

"Pssh... is this what you deem as help these days?" she responds, her tone just condescending enough to overtake her sensuality and cause a streak of anger to race through you. However, before you can respond, her free hand thrusts straight towards the armored man's midsection... and continued on through to the other side. Shards of twisted metal fly out in all directions, and his body shudders from the force. She lifts up one beautiful foot and kicks straight forward just below where her arm has gone through, sending your minion soaring backwards into the wall, and clear on through, sending bits of wooden debris falling down through the large hole his body creates.

Serelia slowly looks back at you, letting the zweihander finally slip from her grasp and clatter to the floor beside her. Once more a beautiful, yet startlingly predatory, smile forms upon her plush lips.

"...Care to test your luck, too?"
155322.title: Role reversal

choices: No you're not! What happened to your pride?
1553221.content:
The anger returns at what she says. It was phrased as a question, but is obviously a direct challenge. She's daring you to attack her as if to say 'so what are you gonna do about it?'.

"Damn you!" you shout, the anger racing through your body like horses on a track.

"Ah, yes. Many have," comes the casual response.

Thinking quickly, you point at her with the onyx staff and position yourself in a casting stance. It is common knowledge that demons, being made from pure evil, are immune to all forms of dark arts. To defeat her, you'll need to rely on a more primal force of magic, similar to the blast you sent at the lock.

Incantations fly through your head as a green mist fills the room. Determined to make your first blow your last, you begin to pool your strength into the powerful artifact in your hands. Below you, a rune engraves itself on the floor, an enchantment you cast to help double the effectiveness of your magic.

If this were a human you were up against, they'd be desperately trying to attack you, find a way to stop you from casting. But Serelia just resumes her slightly interested pose, her hand coming down to rest on her hip again. Though many would dismiss it, your pride only lets you see it as an insult to your power and knowledge.

All the preparations set, you whisper words of power that allow you to fire another bolt of pure force, this time at the demoness. The cosmic force within the attack would've been able to burst open the unbreakable gates to hell itself, rip through the threads of time, and still have enough juice to create a star.

To Serelia, you may as well have spat at her. At least that would give You some satisfaction.

Instead, you look on helplessly as you blast is simply blocked and neutralized, all the strength and energy and pure power within it dissipating into the air.

Before you know what is happening, your staff shatters, your runes vanish, and the demoness is standing above your kneeling body. In a second, it went from you attacking her with cosmic energy to kneeling before her completely defenseless.

"Finished yet?" she asks, almost bored.
1553221.title: Your Next Mistake

choices: You ride into another forest, in the direction of the Academy
A leering rusalka reaches out of the water to grab your ankle!
15532211.content:
All thoughts of defeating this magical entity are destroyed when your staff is. All hopes of binding new creatures to your will, conquering whole villages, and amassing more interesting artifacts and tomes are crushed as she kills your best minion and renders your dark powers, as most were held in your staff, useless as a snapped dagger. However, you may not be able to fight her, but you can still make out of this with your life.

You summon the last dregs of your mana in the form of inhuman speed, but instead of crashing into her or running backwards you shoot to the side. Your body impacts with a window and you smash through the glass, plummeting from the top story of the immense library. You take some pleasure in her cry of fury before you hit the muddy ground below, hard. Your now-befouled robes stopped the lethal fall from killing you, but for the first time you feel pain as the wind is knocked out of you. You limp off into the nearby forest as the demoness's powers engulf and further corrupt your fortress behind you.

That night you spend huddled in a small cave on the outskirts of a village, cursing your reduced magical abilities. It seems your powers have been reduced to that of a common hedge wizard: basic conjuring and elemental spells. No summoning dark minions from the void, binding lesser creatures to your will, or choking the air with vile poisons. All those secrets are condensed in your staff and in your books, which lie gathering dust in the fortress Serelia has taken over. At least your age was frozen when you lost your powers; you're stuck looking like a person in their 20-somethings rather than around 2 centuries. With this somewhat comforting thought, you cozy up next to your pathetic conjured flames and fall asleep. It's the first time you've needed to in 50 years.


The next morn you plot to gain back your library, artifacts, and land. You finally come to the conclusion that you'll need to do the unthinkable: join the Academy of Light. The light magic taught by these mages could prove invaluable to defeating Serelia, though it might be hard to fit in with weak do-gooders like them. As you come to the uncomfortable conclusion that you'll need to enroll in this Academy, you hear screams from the village nearby.

In the commotion you steal a sturdy horse from a nearby tavern and ride out of town. Just in time, too, for behind you Serelia has unleashed her own forces on the town: numerous lesser succubi, inferi, lecherous rusalki, screeching harpies, and other beasts stream forth from what had once been your gates. Yesterday you could have eradicated these things with a mere wave, but today you doubt you could defeat more than one. Still, you have to glance back with a smirk at the plight of the townspeople, what were they thinking living so close to such an ominous fortress?

You knit your brows in confusion when you see that instead of screaming in pain, they seem to be laughing because of the various monsters' ministrations. Then your filched steed rides over a shallow riverbed, and you have to blink to get the water out of your eyes.

Off to the Academy of Light you think to yourself bitterly, wondering how you ever got yourself into this miserable mess. The black robes on your back are the only reminder of the power and knowledge you've been forced to leave behind.
15532211.title: Yes, you are.

1553222.content:
As a wise man once said, the warrior who knows which battles he will win and which he will lose, will be victorious. Before now, you thought the words were cowardly, and only now do you see the logic behind them.

And so you run.

Unfortunately, your clothes aren't exactly tailored for running.  Your movement is restricted within the confines of the robe, and you need to struggle to run in the comfort-made shoes. You try to compensate by throwing up walls and barriers, but Serelia tears through them as if they were paper.

You look back, and are met with an unwelcome sight. The demoness is quickly walking after you, shrugging off all your spells and enchantments. Despite the fact that she's just walking, she is still slowly gaining ground on you. A little pathetic, actually.

Facing forward again, you see the tan thief and one of your servant minions exit into the hallway. The minion notices you right away, but the boy is still trying to grasp the large chest in his arms without dropping it. This might come in handy.

"Distract her!" you shout at the minion. As it hastens to obey, the thief finally looks up and sees you 'running' from the demoness. He only has the time to look confused as you pass him, throwing him to the ground as you do. Desperate, you risk a backward glance.

Serelia has to slow down to contend with the minion you sent at her, but it still only takes a second for her to dispatch it. However, the thief does a much better job, getting up right in the middle of the lavish corridor, blocking the demoness' path completely.

Serelia almost just kicks him aside, but something stops her. What happens instead is much more disturbing, even to one like yourself. The thief looks up to see the demoness' face, and blushes at her beauty. Irritatedly Serelia lifts a finger and points at him.

The boy vanishes, pulled into a pool of black, colorless darkness. You can hear him scream in pain as the vortex closes.

That was all the motivation you needed. In a desperate move to gain speed, you reach down and tear off the lower half of your robes. It exposes your knees and downward, but it allows you to actually run. Just in case, you kick off your shoes so your footing is more sure.

Unfortunately, Serelia seems to have stepped up her game too. Your left sleeve is cut off by a whizzing slice of darkness, which then proceeds to cut through the ceiling and out into the air. The damage to your expensive mansion pains you, but fear for your life is still more urgent.

Another blade of darkness takes out a large portion from the right of your clothes, exposing your hip and side to the air. Soon darkness seems to be flying at you like volleys of arrows, most of them missing but some taking bits and pieces of your tattered robes. None of them actually hit you, which seems strange. But you have no time to ponder it, as you turn to see the demoness running and gaining on you.

On an instinct you turn to your right... and are met with a wall. Not a wall like the ones that are on either side of the hallway, but a magical barrier put up by Serelia herself. Apparently she's done playing cat and mouse.

In a flash you're flat on the ground, naked save for your undergarments with one of the demoness' pretty little feet pressing into your back. There is little resistance left within you, though your pride objects to being put in such a shameful position. Then your thoughts wander to what happened with the boy, and you feel a heavy sense of dread within you.

With that voice that is both frightening and sensual, Serelia puts her head next to yours and whispers in your ear.

"Don't worry," she coos. "I won't kill you off like that petty mongrel of a child. You're much too powerful to go to waste. I think I'll have you be my personal slave, doing whatever I wish." She giggles, a sound that is both dreadful and beautiful. "But tell me, what should I do with such a...
1553222.title: Make a run for it

15533.content:
Astronomers have viewed a planet in the night sky. One that looks much different than Zenith: Nadir
This is where you travel to by an unknown force. How will you survive on another planet where almost everything is opposite. But Nadir is not completely opposite to Zenith. The creatures that inhabit it strangely keep the same customs as those of Zenith. Will you make it across the great lands of Nadir to discover a way home? Or fall victim to the wildlife? Armed only with a sword and a bow, you will find this way home.

but this fate doesn't have to be yours. there are many more choices to choose from...
15533.title: Even more choices...

155331.content:
You are awoken by thunderclaps in the distance. The smell of sulfur enters your nostrils. Where are you? You sit up on the hard rocky ground. You look around at the landscape before you. Grey-black hills stretch before you in every direction. Dark storm clouds tumble in the distance, with flashes of lightning every now and then. You look down at where you woke up.
Only your sword, bow, and satchel lay there on the ground. You begin to take inventory.
Wrapped dried meat, paper, ink, quills, strips of cloth, a needle in a cork, three rolls of thread, 3 glass bottles one of which was filled with water, and a piece of metal you never remember acquiring. The piece of metal was covered in an assortment of scratches and nicks and appeared to have been severed purposely. With no real direction to go, you begin to wander aimlessly. The temperatures are hotter here than where you are from, you think to yourself. You begin to wonder where you are. The sun is much brighter in the sky.

You feel as though you have been walking for hours. You look up again at the sky. The storm in the distance had long since disappeared on the horizon, and with no clouds to protect you, you begin to feel dehydrated. With each step, your feet touched the scorched rock under you. Every step painful and no relief in sight. You stop to take a drink from the water. While drinking, something in the distance catches your eyes. It is a............
155331.title: I'm an abductee!

155332.content:
In a valley to the north west lies a small kingdom, so small that most countries would dismiss it. However, it has the largest mining industry and the greatest metal workers in the world, selling weapons and tools and precious items to surrounding lands as a source of national income. Whilst having a small standing army, the kingdom's allegiance would promise a near endless supply of weapons and armor, all of the finest make. Your father is the king of this peaceful land, and because of that you have enjoyed a peaceful and educated life. War is stirring on the horizon though, and a less honorable nation would have no qualms with kidnapping you to ensure the aid of your father...

Is this really your life? Or is yours farther down the road, waiting to be discovered?
155332.title: Even more choices...

choices: "The little prince has finally woken up."
"The little princess has finally woken up."
1553321.content:
"Please your highness, I insist we return to the palace. Your father will be done with his meetings soon, and I'm sure he'll want to see you."

The riding track ahead of you continues to twist away from the royal palace, much to the concern of your attendant. Tall oaks on either side of you provide excellent shade from the giant midday sun, and the sounds of wildlife surround you and help you feel relaxed. Turning back, you see the enormous stone castle with majestic spires and tall towers get smaller and smaller.

"I beg of you, your highness, the king worries for your safety and so do I. It is a common known fact that are national security is not what it should be, and if we're ambushed I won't be ample protection for you."

"Calm down Jasper," you say, trying to soothe him. "It is just a quick ride, we'll be back to the palace before sundown."

"Sundown is several hours away," Jasper points out. "And in that time anything could happen. It worries me to think what might become of you if you happen to get captured."

"You're worrying to much, Jasper. Just calm down and enjoy the forest." You spoke the truth, but it has always been Jasper's nature to worry. Nearly six feet tall standing, he was easily taller than many in the palace - you included. His angular features were creased with worry, his short black hair combed to perfection without a stray strand to be seen. His clothes were elegant and straight, and his demeanor always made it clear to whom he owed his loyalty.

Your caretaker for several years, Jasper has always been by your side and ready to make himself handy. If only he could be a bit more relaxed, he'd be the perfect person to have around. As it was, his excellent manners, good sense of humor, and his ability to talk his way out of any situation makes him a valuable friend, and one of the closest people to you.

One thing about Jasper though, he is always worrying about something. In his defense, a member of the royal family is a huge responsibility, and in this particular instance his worries were well-founded. Hostilities have been brewing for many years now, and the allegiance of your country will be the key to ensuring its safety as well as the outcome of the war. It's times like these that a country could make use of a skilled diplomat...

Or a hostage.

Ever since the declaration of war, your father has made sure you've been well protected. He says it will stay that way until he makes his decision on which coalition to join and can move you to a safer location, preferably far from enemy borders.

And so it has been, for the past month, that your father has had several diplomatic meetings and met with other monarchs and rulers that he may make a more educated and wise decision. Because of all that he has had little time to see you except to make sure you're all right from time to time and for some formal presentation to a potential ally. And whenever you are alone, it is with a dozen guards outside the door and windows, making sure no one can get near.

Damn politics.

This horse riding trip was the first opportunity you've had to even get out of the palace. And to your surprise, Jasper was to be the only one accompanying you. Of course the attendant tried to 'reason' with the king, but your father said you needed some time away from the worries of international politics. Whatever the reason, you were glad to get the chance to step out into the wild. And so far the trip has been turning out to be exactly what you need, calming your mind and relaxing your worries, and no sign of anyone else.

"Your highness, I understand your desire to get some fresh air but there's plenty of that in the garden. This far out from the capital there's sure to be some horrible fate awaiting us."

"Nothing's going to happen. Besides, kidnappers would expect me to be in the palace. You need to just calm down, and-"

"Your highness look out!"

All of a sudden an arrow come hissing out of the trees, burying itself in the neck of the chestnut horse you're riding. The well aimed shot kills the horse instantly, which falls to one side as two men step out of the bushes and hurry towards you. Trapped between the dead horse and the ground, there is nothing you can do but wait for them to come.

"I'll go back to the palace your highness! Your father will know about this, and not rest until you're found!"

"Hurry Jasper!"

The galloping of Jasper's horse grows quieter as he hurries back to the capital. You're glad he had the sense not to try and save you himself: Jasper is a smooth talker, but by no means a fighter. Turning to face your attackers, you see that one of them is holding some rope. You have no time to register this information though, as the pommel of an unseen sword makes contact with your temple, and you pass out.




You stir. Your head is still throbbing from the blow, and you wince in pain. Trying to bring a hand down to rub it, you realize you can't. It is then you notice that you're no longer in the forest.

The room is empty, not even a table or chair to furnish it. Directly in from of you on the far wall is a door, old but solid. The walls and floor are also made of lumber, but the roof seems to be made of thatch like a farm cottage. There is a gap where some of the material has fallen, allowing the morning sun to shine through and give light to the barren scene. You try moving again, but are still unable to do so. That's when you look at what you are restrained to.

Proving your earlier assumption false, there is one thing in the room. A hook, originally put there for hanging paintings, is now used lift your bound hands above your head. Looking down you see your feet are tied in a similar fashion, except that there is a heavy stone on the ground to which they're attached. The wile layout has you spread taught on the walls, with little slack and your body completely exposed. Speaking of which, it finally hits you that you are nude.

You begin to blush, but are distracted when you hear the door creak open to admit a woman in tight-fitting dark clothes. Entering, she closes the door behind her. "Well well well," you hear her say.
1553321.title: The Crafter's Country

15533211.content:
The mocking tone of the voice makes you blush further and you glare at the woman as she approaches, the door closing behind her. She was beautiful, no doubt about that at least with an Amazonian figure, fiery red hair, an ample bosom that strained against the material of her clothes and bright blue eyes that seemed to mock you just by glancing in your direction. She saunters towards you, swaying her hips in a most seductive manner as you avert your gaze, determined not too show how shaken you are, or how pleasing you find this woman's appearance.

"Nothing to say little Prince?" She asks, continuing her mocking tone before reaching her destination right in front of you, her breasts pressing lightly against your chest as she looks up and down at you "I suppose it's only right, I haven't acted as the most gracious of hosts after all. My name is Lucrecia. You're here for..."

"To be your hostage in order to get my father to ally with one of the coalitions? That's it isn't it?" You demand with a great deal of bitterness in your voice at having been captured so easily and this woman now toying with you. It was almost too much to bear!

Lucrecia simply gave a predatory smile in response as she continued to brush against your body, evidently enjoying the growing blush on your cheeks "There is that yes." She admitted "But I have... other skills that those who're employing me value. This isn't the first time I've captured a cute member of a Monarchy such as yourself. Nor is it the first time I've tortured one for information either."

Despite your best attempts at self control, you flinch at the mention of torture and fear whelms up inside of you "Y-You wouldn't!" You demand, unable to completely keep the tone of horror out of your voice.

Lucrecia simply giggles once more in response "Oh don't worry, it's not the kind of torture that'll hurt, or leave a permanent mark." She says, doing little to alleviate your fears. She suddenly reaches out with both hands and starts to skitter her fingers up and down your side, grazing softly against your skin "It'll be a laugh in fact."

You blink in surprise from the sudden tickling before clamping your mouth shut. She couldn't be serious, could she? You squirm in your bonds, writhing and twisting about as you try to fight the laughter bubbling inside of you from the tingling going up and down your sides. You couldn't show weakness in front of this woman! Especially when it was something as childish as tickling!

Seemingly noticing the inner conflict within you, Lucrecia sped up her fingers, tickling up from your ribs down to your hips at a rapid pace. She stroked and scratched all over your flanks for any weak area, smiling at each suppressed squeak and laugh from you "Open up little Prince." She whispers into your ear "Open up or I may have to look for other places to play with."

You feel her warm breath caress your ear and consider your options. You refuse to show weakness to this but considering you're naked and completely open to any kind of ticklish assault, it's a tough choice. Eventually you decide too...
15533211.title: "The little prince has finally woken up."

choices: Another woman, a colleague of Lucrecia. She holds in her hands some 'tools'.
A troop of soldiers, bearing your family crest. Surprisingly, Jasper leads them.
155332111.content:
It would be embarrassing to show this particular weakness, especially if it could be used as a weapon against your country. You hold your laughter inside with great effort, staunchly resisting the maddening effect of Lucrecia's fingers tapping your sides.

"Not laughing yet?" asks your tormentor. "We'll see how long that lasts." And with those words her fingers start dancing a little nearer to your stomach. Light feathery touches drag up and down the sides of your belly, nearly causing you to laugh. You persevere though, and manage to force down the laughter, though giggles are still bubbling just behind your forced smile.

"It tickles, and you know it," Lucrecia teases. "We both know that you can't hold out for long, and I haven't even gotten serious yet. I can if you want though." She leans in close, her mouth right next to your ear. "It can get a whole lot worse," she whispers seductively into your ear. "But it doesn't have to. Just laugh little prince, and I may start asking questions.

All you can manage without laughing is "Mmmmphmhmhmph!"

"No? Alright then." Suddenly the assault on your abdomen ends, giving you a moment to relax. That was a mistake, as when Lucrecia's nails make contact with your stretched underarms you immediately burst out laughing. Your left armpit is subjected to scribbling with just the tips of her nails, while Lucrecia's other hand draws lazy circles in your right armpit, getting gradually slower and focusing on the worst spot.

You laugh freely now, all restraints broken by her sudden attack. Attempting to squirm, you find your movement greatly restricted by the way she tied you. In your current state you are stretched taught with every part of your body exposed. In fact, she could go behind you and tickle you from there if she so wished. She had access to absolutely every part of your body, while you were completely defenseless.

Lucrecia begins whispering in your ear again. "That's it little prince. I knew you could laugh. Now if you had done so earlier maybe you would have mercy right now, but you made me actually try to break you. I'll have to receive my reward now, so don't expect me to let up for a while."

Her left hand, the one drawing circles, now does so on your belly. To replace it, she moves her mouth right next to your armpit and starts dragging her tongue up and down the hollow that forms there. Your laughter becomes even more frenzied as a result, as the feeling of disgust mixes with the overload of tickling sensation. A higher pitch is reached in your laughter as Lucrecia's questing finger finds your navel, and decides to stay there for a while.

Amidst the flurry of tickling you barely have the awareness to notice the door to the little cottage opening. Through gear-stained eyes, you see...
155332111.title: Gotta work for your pay

choices: "Take her to my rooms, still bound but with a bit more rope."
"Send her to, uh, the interrogation chambers I guess. I'll be along shortly."
1553321112.content:
"There, in the name of your King, apprehend her!" Jasper yells, pointing at Lucrecia.

She swears and turns to face the soldiers. It is clear that she is outmatched however, as the six troops line up and point their broadswords. Your family crest shone on their polished blue armor, a black eagle holding a hammer in its right hand and a pickaxe in its left. At an unspoken command, they all at once start advancing towards your captor.

Judging from the full armor plating and the visored helmets, they belonged to the Elite Guard of the palace, responsible for the safety of the royal family. These men and women were handpicked by the King's military commander for their height and strength, then put through an intense training program that pushed their skill higher than the elites of any other country. Their numbers were only a couple hundred, but with their skill each man or woman counted for a dozen on the battlefield.

They're the reason why no other country has dared attacked your home. An attack would beckon your father to join the opposing coalition, and while the Elites could be overwhelmed though sheer numbers, if they had a supporting army they'd be unstoppable.

As it was, these six would make quick work of your eccentric interrogator.

Chuckling nervously, Lucrecia slowly backs towards the wall you're restrained to. "It looks like I wasn't careful enough," she says. "Should've seen this coming, you can never trust mercs." In a flash, she has a short knife pressing against your throat. "Step back, or he's breathing through a new hole in his neck!"

The Elites stop at once. Charged with protecting your life, they could not do anything that might endanger you. They stand and stare, unsure of how to proceed. Then they part, allowing Jasper (who stood nearly as tall as they) to pass through and confront Lucrecia.

He scrutinizes her for a long while, then nodds as if having confirmed something. It is clear: he's preparing to talk you out of this. Knowing Jasper, he could talk Lucrecia into dropping the knife and make her feel good about it.

"You're bluffing," he states blankly

You feel Lucrecia's blade push a little harder against your skin. What is Jasper thinking? "You don't think I can kill him? I've killed boys younger than this!" Lucrecia yells wildly.

"I never said you lacked the ability to," Jasper corrects. "I simply said you're bluffing: you won't kill him. If you do, you have no hostage, no source of information, no leverage against our king, and no way out. Our King will declare war on your country - which I daresay he will anyway - and these soldiers will cut you to pieces if you so much as scratch that boy with your dull knife there."

It hits you like a hammer, and you mentally kick yourself. Of course! If the knife were sharp, Lucrecia would have drawn blood already with the intensity she's holding you with. You turn as much as you are able, enough to see your tormentor's flabbergasted expression.

Yep, Jasper was just that damn good.

"Now please back away from our beloved prince, before I order these vengeful guards to turn you into a corpse." Despite the venom in his words, Jasper carries himself with a calm demeanor and stance, though his eyes betray his icy fury. At their mention, each armored soldier takes a step forward that panics Lucrecia greatly.

"Ha, fine, you win," she says resignedly. "Just be cautious when declaring war, as my King will call his allies to bring hell to this little country."

"Please, the only ally your country currently has right now is Rylestia, who's caught up in some border war with Coninze, and an abysmal island state hundreds of miles from here." As Jasper turns to face you, he suddenly realizes you're stark naked. "And take off your clothes while you're surrendering: this is no way for a prince to be seen."

Lucrecia starts to protest, but one of the huge guards steps forward and she complies quickly enough. As she slips out of the tight-fitting black clothes, you find it hard not to stare at her exposed skin and undergarments. Just as she's about to take of her bra, Jasper speaks up.

"That's quite enough. There's no call for you to strip, and I daresay the prince won't be needing any of your undergarments," Jasper says without emotion. Motioning to the guards, he bends down to gather the discarded clothes.

Two step forward and draw Lucrecia off to one side, while two more approach you and cut you loose. The ropes are cut like butter, betraying the sharp edge that each broadsword has. Just an example of the great craftsmanship your country produces.

Rubbing your wrists, you turn to see Jasper offering you Lucrecia's shirt and pants. "Please put these on your highness," he asks. "We have brought a wagon with us, so meet us outside once you have finished dressing." With that, the six guards push Lucrecia out the door, followed by Jasper.

You dress quickly, testing out the clothes. A little loose on the hips and very loose on the chest, but manageable until you returned to the palace. Stepping out of the house, you are met with the sight of the very forest you were taken in. The little cottage is situated in an open clearing, which explains the sunlight shooting through the hole in the roof.

All around the thick forest is glimmering with sunlight reflected off of the thick undergrowth. Clumps of bushes scatter throughout between the trees, creating a natural barrier that even a dismounted man would have trouble getting through. The only way out is a single dirt road, leading straight from the little cottage to the forest.

Situated on the road is an open wagon, meant for carrying supplies but turned into a makeshift transport. In it Lucrecia sits with ankles and wrists bound together, surrounded by the six Elite Guards that sit patiently. From the front seat, Jasper waves at you as he tries to grab your attention.

"Over here your highness!" He beckons to the shotgun seat next to him, a wooden bench made for practicality as opposed to comfort. You don't complain though, not being the stereotypical stuck-up prince that gets pampered all the time. As soon as you sit, Jasper hits the reins and gets the wagon moving.

"Once again you have proven your worth Jasper, as a friend and ally," you tell him appraisingly. "Though I must ask, how did you find me?"

"We spotted a couple of mercenaries near the area where you were taken," Jasper answers, his formal demeanor starting to melt slightly. "They were trying to dispose of your dead horse, but we caught the brutes before they could run. Some quick talking and a threat or two loosened their tongues enough."

You throw a glance back at the Elites and Lucrecia. "And how do you know which country she belongs to?"

"The clothes are a dead giveaway. Only one group of kidnappers wear clothes like those, belonging to Fraug to the south west. The country is less of a nation and more of a loose confederation of city-states that have pledged allegiance to their 'King'. Because of this Fraug has seen multiple uprising from the various nobles, so this group of kidnappers were put together to take hostages and force the rebelling nobles to stand down."

You turn to look at Lucrecia's bound form. "And you think she's one of them?"

Jasper nods. "As I have said, they are the only to wear such clothes. They are also trained in retrieving vital information without leaving any marks or scars. In this way, they are able to keep their captives intact forever whilst subjugating them to a near endless amount of-"

"Tickling," you say, shivering slightly.

Again, Jasper nods. "It appears that you have already seen what she can do. If your highness so wishes, you could repay the favor in kind. She will be needed for interrogation, but I'm sure it will be easier if you soften her up a bit."

The wagon continues its journey out into the open, away from the forest and towards the palace. The mid-morning sun shines brightly,and the grass sways gently the wind. Before you, a huge wall with a single gate looms over the wagon. Entering the castle grounds, you are met with a familiar sight.

The gate opens to the private gardens, a large space with exotic plants arranged in neat rows separated by rock paths and grassy clearings. Further back, the entrance to the palace was a set of double doors inlaid with precious metals, which was merely a back door. Towering spires and parapets loom above, rising out of the giant structure of stone.

Slowly, Jasper brings the wagon to halt beside the door, where two more Elite Guards stand at attention. The wagon halts, and Jasper steps down to allow one of the guards to take his place at the reins. You follow close behind your attendant, but before you disappear into the palace a voice speaks up from the wagon.

"Your highness," a guard says, gesturing to Lucrecia. "Where do you want this prisoner sent?"

You turn to Jasper, who nods and beckons for you to decide.

"Guards," you begin.
1553321112.title: Rescue

15533211121.content:
You enter your room to see Lucrecia bound to an X spread which was moved in. Jasper had insisted of this becuase the only other sutibale palce for her to be tied up wuold be your bed, and Jasper wouldn't have any of that. You also notice that she is clothed in a thin dress.

Lucrecia notices you and tries to talk but, Jasper also had a gag in place which made her words unintelligable. You grin as she notices the tables have turned and this wouldn't be pleseant.

"Well what should we do with you" you say as you take in the scene. You think back to what she did to you and grin, You really didn't like most fo the grusome torture methods and where afraid to use them but she had just given you an excellent method to use.

You stride around her and dig your hands into her belly and are rewarded with a shriek of laughter which boils out of her gagged mouth and, you smile seeing that she is even more ticklish than you.

You move your hands up and down her sides and she struggles to evade but to no avail. Soon she is a giggling mass that is broken so you decide to...
15533211121.title: "Take her to my rooms, still bound but with...

1553322.content:
There are many rumors circulating the world about this one particular forest to the east, many of which mention a whole trove of gold, jewelry and artifacts. However, those that enter the forest are never seen again, and those who stray close swear they can hear frenzied laughter deep within. The promise of that much wealth is too tempting to pass up, and you find yourself entering the fabled forest. Little do you know that the forest itself is alive, and has an interesting way of punishing trespassers...

Is this the path you will take? Or does destiny call you down a different one?
1553322.title: Another Story

15533221.content:
This always happens.

Hear a rumor or two about some treasure or other, and before you know it you find yourself strolling to where the legend says. Once it was the treasure in the catacombs of some ruins - Dormduo or something like that? - and then it was some ditch belonging to somebody called the 'Millipede Lord' - great name, right? -, never rest, never tire.

This time, this time will be different. Rumors of an enormous treasure trove in a forest? Too good to pass up! And how the hell do you miss a huge treasure pile?

Of course, that was when you were in the pub back at Trillian. You heard the rumor, boasted that you'd find it, then set off without a second thought. It didn't help that you heard laughter as soon as the door shut behind you. A few quick purchases and you were on your way to the forest.

However, the farther into the forest you got the less sure you were. The brown dirt trail ended hours ago, replaced by lush green grass. Now the undergrowth runs rampant, and it is a struggle to make any progress at all. The midday sun filters through the thick canopy of leaves, and the healthy plants grow irregularly and in clumps, leaving you unsure where you came from and where is deeper in.

It is hard to imagine what could go wrong in a forest this beautiful, so you set down your satchel and rest your head on a log. Sifting through your belongings, you're disappointed at what you see. All that remains of your provisions are a couple loaves of bread, a half empty hip flask, a map of the known area of the forest, and some empty sacks you had planned to fill with treasure.

A noise shocks you out of your self-pity. Looking around, you don't see anything out of place. Yet the noise fills the wood, and you look intently for the sound of the -
15533221.title: Yeah...

choices: Wait for them to pass and then climb down.
155332212.content:
Years of adventuring have conditioned you to believe that mysterious out of the way places suddenly filling up with a singular sound are rarely a good sign. The slithering noise gets louder and louder, seemingly from everywhere. Whatever it is, it's coming this way fast.

Thinking quickly, you look around for someplace to hide. Since the noise appears to be coming from all directions, hiding in the undergrowth seems ill advised. You peek at each of the nearby trees- too small, not enough leaves to hid you, too hard to climb- before finding one with just the right amount of handholds to climb and hide in. As fast as you can, you shimmy up the tree until you're at a high branch with enough foliage to hide you effectively. As whatever is making the noise finally arrives, you peek through the leaves to get a glimpse of it. What you see surprises even your well traveled eyes.

Snakes. Hundreds of them, of every shape and size. Cobras and pythons and harmless garden snakes, snakes so big they could easily eat a cow and snakes smaller than your pinky finger. Many of them you are pretty damn sure aren't native to this area. All of them slither through the undergrowth in a single direction, moving deeper into the forest.

It occurs to you that such an insane event would not happen without cause. It must have something to do with the treasure. And since this is the only lead you've had for a while, you might as well take it. You need to follow the snakes. But you don't want them to notice you- who knows what they would do to you? You ponder a moment on how you should follow the reptiles.

Should you attempt to climb from tree to tree and follow them directly from the treetops, keeping them in your sight but with the risk of potential fall?

Or do you wait for them to pass, climb down, and follow their trail-possibly loosing said trail and getting lost again?
155332212.title: slithering.

choices: You fall down to the floor, into the snake swarm
1553322121.content:
You've never been much of a tracker. If you don't follow them now you'll probably lose them. You spot a nearby tree that looks close enough to jump to. Keeping the snakes in sight, you leap onto the next tree. You panic for a second as you wobble on your new perch before balancing yourself. Sighing with relief, you spy another tree that suits your purposes. The snakes ignore you as you jump from tree to tree, always moving in the same direction. What are they doing?

After a few minutes, you come to a halt. There are no more trees within safe jumping range-there is only one that you think you might be able to make, but it's a stretch. You nervously debate with yourself whether or not to risk this jump. You glance back down at the snakes, noticing that the mass of reptiles seems to be thinning. They're passing you fast! You decide you've come to far to stop now. Taking a deep breath, you leap of faith to the far tree, praying to every god you can think of to make this jump.

And then...
1553322121.title: Follow them from the treetops!

choices: Success! You use something in your bad to escape.
Failure! Looks like your in for a long day...
15533221212.content:
You cry out in fear as you plummet downwards towards the forest floor. You land on top of a particularly large snake with a *thud*, breaking your fall. You look around in fear. The snakes have stopped- all of them. They're staring at you. "Oh...uh... hi!" you sheepishly say, nervously glancing around at the reptile swarm. "I'm, uh, sorry for intruding... I'll just be on my way..." The snakes stare for a bit longer... and then swarm towards you!

You scream and struggle as they wrap around your arms, constrict your legs, and force you to the ground. Your body is held firm by the many coils, completley unable to escape. "Let me go! I'll tear you to pieces! I'll..." You gasp as you feel sensation on your side. And then another sensation on your belly. And then a few between your armpits! You bite your lip and wiggle around. Little tail tips slide under your shirt and bury themselves in your belly, wiggling all over your sensitive skin. "Grrkkk! H...hey! That tihihihicklesss!!" you manage to squeak.

The rambunctious reptiles ignore your protests, as the tickling sensations grow more and more intense. A few snakes slip their heads into your boots, licking at the soft sole skin hidden within. One of the tail tips teasing your belly inserts itself straight into your belly button and begins to wriggle. Your giggles, snorts, and protests give way to full blown laughter. Your struggle in vain as the coils hold you in place, the tails and tongues of hundreds of sadistic serpents treating you as their sensitive little tickle toy.

You have to get out of here! Surely there is something you can use... your bag! Something in your bag! If only you could reach your bag! Blinking through tears and thinking through tortures, you try to position your struggles to drop your pack off your back and into the reach of your hands...

You...
15533221212.title: You fall down to the floor, into the snake swarm

15533222.content:
You ride with a greatly feared bandit group in the west, mostly for the thrill and adventure... and the loot. Always the loot. Recently your little party of outlaws has grown more bold, attacking towns with garrisons and armed convoys, so far with great success. The next target is a small city, deep in the forest and next to a wide river, protected by low walls and a small militia force.. However, the Elven inhabitants are potent magic-users, and they often give sacrifices to an old entity that resides upstream; the Tentacled One.

The choice is yours: ride out with your bandit companions, or seek a different destiny.
15533222.title: Yet Another Story

choices: Help your friends out - join the fray!
They stand no chance - run like hell!
155332221.content:
Peering through the bushes, you see another squad of bandits move closer to the walls. One good thing about assaulting an Elven city is that there's always plenty of cover to choose from. Bushes extend all the way up to the walls themselves, providing a visual barrier for your groups and squads to move behind, and the trees are just meters away.

The assault is well planned. At the tree-line, several archer squads are positioned and poised to strike. The rest of the outlaws, the ones more suited to close combat, are slowly but surely making their way to the foot of the wall. Once the melee troops are in place, the archers will rain fire arrows on the town and generally get themselves noticed. With the town in a panic and the garrison rushing unprepared to the walls, the bandit warriors will scale the two meter tall barriers with ladders and grappling hooks and finish off any spell casters before cutting through the populace.

Everything is tipped in your favor. You outnumber the militia ten to one, you have a well-planned strategy, and the element of surprise on your side. It is almost too easy, especially for your first city assault.

Finally reaching the wall, your squad leader signals back to the archers. Now that there's a little time, you take in your surroundings. To your back is the wooden city wall, covered in moss and in bad shape, and you wonder if the grappling hooks won't break it. In front of you is the thick bush cover you just came from, and the forest a little farther back. The road into the city is far to your right, guarded by a gatehouse with towers, and is currently empty.

A whisper from your squad leader. The entire group immediately tenses, waiting for arrows to fly through the air and set the town alight. A minute passes, without turbulence. Just as it looks like something's wrong, a volley of flaming arrows arcs through the air and lands on the other side of the wall.

And suddenly all hell breaks loose.

Unaware of the magic wafting through the air, your squad is jumped by the bushes behind it. That's right, the bushes. Ropes and roots shoot out of the shrubbery and ensnare the bandits nearest them, catching them off guard and throwing them to the ground. The rest of the outlaws, surprised at the suddenness of it all, are attacked by the well-hidden militia that were hiding in the bushes. You kick yourself mentally: you passed right by them!

As far as you can tell, you are the only one not engaged. Should you join the fray and try to help your comrades? Then again, you may be fighting a losing battle. Flight is always a safe option, but there is no guarantee there aren't any traps waiting for you on the way out.
155332221.title: Assault and Ambush

choices: Tied to post, in the middle of square overlooking the river.
On a bed in a prison room, unrestrained but locked in.
1553322211.content:
Rage courses through your body. You and your friends are the most feared bandits in this land, and you're going to bested by a group of militia? Not a chance!

Raising your saber, you charge at the nearest elf and catch him off guard. Contending with his own opponent, he was clearly expecting you to be otherwise engaged. A quick slash to his sword arm proves him wrong. You rush to the next militia men before the first drops his sword.

It seems you have gotten lucky: all of the enemy garrison are occupied with their own duels and don't notice a rampant outlaw that cuts through them uncontested. Even better, each one you take down frees up another bandit ready to help, and some of those begin to free their comrades that were trapped by the bushes.

Still in a blood lust, you slide your weapon into the side of a militia, then turn your blade and open a gash in another defender's forearm. Whilst the injuries aren't enough to kill, they're still big enough to take them out of the fight. After the nasty surprise attack, things are looking up.

But you forgot about the casters on the walls.

Before you know what is happening, you trip over a root that wasn't there five seconds ago and tumble to the ground. More roots quickly encase your body, trapping you in an earthly-grown net of wood. Looking around, you see the same happen to many of the other outlaws, until it is them who are running rampant amongst your allies.

With a crushing feeling of defeat, you don't notice the pommel of the sword flying at your head until it connects, after which you promptly pass out.




Still groggy from the forced sleep, you shake your head to get your bearings. Looking around, you see that your are...
1553322211.title: To Arms!

choices: Tied up in a boat. A priestess is at the hull and you're moving... Upstream?
Bound to a rack, in the middle of a square. Priestesses surround you, chanting.
1553322212.content:
The debate in your head doesn't take very long. In the fight or flight scenario, flight usually wins because it is easier. This appears to be the case right now, as many of your bandit allies have already fallen to the surprise attack. Your body yells at you to run, and you quickly obey the animal instinct that you were gifted with.

Quickly assessing the situation, you decide that the safest course of action would be through the brawl and back into the forest. All the militia are occupied, and you can easily lose pursuers in the forest. Your only other options force you to follow the wall, which isn't fitting with the idea of getting away.

You dash in-between duels, avoiding the occasional stray blade or axe. Thankfully the bushes don't hold any more surprises, and you pass clear on through. You feel a little shame leaving your comrades behind, but knowing them they'd do the same in your position.

After what seems way too long a time you finally make it to the forest. Jumping into the trees, you begin to continue running when something strikes you as odd. The outlaw archers should be here, and yet they aren't. But you swear you saw the volley of fire arrows disappear into the town.

Looking left, you spot an abandoned bow and quiver, seemingly dropped at a moment's notice as the owner ran. You are about to pick up the equipment when you hear a strange noise. It reminds you of something, right at the tip of your tongue. You follow the noise, and remember what the sound reminds you of.

Bound not ten feet from you lies a bandit, one of the archers who supposedly fired the flaming volley. The sounds are coming fro his gagged mouth, and you notice his ankles and wrists are bound tightly as well. This begins to register in your brain as the sign of an ambush, but before you figure out it means there's an enemy here you feel something thick and heavy hit you across the back of your head.

You black out.




Shaking your head to clear it of sleepiness, you look at your surroundings. You are...
1553322212.title: Save Your Own Skin

choices: "Now, fragile woman, we will prepare you for the Tentacled One."
"Now, helpless man, we will prepare you for the Tentacled One."
15533222122.content:
The square is full of people staring at you. Most of them appear to be elves, but groups of humans are scattered throughout the crowd. All seem to have simply stopped with their daily lives just to take a look. One man is hefting a large sack of flour, another is holding a pile of books, a woman is carrying a basket filled with vegetables. You even see some people in the middle of a purchase, vendors and customers, pausing to take a look.

Closer to you, you see a circle of eight elves - all women - chanting in quiet and hushed tones, heads bowed. They are all wearing some sort of robe, with a feathered headress that covers all the face except for the mouth. Each one has a unique silver designed sewn onto a mixture of different shades of blue. The colors remind you of a flowing river,
which suddenly sparks a memory of some ritual they perform in this village. Hazy, something about a... tentacle? The details elude you.

Assessing your situation doesn't take long. Put simply, you are strapped naked to a table structure in the middle of the plaza with your arms and legs stretched to the corners. Not exactly a dignified position.

With bright red cheeks you turn to the nearest person - one of the priestesses - and ask "Why am I here? What's going on?" The priestess simply ignore you continuing with her mumbling. You turn to the other side and repeat your questions to another priestess, and you get the same reaction. Just when you're about to start shouting, the chanting stops.

All around you the priestesses raise their arms, as if beckoning to the sky in a dramatic performance. What they say next isn't in any language you know:

"Hie erit sacrificium nostrum.
Offerimus eum magnam.
Audiat risus.
Gaudeat de dono nostro."

With their little speech done, they slowly begin to walk towards you. The new ring they form is just next to the table, to the point that they can reach out and touch you. Though you can't see their eyes through the headdresses, but you are sure each priestess is staring at you.

At some unspoken command, they shift formation slightly in a way the places four of them on either side of you. Your heart pounds in your chest, anticipating what they might do to you. Did one of them carry a sacrificial knife? Were they going to paint you or something? There was no indication as to their intention, but the silence was broken again by speech.

In unison, the eight elves shouted "Incipere!"

Each of them reach for your naked and exposed form. What they plan becomes apparent when their fingers begin to wiggle slightly, causing you to struggle against your bonds. Were they really planning on tickling you? Thinking back to the crowd, you wonder whether this is public amusement. One would assume not though, otherwise there would be no need for priestesses.

In a desperate attempt to escape the fingers, you yell "Please! I'm sorry! I'll do anything, just don't tickle me! Please!"

At once all eight women turn to face the head of the table. Actually, they are facing someone who has appeared at the head of the table. You look up to see another elf priestess, though this one seems different than the ones on either side of you. Her roves are similar to the other priestess', but they are shades of green with gold designs sewn on. Her headdress also has more feathers and is bigger than the others.

In a voice that holds no mercy, she speaks to you. "You have raided this land, desecrated our forest, and tried to pillage our city. There is no reason we should listen to your pleas." She pauses.
15533222122.title: Bound to a rack, in the middle of a square. Pri...

155332222.content:
The Angels that in habit this reigon of Zienth are actual beings with wings and their kingdom is in the middle of a civil war. One side wants the goverment to stay and they are called the Royals. The other wants and different family to rule and they are called the Nobals. And how did you get mixed up in this, well you where captured by the Royals who love slaves and pets and where taking to their floating fortresses to be sold. And are bought by the royal family as a pet.

Well is this you or are you going to distant lands?
155332222.title: A different destiny...

1553322221.content:
You and the other captives are brought to one of the floating castles, many of the other captives are flown to a courtyard while you and two others are brought to the royal family. The family contains five members,King Galis a well built man clothed in lionskins and eagle-like wings. His queen Mirea a skinny woman with a nice rack, and his children. Fari their first born son, and their two daughters Helia the older and Nea the younger.

As you and the other captives hang from some of the hooks that adorn this room you hear the family arguing who gets which captive. Finally the family flies around you three and begans their inspection. You clench your teeth as you are poked and proded by the family, giggling when one of the girls touched your foot with their wings.

Final when it was finished you were owned by a......
1553322221.title: You have been captured

15533222212.content:
"Dad I want this one!" Helia says pointing at you "I just love how much he giggles when you poke him" she says poking you in the ribs which forces a smirk to appear on your face. Helia is the middle child of the family and by far the prettiest. She has long, brown hair, and brown eyes. She is fairly short with a very athletic looking body. She also seems extraordinarily kind, however very flirty.

"No dad that's not fair! I want that one!" Helia's younger sister yells to her dad.
"No! If anyone deserves them its me!" says the eldest son.
Who Gets you?
15533222212.title: child

155332222121.content:
"Now now kids, Helia asked first so she gets this one. Besides it is her 22nd birthday" says the king. Helia has a large grin on her face, and the two other children look disappointed, however they know better to argue with the king. You are removed from your shackles and Helia leads you out of the room, saying nothing along the way.

Thoughts race through your mind as you worry about what will happen to you. You start to plot out possible escape plans. You could easily overpower this girl, however escaping from her would be difficult seeing as how she could fly. Even if you could out run her, you have no way of getting off of this floating fortress. Your only hope is to hold out and gather some more information before you make your escape.

She leads you to her bedroom. Well if you can call it a room. It actually takes up an entire tower of the castle. On one side of the room is a giant pink bed, with more pillows and stuffed animals. Besides the bed, you see a couch, a large balcony, and lots of bondage equipment. "Well this is my room and this is where you will be staying for most of the time" she says.

"Well now lets have some fun!" she leads you over to the........
155332222121.title: Helia

choices: "I just love having a girl my age to play with."
"I just love having a boy my age to play with."
1553322221211.content:
"Here, lie down on my bed,"she says and gestures towards the stuffed toys and ever so soft looking pillows and sheets. You note how soft and warm the covers feel against your naked skin as you lay yourself down, for the time being obeying the young royal.

She reaches across your body and begins stretching out and tying your limbs to the posts of the canopy bed with silk scarves. The feathers of her wings brush across your body as she does causing you to giggle.

"You have a beautiful giggle," she coos sweetly. She finishes tying the last limb to leave you outstretched and vulnerable and comes I lie on her side beside you.

With her head propped up on her hand she gazes warmly into your eyes. "I'm so glad father let me keep you," she says as a wingtip, soft and almost glowing white sweeps gently up your leg.
1553322221211.title: The Bed

15533222212111.content:
"Heheheh..." You're not that bad looking yourself, though Helia does look a bit nicer. You were never one to trust weapons and your brawn; rather, you were much more into magic. You helped people by summoning water, or freezing things for storage...you'd been passing by this land when you were kidnapped. It was easy to identify the fact you had the magical gift; your hair was naturally long, and more importantly, green. Mages tended to have something different about them; for you, it was your hair. You were rather tall, as well; 6'0, even. You towered over Helia...Well, if you weren't currently tied down. She looked lovingly at you, smiling whenever the tip of her wing caused you to giggle.

"I think I was right to choose you. Normally we don't often keep slaves for long, though...at any time, we are allowed to have one 'permanent' slave. We just make a small rune on their back..." She said softly, running a finger over your neck, "Not that painful, either...and we just acknowledge we chose our 'one'. You are definitely my one. I've never had a girl so giggly and so pretty." She said, before you realized you felt a magical energy on your back.

Welp, there goes any way of getting out easily.

"Perhaps I was hasty...but then again...someone doesn't seem to mind~" She cooed, before you paled.

You were blushing, weren't you? You couldn't help it. You liked women, and despite the situation...this was rather nice. Comfy, too.

Are you sure being a slave is bad when you have a nice cushy bed and a loving owner?
15533222212111.title: Not that bad...

155332222121111.content:
She runs a hand over your stomach, petting you, and whispers, "You have a few minutes, I can wait."

You think back to your old life below the sky. You had the respect of your peers but you wern't known outside work and the guild, and you doubt many would miss you presence. You had little political presence or money, so you really didn't have that much to loose in agreeing to become this royal creatures slave. Infact from what you know about these creatures you would be kept more as a pleasure servant then as a proper work slave, the thought of Helia owning your body stirs something in you.

You realax into the bed and shut your eyes, trying to loosen your stressed joints. "I'll take that as a yes, human?" Helia asks you. You make a smalk knod and Helia collapses besides you on the bed. "It always makes me nervous when we take in a new slave, more so now that I get to have you. You never know how they're going to respond to the loss of their personal liberty. I'm glad I was right about you." The angelic figure monolouged into the room.

Helia turns to you and asks, "I know this is a bit of a shock still, but you seem pretty okay. Do you want to rest awhile before I introduce you to your new life?"
155332222121111.title: Slavery isn't that bad!

1553322221211111.content:
You look at your new owner and carefully reply, "If you really don't mind it Halia, I really do need rest. I've been marching for a few days without many stops."

Helia looks sad but responds, "Understandable enough, i'll show you to your quarters then give you a proper introduction tommorow."

She smoothly goes about untieing you from the bed before helping you off it. She grabs your arm to make sure you don't wonder off as she begins leading you through the large castle. "I had to special request most of my furniture, the last few people who lived in my room were even more sadistic then i was. Though judging by the bed they used you would assume they were machoists." She talks to you as she leads you, "Your bed won't be as nice as mine, the others have their ways to get their slaves to return to their chambers, I prefer making it nicer then your quarters rather than jumping to punitative measures."

She finnaly arrives at the servants quarters and leads you into what seems to be the newest addition. Inside is a small room that consists of a dresser and a bed, with a small barred window to let light in.

She orders you to lie down on the bed then retreives a set of thin undergarments and orders you to put them on. She explains, "While you are serveing me it does not make sense for you to be clothed, but anytime where other servants of the castle may see you while i'm gone its customary to wear these. Wouldn't want any of the others to mis-interpret anything. I'll retrive you in the morning, for now though, sleep well." Her owner left, and she heard the door being locked.

------

True to the princesses word, the bed was quite uncomfortable, and it took quite awhile for her to get to sleep. But when she finally did she had quite the un-eventful night. In the morning she re-stripped and spent her morning examining the make of her new clothing. They were made of some form of slightly uncomfortable black fabric, but they did their job very well and that was all you could really ask for.

You stand to attention as you hear the door being unlocked. Halia steps inside your small room but has to awkwardly fold her wings in a way that looks quite silly, but your not about to state that aloud.

Halia starts, "Good morning pet, ready for your new life? Were going to head back to the my chambers and i'll get you started." She took your hand and lead you through the halls again, "Normally we would do this everyday till i got bored of you, but once you've memorized the path i expect you to be at my chambers around this time."

As you travel through the hallways your nude form scurrying after Halia draws a few eyes which makes you blush, you had come to accept Halia seeing your nude form, but you hadn't expected so many servants to be moving in the hallways. It both excites you and makes you want to get to Halia's chambers all the more sooner.
