Well known were stories of him publicly humiliating his slaves and torturing them for the slightest of offenses. There were also rumors that he forced his slaves to fight to the death or participate in gauntlets of his own design that were usually lethal and always painful. All for his amusement.

Nea on the other hand, looked at you with wonder. Nea wasn't as kind as Helia but nor was she as cruel as Fari. She was said to be a bit bratty, being on the younger side, but you heard that all she really wanted was to see the world and for someone to play with her and treat her like a regular person and not the baby child of the Royal King.

You ended up going to...
155332222122.title: One of the other children

1553322222.content:
On an island far far to the east stands a great pillar of rock, easily the tallest in the world. Called Heaven's Pillar by the locals and the Great Cliff by travelers, it is worshipped as a the staircase to the afterlife. You are a recent addition to this growing religion, seeking solace from your shady past in a new belief. The religion demands odd sacrifices however, and the deities that stop by have peculiar interest in you especially.

Do you really seek solace in religion? Or is your story deeper down?
1553322222.title: Going to distant lands

choices: "Bring her to the shrine of the god Rakshu," she says to the worshippers.
"Bring him to the shrine of the goddess Umia," she says to the worshippers.
15533222221.content:
To the far east, farther than the easter deserts but closer than the Horizon Islands, lies a forest of lush green and bright flowers. This lush vegetation spans all the way to the coast, encompassing more than a fifth of the continent. No nation has ever managed to tame these woods, but people who seek independence have set up towns and posts where once can spend a peaceful life.

On the coast of Nguya on the eastern edge stands a great pillar of stone, reaching high into the sky. No one has ever seen the top, nor has anyone dared try to scale the sleek cliffs in search of it. If the landmark were in some country it would easily be marked as a natural wonder and attract travelers from the entire continent. Instead, the only ones who ever see it are the travelers who wish to venture deep into the forest and the religious humans who believe it is a staircase to heaven.

Their temples are ancient structures of rock, surrounding the great stone tower. Heaven's Pillar they call it, and they worship it as a living entity as well as the gods and goddesses they believe stand watch over it. The temple complex makes a ring around Heaven's Pillar, big enough to support hundreds of believers and have enough room for all the practices and shrines to the many deities.

You find yourself before the rigid stone structure of the temple complex right now, seeking solace from your shady and shameful past in religion. The Worshippers of Heaven's Pillar led comfortable lives despite their constant practices of faith, and every convert is promised to be allowed to ascend in the afterlife. You want to atone, and be promised with utopia in the next world.

The entrance is very cubic, with stone steps leading up to a square open entrance and straight pillars that support the flat roof. Moss grew fervently on the stone walls, but the plant seemed to stay away from the inside of the temple itself. Behind and to either side of you the forest looms, inviting and mysterious. On the far side of the temple, behind Heaven's Pillar, the coast of Nguya stretched left and right as far as the eye could see.

You take a few steps towards the stairs, and uncertainly climb them until you're standing next to the pillars. Before you a large stone passage reaches deep into the building, with several hallways branching off on either side. Unsure of what to do next, you stand there and debate whether you should shout. Fortunately, it seems that they've noticed you as two men in yellow robes walk towards you from one of the hallways.

"Welcome stranger," greeted the young man to your right. His chocolate brown eyes seemed welcoming behind a few wisps of hair that fell in front of them. Black hair covered his ears, and his warm smile helped ease your worries.

"Have you come seeking a place to rest? We Worshippers offer a bed and food for any who need it," says the man to your left, old yet with kind features. A bald scalp crowned a pair of blue eyes, wise and knowledgeable. They seemed to whisper to you, years of faith and religion.

Standing in front of these two, it is suddenly much harder to speak your mind. "I, um, I wish to join the Worshippers of Heaven's Pillar," you say, shy for some reason.

If anything, their smiles grow even wider. "Then follow us, stranger, that we may bring you before the High Priestess," instructs the elderly man, who then turns and begins walking deeper within the temple. The other man beckons to follow, and soon the three of you are walking down the large passageway.

Skylights in the roof of the structure admits the radiant sunshine into the ancient stone building. Lit by the natural light, all kinds of wall art line the passage: murals, mosaics, carvings. Pictures of Heaven's Pillar and its reverent worshippers cover both walls. However, amongst them are depictions of worshippers laughing, bound in different positions and structures. In these pictures, other worshippers seem to be tickling the captives along with... something else. Larger beings that are shown differently than the worshippers; some with multiple arms, some with hair that moves, some that have tentacles. Curious creatures of which the likes you've never seen.

At the end of the hall you see another doorway, probably leading to your destination. The worshippers lead you through into what looks like a throne room. Opposite where you entered is an enormous statue of a six-armed woman, hands open and lifted. The eyes seem to be made of emeralds, glowing green on a gorgeous stone face, hair falling all the way to the floor. Her robe looks much like the robes of the worshippers, except with designs written across the sash.

Looking down, you correct your analysis. The only quality this place shares with a throne room is the size. Carvings line the walls, all with similar depictions as those in the passage outside. No throne, or chair for that matter, exists within the room. Instead, where a throne would normally be place is a circular pool of water, shimmering with reflected sunshine from the skylight. A figure is kneeling before it, head bowed and silent.

The two men who led you here kneel and bow, assuming a posture similar to the person before the pool of water. "High Priestess," begins the youthful man. "A traveler has come in hopes of converting."

Standing up, the woman who you assume is the High Priestess turns and looks at you. Her face bears a startling likeness to the statue's, with green eyes and long brown hair almost reaching the floor. Gorgeous features examine you, your traveler's attire, your weary body. A solid expression turns soft, and her voice is sweeter than honeycomb.

"Welcome to the Temple of Heaven's Pillar traveler," she says with authority. "Many have traveled far to join us, though none as far as you seem to have. Are you from beyond the forest?"

"Yes High Priestess," you answer. "I've led a shameful life of thieving and lying, a life I wish to leave behind." You kneel and bow like the others have done. "Please, I will devote the rest of my life to Heaven's Pillar if I may be granted forgiveness."

A smile forms on the High Priestess' lips as she turns to face the enormous statue and pool of shining water. "Heaven's Pillar is a staircase for many gods and goddesses, those who watch over it and carry those who passed from this world up into utopia. To each of these deities we have built a shrine within our temple, each containing an idol of their physical form."

The woman kneels and looks into the water before continuing. "Today, you will be brought before one such idol. Left alone in the shrine, you will confess your shame to the deity and ask forgiveness. Worshippers will come to get you at dawn, by which you will either be marked or left unscathed. This will reveal whether the gods and goddesses accept you."

Nodding, you hope that whichever god or goddess that judges you will be forgiving. Before you, the two robed men stand in preparation yet keep their heads bowed in respect. You do the same, eager to start what you hope is the ritual which will grant you sanctuary from your past.

Staring deep into the pool, the High Priestess takes a moment before declaring which shrine you will be brought to.
15533222221.title: The Worshippers of Heaven's Pillar

choices: Rakshu comes to life, wrapping you in his feathered coils
You hear Rakshu's voice in your head, and anything he says feels real
155332222211.content:
The followers gesture for you to follow them as they take you down a long hallway to the Shrine of Rakshu. The two robed men you follow smile at you kindly, but say nothing. The silence is almost eerie, although it must be a sacred moment for them, and you maintain the silence. They reach a heavy stone door, and opening it, wait for you to enter. As you enter, the robed men shut the door heavily behind you, leaving you alone in the shrine.

Looking around, the shrine seems lavish. The floor is carpeted by a fuzzy rug, perhaps made from some kind of wool. On the walls of the large room are torches, keeping the shrine lit and warm. In the center of the room is a large statue, presumably of the god Rakshu. He is not like what you expected. His form is not one of a man, but of an animal. He is a gigantic snake, adorned with feathers across his body. Coiled and facing your direction, the gigantic serpent god rears back, revealing an open mouth and lolling forked tongue. The eyes are made of some reflective jewel, perfectly round and smooth. There is a hypnotic quality to them, something that makes you unable to look away...

Remembering why you've come, you bow before Rakshu and begin describing your sins to him. You tell him of the thefts you've committed, all the lies, the deceit, the pain you've inflicted on others... the litany pours from you. You've perfected this list in your head throughout your journey here, and despite your nervousness at being presented to this large god, you speak it easily.

Having spoken all you can think of, you stand there, silently. You want to shift nervously, but realize you cannot move! Somehow, you are stuck in place, unable to even tear your gaze from the hypnotic eyes of Rakshu. There's something comforting about his eyes, something that saps your will to even try and resist your immobilization. You await for Rakshu to respond to you.
155332222211.title: "Bring her to the shrine of the god Rakshu,...

1553322222111.content:
You start to panic, but Rakshu stares at you and tells you to be calm and asks if you wants forgiveness. You nodded your head slowly has he continues to wrap himself around you. He smiles and then asks you to raise your arms. You stare at him and meekly ask why and he says that he needs an opening for his power to flow through. You start to raise your arms when he wraps around the wrists and moves his head down to your armpits and says be free of sin.

You feel a tickling sensation on your left armpit that makes you giggle slightly. As Rakshu continued to trial his tongue over your armpits your giggling turned into full blow laughter. Then the feathers on Rakshu's body start to tickle you as well. This drives you insane in laughter and you blackout.

Later you awake in a room with.....
1553322222111.title: Rakshu comes to life, wrapping you in his feath...

15533222221112.content:
The serpent is about six and a half feet long, with pinkish-orange scales and a large glowing plum of feathers at the tail's end.

"Hello," you say "who are you?" You ask puzzeled at this new serpent's appearance.

"Greetings mistress," the serpent states "I'm Heas your Guardian Serpent"

You give the snake a puzzeled look inviting him to explain further.

Sighing it speaks again "I'm here to protect you from those who would harm you, keep you on the right path, and" Heas smirked "humor you."

However your mind goes into a panic, who would want to hurt you and were you really safe here. Heas sensing your distress is quick to calm you.

"Shush my mistress I will let no one harm you." Heas states as his body warps its coils around your form. Instead of the cold embrace you were expecting his "hug" felt like a warm blanket, and you nearly lose yourself in it when you hear the sound of both your sandels falling off. You open your eyes to see a sheepish Heas facing you, you grin humorously and speak.

"So you like my feet eh" You say and Heas blushes while nodding. "Well what are you waiting for?" you ask. And with that Heas strikes, his feathers glide across your bare sole sending you into pure ecstasy of laughter which contains for a good deal of time. Finally Heas finished lets you go and speaks.

"Well my mistress would you like to go to the dinning hall or shall we have some more fun" Heas asks.
15533222221112.title: Another serpent

155332222211121.content:
You and Heas exit the room and enter a large hallway which was decorated with a fresco of beings and snakes in many different adventures and activities. While you might have liked to admire the paintings Heas kept urging you on with quick little tickles which brought giggles to your mouth. following Heas and trying miserable to doge his tail feathers, both of you finally enter into the dinning hall.

It looked more like a Nordic mead hall than a proper feast hall, but you didn't get much time to look around as Heas dragged you down in time to dodge a piece of food being thrown at them. You glare at Heas as you get up as if to ask if this hapens frequently, to which he smiles weakly.As you two try to move around the battle and try and get your food you can not help but notice the two who seemed to start this mess.

One was a minor gaint standing about 8ft high dressed like a simple friar in a midnight claock with pricks of light on it as he threw gaint portions of food at his "enemy" a harpy. The harpy was dressed in a gold mail suit with a belt that had two empty holes in it. As the harpy dodged most of the food thrown at him until a gaint roast hit him square on the chest.

Suddenly the hall got peaceful as the winner helped his foe up and they both returned to their seats. You finally fix your plate and see that the only two seats are next to the giant and the harpy, just your luck you thought grumbling towards......
155332222211121.title: Dinner

choices: Confess to me now, if you can.
155332222212.content:
The followers gesture for you to follow them as they take you down a long hallway to the Shrine of Umia. The two robed men you follow smile at you kindly, but say nothing. The silence is almost eerie, although it must be a sacred moment for them, and you maintain the silence. They reach a heavy stone door, and opening it, wait for you to enter. As you enter, the robed men shut the door heavily behind you, leaving you alone in the shrine.

The shrine is cool, and a drafty breeze flows through it, causing goosebumps to rise across your body, making you wish you had dressed for the cool room. The floor is strewn his lavish pillows in a haphazard manner, perhaps as gifts to Umia. The priestess never did tell you what Umia was the goddess of... sleep? comfort? luxury? It's impossible to tell from the room itself. Looking to the center of the room is a statue of Umia herself.

She is made slightly larger than lifesize, at least if she were a normal woman, perhaps 10 feet (3m) tall. She seems to be made of marble, and is shaped as a beautiful woman. Umia wears a small garment over her shoulders that comes just down to her chest, exposing the underside of her shapely breasts. Her midsection is bare, revealing a slender, curvaceous figure. A many faceted emerald fits snugly in her navel, glittering attractively. A long skirt hangs low on her hips, and covers her legs down to her ankles. Her feet are bare, each with an anklet of feathers or leaves. The statue is painted, her skin a pink-red, her clothing a pure white, her eyes the deepest brown-black. She reminds you of goddesses of love and beauty in other parts of the world. Maybe that's it?

But her most notable feature is her hair. Her long black locks are tied in many braids, each descending to mid thigh. Some fall down her back, others in the front to either side of her face. There must be... eight of the long braids. As you stare at the incredible statue, you notice the braids are starting to move and writhe! Her hair coming to life, and the statue of Umia itself begins to move in front of you. Umia stretches as if awakening from a long nap, the alluring view presented making you blush. She then sets her eyes on you.

"You are the newest of my followers." She says to you in a voice sweet as honey, its sound music in your ears. She doesn't appear to be asking, but rather telling you. Umia takes a step towards you, her hips swaying, and tells you to...
155332222212.title: "Bring him to the shrine of the goddess Umia

choices: In a mind-world where Umia's will shapes existence.
Wrapped up tightly in the blankets in Umia's shrine.
1553322222122.content:
The green stone glints preciously from Umia's abdomen, and you suddenly find yourself drained of the conviction the lead you here. "But goddess," you protest quietly, "I came to confess, to seek forgiveness, to-"

"I'm well aware of what you came here to do newcomer, for it is the same for every person who steps within this shrine on their first time." Umia's rich voice sounds slightly irritated, a hard thing to do with a voice as gorgeous as hers. "They continually insist on speaking the long list of misdeeds they have done, then spend twice as long repenting each one. I have looked into your heart mortal, and have already judged you more than worthy to join the worshippers here. What you have done in the past matters little; it is what you will do here that you will be remebered for."

Head swimming with all this unexpeted information, you find the sense of mind to ask one question that particularly stuck out amongst your thoughts. "Does that mean that you can see my future Lady Umia? Are you the goddess of foresight?"

Siting cross-legged on a nearby pile of rugs, Umia replies, "No I am not. The goddess of foresight is a lovely soul, but she is on the other side of the complex. No, I simply read the spirit essences that surround you. I cannot say exactly what you will do or when they will happen, but you will do great things here. Now enough talk about the future, come, sit with me." With one giant arm she beckons to a comfortable pillow in fron of her, which you reluctantly it upon. "My request has not hanged mortal: kiss my emerald, and receive the Mark of Love."

Still unsure about how event are unfolding, you hesitate at the thought of doing something so intimate to a statue. A look of annoyance grows on Umia's face, and in the end you decide it would be best to stay on the goddess' good side. Leaning in deeply, you plant a kiss on the sparklin emerald, which immediately shine brighter than the day. At once afterwards your vision blacks and you fall unconscious.

You wake...
1553322222122.title: Change of Pace

choices: You awake still in the dream world; your test with Umia still continues.
You awake in Umia's shrine, now bearing her mark of Love on your palm.
15533222221221.content:
What you see is both puzzling and frightening. Instead of awakening in Umia's shrine, you find yourself in a sort of mind-world, with blue mist hiding anything farther than three feet. Of course you've heard of such things before, people able to retreat to a reality that only exists in their mind and invite themselves to others'. You've had a run in with a sorceress who could perform such a feat, and the result was very embarrassing. Looking around for Umia, who you assume is the one who brought you here and therefore present as well, you find nothing but the black ground and blue haze.

"You are about to undergo a trial mortal." Umia's voice booms from every direction at once. "Well, we call it a trial but it's really more just something we do to initiates who want to join. There is no challenge, no goal except to experience what I want you to. And where we are right now it will be hard for you not to." This time her voice has a definite direction. "My kind and I have been obsessed for the past few millennia with an activity which you humans call 'tickling'."

A shadow looms just beyond your vision, and despite your best attempts to peer through the mist the shape is still well-shrouded. "We use it as an activity to bring happiness to our worshippers and for them to bring happiness to each other. Thus we have also implemented it into many of our rituals as well, so that whenever the worshippers practice brining happiness to each other they are honoring us. We feed off of your laughter mortal. We grow strong with the expression of pure joy."

Gradually, you feel yourself being raised into the air. The mist between you and Umia disperses, leaving you to face the goddess' gaze unprotected. As her marvelous eyes look warmly at you, you become aware of all your clothes melting off of your body and falling endlessly into the blackness below until they are out of sight. Your limbs are spread apart, giving full access for the goddess.

"And so we begin your acceptance trial initiate. Your task: enjoy what is to come. If you cannot, then it would be unwise for you to stay here.” With that her hair begins to animate, each braid wriggling and writhing as if only slowly becoming aware of its new life. Once they are done, they move around like snakes, slithering through the air towards you. If one is too short to go any further, the braid continues anyway as if it were pulling more hair from the goddess' head to replace what was there before. Soon Umia has all eight of her braids extending towards you, nearly upon your helpless body.

Before they strike, you quickly go over what Umia just said. There wasn't anything in the rumors that involved tickling, at least not in the rumors surrounding this temple. You've heard stories that their practices seem strange for religious rites, but you have never until now guessed what they might be. The mere thought of being tickled is enough to send you into a bout of shivers, as you have had more experience with it than you would like. There have been numerous times on your voyage here where you found yourself short of money and needed to make strange agreements with the inn owners involving tickling, and even further back your weakness has always been exploited by the other very young pickpockets to bully you around, not to mention that a lot of the time the most popular punishment in an isolated town is tickling by the people in a pair of stoks in the village center.

So to see these eight braids approach you with tickling as their intent scares you greatly.

You squeeze your eyes shut, dreading each second that the 'trial' may begin. Almost a minute passes, yet nothing happens. Slowly, you open your eyes to see that Umia's braids have stopped in their approach. The goddess herself looks at you with concern in her eyes. "What is it mortal?" she asks in her oh so sweet voice, laden with worry. "I sense anticipation, but whereas in most I feel a sense of giddiness, you emanate fear and distress instead. Why do you find tickling frightening?"

And so you explain your history concerning the activity to the goddess with great trepidation and solemnity. After recounting your multiple unpleasant experiences with it, Umia nods comprehensively. "I see. So because people have used it as a tool against you, the fear of losing something to a thief evolved into a fear of tickling. The remedy is simple: we just need to separate loss and tickling again. Unfortunately, the easiest way to do that would be for you to experience tickling at my hands."

Suddenly, without any pretext or warning, Umia's eight long braids jump into action. As you begin to erupt in laughter, you can't help but find pleasure in the silky touches of the goddess' hair, which feel so incredibly soft and luxurious like gentle furs. However, those silky soft touches are exploring every ticklish nook and cranny of your exposed form. Strands of hair slip their way in-between toes, up and down arches, across your ribs and sides, exploring your armpits, and venturing into your navel and the surrounding tender area.

Despair and panic soon ensue, and you feel all your worst fears come to light as your nightmares become reality. Or perhaps, as this is only a mind-world, this is one of your nightmares and you are simply living it. Regardless, all that pent up anxiety is now released, pushing you closer to the realm of Madness than you ever have before. Struggling is impossible entirely, as the will of the goddess prevents even the slightest movement. Wishes of death nearly spring to mind, but before they do a miracle occurs.

Instead of riding your wave of anxiety all the way to Madness, you feel it drain away into another realm. This realm is foreign to you, and you do not yet know in which of the gods' domain you find yourself. All your fears and phobias, all your distraught emotions instantly dry up upon gushing into the realm. Even though you are unable to identify your location, you feel a familiar presence. It is Umia. Suddenly, a phrase she said runs through your mind: "Kiss my emerald, and receive the mark of Love."

Now you begin to understand what has happened, and more importantly where you are. Because your parents passed away when you were a mere child, you have not been to this place for years and years. Here, fear and madness dry up and wither, disappearing in the overwhelming essence of this realm. Instead of the tickling pushing you to Madness, it has brought you to Love; Umia's domain. As this thought rings true in your head, you hear the goddess speak though her lips never move. "The High Priestess knew to send you to me. It is no coincidence that you have become my follower. You unknowingly desired this forever, as much as you desired forgiveness. So here you are in my realm once again. Welcome back."

This newfound discovery, along with a sudden urge to thank and please the goddess, changes your panic from the tickling to joy. After finding Umia's realm again, you love and cherish every second her hair explores your most sensitive areas. Your laughter, once tinted with dismay, now reverberates about the mind-world with happiness ringing in every note. As the revelation washes over your body, you shudder and, unable to take such amounts of a new feeling, pass out from the pleasure.
15533222221221.title: Trials and Discoveries

choices: "You are to meet with the High Priestess so that she may welcome you."
"I am to bring you to the section of this complex assigned to Umia's followers."
155332222212212.content:
You stir as if awakening from a deep sleep. Upon opening your eyes, you find yourself huddled in the goddess' lap, staring at the sparkling emerald nestled in her navel. Slowly, you let your eyes wander up to meet her's, and she smiles radiantly. You find her size and proximity a little intimidating, but you blush as you think of how intimate this instance is.

"Do not feel ashamed," Umia assures you, the sweetness of her voice a welcome sound. "It was I, not you, who placed you here. Even though my followers have generously and lavishly decorated my shrine, I still think my lap is more comfortable. Do you not agree?"

Flushing more madly than ever, you nod meekly and slowly crawl onto the lush carpets and pillows. The goddess chuckles at your reaction, causing your cheeks to burn even brighter red. Kneeling, you face the goddess and begin to bring your head to the ground in an act of worship and gratitude, but Umia waves her hand disapprovingly.

"No, please do not. Unlike the stuck up gods of the other pantheons, we do not ask for servitude or sacrifice. Frankly I find both practices insulting: humankind owes no more allegiance to us than to the air they breathe or the ground they walk on, and to sacrifice in the name of eternal life is hypocritical at best. Simply by giving others joy in the way I gave you is more than enough to honor me."

"Thank you goddess," you say reverently, bowing your head slightly until she beckons for you to stop that as well. "You truly are benevolent if that is all you ask for. And you have my eternal gratitude for leading me back to your realm again. If there is anything I can do to please you, I would be honored if you allowed me the privilege of doing so."

Again Umia chuckles, extending a hand and brushing your cheek. Once more you feel your face flare furiously, but you force yourself to remain still despite your surprise and embarrassment. "Oh you are so innocent!" she giggles gleefully. "It will be refreshing to have someone like you around. Yes, I will not hesitate to talk with you my loyal follower."

Before you can respond, there comes three careful taps at the door.

"It would look as if the time for your trial is finished. I have enjoyed our first meeting initiate, and look forward to when we will meet face to face again. Now you leave this room forever, and join the those who worship Heaven's Pillar."

Shock and curiosity flash through your mind. "Forever? But how will I see you? When will I see you? I don't want to leave if-"

A soft and gentle finger is pushed against your lips, quieting you. "Hush, my avid worshipper. It gladdens me that you do not wish to leave my side, but you must go meet the others - the worshippers and the gods. Do not worry, we will see each other again. Until we do, I say farewell and good luck to you."

Standing, Umia returns to the podium on which she was standing when your first entered her shrine. She mounts it, faces the door, and resumes her original position. Just when you think she's frozen again, she winks at you and adds, "Oh yes, and welcome to the temple."

At that exact moment the door opens and in walks a monk from before. It is the older one, whose knowing eyes regard you intently. "So, did you receive Umia's mark?" he asks.

You quickly shift your eyes to the goddess. Not once since before your trial had either of you mentioned the mark. She obviously meant for you to join, but you did not know exactly whether she actually bestowed the mark upon you. "Uhh..."

Without missing a beat, the old man approaches you and takes your right hand. Ignoring the puzzled look on your face, he flips your hand over and spreads your fingers. "Ah, so not only have you been accepted, it seems that you are favored by her as well." You have no idea what he means, that is until you follow his gaze and see the emerald embedded in your palm. It spans most of the surface, yet as you run your fingers across it you feel the warm flesh of your digits while the fingers feel only gemstone. It is unnerving to be honest.

"Most only receive a tattoo. To be blessed with one of Umia's emeralds... And you're only an initiate!" The old man shakes his head in wonder. "In all my years, never has one so young received any deity's favored mark. Anyway young man..."
155332222212212.title: Her Mark

choices: "Old Paul will show you your chamber."
1553322222122121.content:
While you fidget with your new gemstone, the old monk leads you from the shrine and towards the chamber where the High Prietess met you yesterday. Outside, the dawn filters through the thick trees and leaves, shining slits of light on the forest floor. Through the south-facing windows you see spots of color in the thick jungle that engulfs the temple. The dense vegetation has made the temple hard to find, meaning that many a traveler has walked right by it without noticing, as even Heaven's Pillar is difficult to see through the canopies. Such was the rampant growth of the forest.

You arrive in the chamber to find the High Priestess by the pool again, kneeling in the exact same position she was when you first saw her. Near the western entrance are two slivers of light cast by the rising sun, with the shadow of Heaven's Pillar cast right in-between them. From the southern entrance, the giant statue sits to your right at the top of a small yet very wide flight of stairs, resting on it's own sort of podium. The circular pool at which the High Priestess is kneeling seems to shine with reflected light in front of the depiction of the enormous goddess, whose emerald eyes seem to sparkle as well.

Wait, reflect, sparkle? There are braziers on either side of the chamber - big ones too - but they aren't lit. The only light is coming from the specks cast by the sun, and there isn't enough for the gemstones or the water to be shining nearly as much as they are. Looking at your emerald you see it too is faintly illuminated. Perhaps there is some source of energy, godly or otherwise, that is keeping these things alight?

"So you are favored by Lady Umia. Such a curious man, to receive her emerald upon initiation."

During your contemplation, it appears that the monk has ascended the steps and talked with the High Priestess, who is now standing and facing you. Unsure of how to respond, you stammer and start for a second before collecting your wits enough to give a proper response.

"I don't know much about that," you confess rather uselessly. "Er, this gemstone is a bit awkward. Will it stay in my palm forever?"

"Yes, that emerald will be with you for life," informs the High Priestess. "It may feel uncomfortable at first, but you will get used to it. Besides, the powers it provides will undoubtedly outweigh the annoyance."

She turns to the monk at that point and nods. Apparently it's a practiced routine, for the monk promptly bows and leaves the room. Once he's gone, you hear the priestess sigh as she sits on the steps, seemingly exhausted. "You truly are fascinating. Converts are very rare, and on top of that you were blessed on your initiation. It is almost as if the gods themselves called you here."

You frown, puzzled over something the High Priestess said. "If it is rare to find a convert, than where do the worshippers come from?"

She shrugs. "Most are born here. To be honest, I was surprised when Old Paul and Kurosa said you wanted to convert. So where did you come from and why did you come here?" Crossing her legs, she leans forward intently as if she were a child being told a story.

"Well, I was born in Eisbrecher, far to the northwest, but I didn't stay for very long. I had just turned five when my parents died to a disease that was common among the poor in those mountains. A traveling fur merchant named Gustaf took pity on me and let me travel with him." You close your eyes, remembering what happened next.

"It was during one of his journeys around Coninze that I began thieving. Just small-time stuff in remote villages in the northern countryside, but I kept it up. I was nine when Gustaf found out where the extra coins were coming from. He told me that I would have to stop or he'd get in trouble, but I didn't listen. Two days later I was caught stealing a family heirloom from the village chief. Gustaf took the blame and was locked up because of me."

The memories come rushing back, all the harsh lessons you never learned. Umia may not have wanted to hear it, but it seems that you are reciting the sins you forced yourself to relive on your way here.

"That should've given me pause but I couldn't stop myself. After stealing in the Coninze countryside for several years I made my way to New Forazio, where I became more bold and foolish. It was sometime later that I came to my senses, remembering Gustaf and what he offered me. He let me escape a life of poverty, and in return I sent him to prison. Not once did he get angry with me, and I finally understood how hard it was for him."

The High Priestess, who until now had been running her fingers through her incredibly long hair, leans back and cocks her head to one side. "But why did you decide to come all the way out here?"

You shrug. "I gathered a lot of rumors about the various faiths that would forgive me. Yours sounded the least painful, and besides you have the giant tower of rock to prove it."

Standing, the High Priestess smiles at you. "Thank you for telling me. I didn't expect you to really, but it's nice to have an honest and trusting person around. I formally welcome you to the Worshippers of Heaven's Pillar, follower of Umia. Now..."
1553322222122121.title: Meet the High Priestess

choices: You decide to go exploring around the temple for a bit.
A woman with an emerald tattoo on her palm appraoches you.
15533222221221212.content:
Upon being called by the High Priestess, the old monk who led you here, who you assume is Paul, returned and kneeled before her. "Take our newest worshipper to the chambers where Umia's followers rest." The High Priestess turns back to regard you, green eyes sparkling. "Thank you for talking. Whilst you may not have felt anything change, your initiation is now complete." With this, she returns to kneeling by the pool, arms held out in silent prayer.

Old Paul beckons, and you follow him quietly out the door. In fact, it appears you are heading back in the same direction of Umia's shrine. As if reading your thoughts, Paul explains. "Only converts and Senior Priests set foot inside th shrine, this is true, but the Followers of Umia take up residence in chambers around the shrine."

That makes sense. This is confirmed when you recognize the doors to the shrine up ahead but instead take a left away from it. Now small chambers line the corridor, each one only about a dozen square meters. Inside each of them is a shelf, a bedside table, and a rug with a glorious emerald woven in it. You assume that this indicates to whom these rooms are allocated. Thinking back to your initiation, you puzzle a bit on what the High Priestess said. Even though nothing felt different, you were initiated. "Paul," you begin, "what did the High Priestess do to initiate me?"

The old man chuckles. "It is not for me to tell you. All converts ask that, but that's only because they do not understand our ways. Here, we believe that a person is defined by their memories. The human body is only a tool that we use to experience the world and add to it. We create, we experience, we discover. Yet everything we do is a part of our memories, ourselves. I can say no more, lest I give away comepletely the point of your private chat with the High Priestess." And so, left with more questions than answers, you follow Paul through the halls a little confused.

He stops outside one of the chambers and faces you. "This will be your room," he explains. "What you put in it and what you do inside is entirely up to you. Keep in mind that beause of the nature of this temple, there is nothing to bar entry or exit nor is there anything you can hide your room with. This is to uphold one of our beliefs: what we experience, we let others experience freely. You cannot keep anything to yourself besides your memories - everything else we share amongst the rest of our family." So the price of peace was privacy. Not a horrible deal, but a good amount less than you were hoping for.

You stop Paul before he can leave. "Wait, what am I supposed to do? Are there any rituals that I must attend to? Any responsibilities, any chores?"

Smiling warmly, the elderly man looks into your eyes with his piercing blue ones. How young those eyes look, you think. "You have aresponsibility to share what you an with the rest of the Followers of Umia, if not all the worshippers. You have the responsibility to make sure that you work honestly for the good of the Worshippers as a whole. You have the responsibility to bring joy to others as Lady Umia has brought joy to you. You have the responsibility to experience that joy, for you and for the rest of us. How you go about that is yours to decide." Old Paul bows slightly. "Until next time, initiate."

Left alone, you wonder a little about what exactly the old man meant. More than a little of your wondering was whether the old man liked speaking indirectly. What it sounded like was that as long as you shared other people's joy and burdens, you wouldn't have to worry. Of course, the circles that Old Paul talked in didn't make much sense.
15533222221221212.title: Welcome

choices: One of the ritual rooms, with several worshippers taking part
A large chamber with idols to the deities of a certain pantheon
155332222212212121.content:
You spot a set of robes folded on your new bed, and quickly change into them before putting away your old clothes. They're the only thing you've worn since setting out to find this isolated temple, so whilst you dislike the thought of wearing them again you feel strangely attached to the near-rags that you've traveled in for weeks. You can't say you dislike your new robes however; they're made of something that's as smooth and light as silk, a nice feature to have outside when the sun is high and its heat strikes you full force. Like everyone else's you've seen so far, the sleeveless vestments are yellow with a red sash draped from your right shoulder to your left hip. Some richer people you've known (or stolen from rather) would've paid a lot of money for something as exotic as this.

Searching the floor and mat, you find no alternate footwear to go along with your new clothes. Actually, you don't recall anyone else wearing shoes or sandals either, and wonder whether enyone does. Of course you have no complaints as you slip off the worn boots that carried you the entire way here, flexing your feet as if freed from a prison.

Walking out of your new room with your new look into your new life, you feel... new. This entire temple is your home now, the worshippers your family. Speaking of which, you should probably explore your home and talk to your family. Outside the temple looked enormous, inside it looks complicated to navigate. You'll likely have to ask your way back here for a while before you finally familiarize yourself with the place. You return to the main hallway that leads to Umia's shrine and look at the large double doors. Despite yourself, you're quite tempted to open the doors to take just a peak at your new Goddess, but you refrain from doing so.

Instead, you take a random hallway leading deeper into the complex. You try to remember which turns you make, but after a while just give up. It's much more fun to get lost - that way you need to talk to people to find your way back. Before you can get too lost however, you stumble into...
155332222212212121.title: Lets Get Lost!

1553322222122121211.content:
On one wall there is a small shrine to one of the many deities that the temple worships. Since you're new here you have no idea who it might be or what it holds power over, but the carving depicts a strange being: a mass of branches and roots, with two root tree trunks as his legs. Leaves decorate his form, and on either side of his body the branches intertwine to make long arms. He might be the god of nature, but the eye throws you off a bit.

Although a quick look at the ritual reinforces the idea of nature. The ritual itself was what you expected it to be, tickling, but the device restraining the worshipper was very intricately made. Supported by a metal base shaped like a tree trunk, the rest of the restraint grows out of it in the shape of metallic tree branches and sticks. It's so beautifully done that it'd be in a museum were it in any big city.

In this detailed restraint sits a nearly nude woman, the furniture forcing her limbs to point at the four corners of the room while arching her back to open up as much of her torso as possible. Two other worshippers were tickling her breathless, a man on her right and another woman on her left. Using only their fingers they searched relentlessly for new ways to torture their victim, kneading her hips or digging into her armpits. A little embarrassed, you sort of hang back in the shadow of the entrance, away from the light cast by the braziers.

Suddenly a blue flash shines from the engraved deity's eye, and the worshippers stop torturing the restrained woman. To your amazement, the metal structure begins to move! The branches withdraw and shift until the woman inside is sitting why looks to be simply a fancy chair. The other woman's hands her her robes, and the former victim gets dressed. All three bow before the altar, then file out one by one.

Just as the woman tickler was about to leave she stopped. Turning her head slowly towards you, she sees you standing there in the passageway a little confused. Smiling widely, she walks over and takes you hand. "Welcome newcomer," she said, "to an altar of Rawst, god of growth. He watches us with his single eye, seeing us grow, observing our maturation. Nothing else please him as much as seeing his followers grow."

"Grow how?" you ask.

The woman's smile turned absolutely radiant. "In any way at all. He loves watching the worshippers grow physically, mentally, emotionally. He's even satisfied if our love for tickling grows. And just because you are not his follower does not mean you cannot be blessed by him. Come, I will perform the ritual."

Before you know exactly what's going on, the woman grabs you and pulls you over to the chair. "Wait!" you yell. "You mean I'm going to be tickled?"

Always smiling, the priestess nods. "That is the ritual of every god and goddess.Sometimes the manner is different, but it is always the release of laughter. Now please undress - it would make this much easier and more comfortable."
1553322222122121211.title: First Ritual

155332222212212122.content:
"Hi there', she says, "My name is Aluae and I hear you are the newest convert."

As she talks you quickly take in her features. Her hair is a golden blonde and her skin is without a blemish, curves in all the right places that show even through her robes, and her voice had the sweetest tone as if she was an angel of Umia.

"So whats your name?" Aluae says, snapping you back to reality you tell your name and she laughs an oh so swwet laugh and askes a question.

"So the gods have taken up tickling and we are to share joys with each other, Im guessing because you have the Mark you enjoy tickling alot, am I right?"

Not wanting to lie, you say flat out "Yes I do......alot" suprised by your sudden honesty you go into an akward silence for awhile

"Good so do you want to be tickled or do you want to tickle me?" she said suddenly which put a look of surprise on your face

"Excuse me?" you ask puzzeled

"Sorry Im very forward but you didnt answer my question I love tickling and being tickled so Im fine either way" Aluae said

"Well I guess.......
155332222212212122.title: A woman with an emerald tattoo on her palm appr...

choices: Stay at her feet for awhile
1553322222122121221.content:
"All right I was hoping you would do that!" Aluae says excited as ever

"Ok where to start though?" You ask, and in wasting little time she plops her shoed feet on your lap and says " Right there on my feet they are so ticklish."

"All right then" you say and pull off her shoes but see a pair of socks. Not waiting any longer you test her by tracing an index finger on each sole, the result is a fit of giggles from Alaue

"Hehehehehehehehe hey hehehehe that tickles but you shehehehehould thehehehake mhehehy socks off" she tries to say through her laughter.

Heeding her request you remove her socks and notice her feet are as beautiful as she is, not surprising but still.

Now for the fun part you think and spider tickle her feet

She loses it

Ticklish laughter erupts from her as you go up and down left and right on her feet

HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA OH MAN HAHAHAHAAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA THAT TICKLES AHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAH
not once does she say stop and this goes on for at least an hour but you decide to give her a break

"Wow that was fun but wher will I be tickled next?" she asked not wanting this to end.
1553322222122121221.title: "......I'll tickle you"

15533222222.content:
Miles beneath the surface of Zenith lies the town of Ruken, with a small population of about a few hundred people. Living is very different underground, as meat is hard to come by and everyone has pale skins due to lack of sunlight. You were a crazy kid, always going out on some adventure or other. Now you seek the surface world, stumbling into weird creatures with weirder intentions along the way.

... Or are you already on the surface of Zenith?
15533222222.title: Deeper down

155332222221.content:
In the entire history of Zenith, few people are able to brave the unknown. Those that do are known forever, like the man who first wove necromancy out of death and pure darkness or the woman who established the borders of a small yet prospering mining and crafting country nestled in a northern valley. However, one such explorer has achieved a near-impossible feat, and yet she has never been talked about.

She managed to set up a town underground. Not only that, she has managed to find a sustaining way of life deep under the surface.

The herculean feat was downplayed though, and over time the surface dwellers have forgotten about the pioneers below the ground. Despite the lack of support from higher up, the town managed to dig more tunnels and find more caverns, flourishing into a small country. The underground world became that of prosperity, though very different from that of the surface.

The generations born under the ground were extremely pale due to lack of light, and the young were weaker because the protein was in the things they didn't want to eat. They were also extremely sensitive because they never experienced wind or battle, though as they grew older and used stone more often they became callouses and tough. Stand a surface dweller next to someone from the underground, it would be hard to recognize them as the same species.

Yet, even when the underground was all but forgotten by the surface dwellers, stories of the surface in the underground grew and grew. Tales of a giant fire in an open sky, a place where the ground is green, and buildings are made from wood instead of stone. So many unbelievable tales, but no one underground has ever seen this so-called sky.

You decide you will be the first. Having grown up in the small town of Ruken, the first town set up beneath the surface, the rumors of open space and green ground were always around you. It is a place of discovery and creativity, with no boundaries and people who were tall and strong. You've carried these dreams since childhood, and now that you're old enough to set out on your own, you plan to find the surface and reconnect the two peoples.

Having set aside some provisions for the journey, you step back to take stock. Enough food and water to last a week, some torches and matches, digging tools should you get trapped, and a short dirk should the need to defend yourself arise. You are going alone on this quest, so no need to worry about anyone else's back.

"Are you all set?"

Turning, you see your uncle enter the carved out room of stone. A grizzled man, he claims to have traveled the entire underground alone. Judging from his numerous scars, he may well have. True or not, the man knew how to survive in the tunnels of the wilderness.

"It does me proud to see the child of my brother set out on such a daring exploit," he says. "I once sought the surface, but could not for the life of me find the exit. I always ended up circling myself, and it's a miracle I made back. I wish someone were going with you."

You smile at the old man. "Who would? As you have said, only the brave or the foolhardy seek the surface, and there is a shortage of both in Ruken."

"Too true," he chuckles. Fumbling inside the satchel he carries by his side, your uncle hands you a large roll of parchment and a quill pen. "Do not forget to map your journey as you go. It will be essential to your return should you run out of supplies or decide to give up."

"I will never give up," you tell your uncle. Nonetheless, you take the parchment and pen from him and intend to use it often. You collect all your supplies and slide it into your knapsack, slipping the dirk into a loop on your belt. Turning, you embrace your uncle for what you feel is the last time. "Thank you uncle. I hope I'll see you again."

"I hope so too, young one." Is that a tear in his eye? No. Never. The man who traveled the entire underground, crying? Perish the thought.

It takes a huge amount of will, but you step out of the dwelling that has been your home for all your life and out onto the street.

The sight is familiar, a tunnel with homes carved out on either side. Not very fancy - especially when compared to some of the huge cities - but it's place you know best, and the rows of caves give you a heartwarming feeling.

Some turns, a brisk walk, and ten minutes sees you at the edge of town, where the grey rock tunnels become black dirt. From here there is only one place to go, and that's to the surface. However, it is like a labyrinth in there, so it's not as simple as 'go up here'.

"And where are you going?" says a familiar voice. Smiling, you turn to see your childhood friend...
155332222221.title: Embark

1553322222211.content:
"I'm going to find the sky" you say wondering how Sophie managed to get out of her house. Sophie was about the same age as you and was considered the top troublemaker of the town. When you had first met her you were hanging upsidedown in one of her wild traps trying to cut the ropes with your teeth. She had clamly approached you introduced herself and cut you down. To your knowledge you where the only person she had released without embarrassing them.

"What!!!" says Sophie clearly think that your ramblings all these years where a mere fantasy, but apparently this wasn't the case. "You think you can just go out there and find the sky? are you crazy or something."

You stare at her and she quickly realized what she just said, she tried to stammer out another reply, but was cut short when her father appeared behind you. Sophie's father was unfortunatly for you the mayor of the town and he was a little overprotective of his daughter that, and he like to use his club on the boys.

You woke up in the
1553322222211.title: Sophie (you're male)

155332222222.content:
The land of Northhold was a peaceful place. Famed for the warriors who protecte it, the fearsome Guardians of Sekhmet skilled in the ways of combat and sun magic. Thanks to these warriors Northhold is kept safe from the necromancer know only has the bone eater. Now due to the years of peace Northhold has become a place to live your own life free from the tryanny of the world, aplace to settle down and live peacefully.





For now.
155332222222.title: Already here. Duh.

choices: Flame paliden barges through the door
1553322222221.content:
You moving into a small log cabin in the foothills near the Osseuse Mangeur Mountians. You work as a local farmer selling your produce in the town of Remontoir. Living a peacful life that you have all ways wanted, you think nothing can spoil it.

Meanwhile, deep in the heart of the Osseuse Mangeur Mountains is a fortress. It spans thousands of kilometers down but only a single tower rises up out of the earth surronded by battlements all stone cold, but somthing does garrision this fort, the Bone Eater. He has gathered his forces slowly over the years, visting mass graves and boneyards to add to his horde of undead soilders. his army includes five sand kraken which he has twisted in to what he calls tongue kraken a mass of tongue like material surronded by a armored shell. While the tongue kraken may be his greatest weapon his greatest success is Lisa. Lisa is 5'9 with brown hair, pale green eyes, and is a human. her peachy skin color marks her out of the dark grey horde and may be the only human to be fully resurected from the dead. She is also his toy, for this Bone Eater has a thirst for laughter and he uses Lisa to test out his new skills at tickling.

Back at your house you are about to go to bed when a..........
1553322222221.title: Northhold its

1553322222222.content:
Far beyond the southeastern corners of Zenith's map lies a primordial continent unknown to the rest of the world. It is so far away and so obscure that few even know the continent exists at all, let alone know of its exact location. But you, and only you, had been given a good deal of information of this strange land by your mother, the only explorer ever to discover it. You still remember the stories she told you of the new world to this very day: a hot and exotic land with vast, verdant jungles, cataracts adorned with rainbows, mountains that spew fiery liquid, black and white shores, and flora and fauna not found anywhere else in Zenith. What astounded you the most was her account of a grand civilization run by sentient pigs. The only real information she gave you of these sophisticated swine was their caste system, beautiful clothing, and their massive stone buildings. However; you believed your mother knew more about the pigs than she told you, which is why you felt the need to discover this new world and seek out this mysterious culture.

Then again, the best voyages you could ever undertake are the ones that exist only in dreams and folklore...
1553322222222.title: Moving on

choices: You are ready to go exploring and venture into the forest
You are in the mood for a short stroll through the low, soft-looking grass
15533222222221.content:
After a month long maritime journey you finally land. All the trouble of finding a captain willing to take you all the way here (no small feat in itself, considering the bad reputation of this place) finally seems worth while. You had to sell family house and basically all of your possessions to be able to pay for this little expedition, but you have no regrets. You are a free spirit, who never enjoyed being tied up to one country, let alone to one city, so you are looking forward to the new life of adventure and exploration, with nothing to tie you back to your previous life.

After dropping anchor several hundred meters off shore, you and a landing party load your cargo onto a small boat and complete final stage of the journey. Standing knee high in the water after jumping off the boat, you see relatively narrow stretch of beautiful sandy beaches both to the left and right and beyond them, to the left a forest for as long as eye can see and to the right forest gradually turning into a low grassland for many miles. Wonderful position to get some rest and enjoy a seaside vacation for a few days, before you go on exploring, you think to yourself.

After unloading your equipment and supplies and helping you to set up a base camp at the edge of the forest, captain and his crew bid you farewell and head back to the ship. Their plan is to travel back as soon as possible, leaving you all alone, but you don't mind that one bit. A little solitude sounds prefect to you right now. After all, though a girl, you are one of the best sword fighters of your (now ex) homeland. You have been in many dangerous situations before and managed to get out of each and every one of them unscathed. You are more then capable of taking care of yourself.

By the time you change your clothes and boots from those suitable to the sea voyage to more land-friendly ones, you see ship already turned around and slowly getting away towards the horizon. Well there's no turning back now, you think to yourself, and turn away from the sea to look inland once more. A short survey of your camp's immediate surroundings is in order, but where to go first...
15533222222221.title: Voyage to a New World

choices: You start on your way back
155332222222211.content:
Forest doesn't look too dense and is at your doorstep, so to speak, so you decide you need to look around a little bit. After you take about 20 steps into the forest, you realize trees are high and though they are not too dense, amount of light reaching you is still limited. More importantly, though unbeknownst to you at this time, a pair of eyes is carefully watching your every step and studying your every move.

You start off going parallel to the shore one way and then back and keeping close to your camp, but very soon you can't see the beach any more. Every now and then you you kneel down to inspect some berries or mushrooms, in order to discover alternative food sources. You can catch fish, as long as you are near the sea, but you prefer more diverse diet, if you can help it, especially since you prefer to keep your food supplies carried from the ship in-tacked for as long as possible, because they may prove much more valuable once you journey further away from the the shore. At one such time you feel something sharp and hard inside your boot get stuck into the sole of your foot. You sit down and take off your boot, you turn it upside down and a small rock falls out of it. You remove your sock too, to reveal soft-looking, wrinkly sole and your pretty burgundy red painted toes. You rarely used to wear any foot-wear that displayed your feet, but you enjoy painting your toenails to match your hair color. You made sure to bring with you ample supply of your favorite toenail polish into this adventure.

A little further away from you inside some bushes, that pair of eyes was still staring at you very hard. The moment you removed your boot, a hunger grew in those eyes and the moment your bare sole appeared outside your sock, a tongue came out of the mouth beneath those eyes and lustfully licked the lips out of which it came. While you were sitting unsuspectingly and massaging your sole to make the pain go away, a decision was made and a plan was hatched in the brain behind those eyes.

After few minutes you replaced your sock and your boot and decided you ventured deep enough and should be getting back before you lost your way in the maze of trees. You stood up and turned around towards the beach.
155332222222211.title: You are ready to go exploring and venture into ...

choices: Welcome to the forest of the Lone Orc Warrior
1553322222222111.content: In front of you, standing directly between you and your camp, you see a creature you did not expect, not in your new world anyway. A little bit of panic creeps inside of you, but you manage to suppress it. If only you brought your sword with you, you'd feel much more confident, but you didn't expect any trouble in the isolated place like this and so soon after you landed. For a moment you and creature remain still and silent and just stare at each other, each of you expecting the other to make a move. You try to use those precious few seconds, to come up with some plan of action, but you are unsuccessful, the tension is just too high, for you to think straight. Finally the creature steps towards you and speaks
1553322222222111.title: The way is blocked

choices: You manage to stay in front of her
15533222222221111.content:
By the tone of her voice and after getting a closer look at her, you realize that the orc is a female, but that doesn't make her any less threatening. She is carrying a long serrated knife at her belt and a bow over her back as well as a quiver of arrows. Her clothes are green to make her harder to spot in the forest. She doesn't wear any armor, but her clothes outline strong muscular body. Confrontation would probably not end well for you, you decide.

After that one sentence and one step she stopps again, studying you with those mean eyes. Her gaze tells you that she does not mean you well, at least not by your definition of well. She has already decided that you are not a bigger threat then she can handle, otherwise she would not have came out from her cover, and now she is just trying to make sure before she comes at you. Also, though you can't be precisely sure of it, it looks to you that, from time to time, her eyes drop down to your feet for a split second and then go back to your face. You don't even want to begin to think about what her intentions are. Orcs have a bad reputation in your homeland, even though they are not native to it or to any of the neighboring kingdoms. They are not all evil, but they are clever and many of them can be greedy or cruel. Some of them are known to be killers, looters and pillagers, but such tribes lived far to the east of your home and you never heard of any o them coming close to your kingdom. Others are notorious assassins, thieves and burglars trained in special guilds, but those too are known to you through stories only. Finally in some countries they even live alongside humans in towns and cities, but they are not much liked even there. Your realize that your knowledge of their specie is unfortunately lacking and you can not use it to deduce anything about your rival. Could it be that your mother did not know about them much more then you do, and that swine-people she described to you, were actually orcs, whom she have never seen before and thus couldn't recognize when she saw them here? It doesn't look too unlikely at all, from where you're standing right now. You would probably not realize that the creature in front of you is an orc, had it not told you so itself. The thought of being all alone on the continent full of orcs did not appeal to you one bit.

Suddenly you are pulled away from your thoughts, as the orc starts again towards you. She doesn't seem to be running anywhere close to full speed, still you don't have time to study here moves and try to guess her motivations. The moment you caught full glance of her appearance and equipment, you decided that you probably can not win a fight, at least not without major injury, so you decided that flight is a better option. It's true that orc knows the surroundings better then you and that you probably can not hope to outwit her in the forest, but if you can only manage to get back to your camp, you'll find your sword there and that should boost your odds in the inevitable fight.
15533222222221111.title: Welcome to the forest of the Lone Orc Warrior

155332222222211111.content:
Even though you are running through the completely unexplored forest, you are somehow managing to keep her behind you. But any time to try to make a turn to the left or right, she seems to be there in the matter of seconds, forcing you to go back to running away from the shore. After a number of unsuccessful attempts to change direction you lose your barrings and find yourself just running away from here rather then towards anything. Every now and then, you would see here flanking you and would turn your back at her, running in the opposite direction.

After maybe fifteen minutes of this, you ran into a clearing in the forest. In front of you, you can see a what looks like a small well kept house. Hope stirs inside you, maybe you can ask for help from the inhabitants of the house or at least find something you can use to defend your self in it, when the she-orc reaches the clearing just few steps behind you. As you start towards the house, you can here her laugh out loud behind you and wish you "Welcome to my hideout".

Before you have time to process her words, she is on top of you and you are both on the ground. As you hit the dirt the wind is knocked out of you and you are stunned for a few seconds. Then utter and complete darkness comes. As you come to, you realize that you have been blindfolded, your hands have already been tied up behind your back and your ankles are crossed and being tied together as well. As she lifts you up over her shoulder and starts to carry you, presumably towards the house, the truth dawns on you: you weren't managing to keep her behind, by your speed, she is much faster then you are. She was stirring you this way all the time. This doesn't look good at all, you think to your self, as she lays you back down, with you face towards the ground.
155332222222211111.title: You manage to stay in front of her

choices: The preview is over, but more is soon to follow
1553322222222111111.content:
You can feel her sit down on your ankles pinning them down and completely preventing any movement, but then nothing happens. You try to concentrate and detect what's going on, but you can't hear or feel anything. After a minute you decide to try to think of some kind of escape plan. Even though your mind is working at full speed, you are drawing a complete blank. You have never been in a predicament remotely similar to this, being strong self-reliant young woman.

As you are lost in your thoughts you seem to feel a barely detectable prick at the side of your right foot. You try to concentrate on your feet, but still being a little dazed from the initial fall, you can't seem to feel anything. You decide that it was probably nothing and that your senses are probably playing a trick on you in your groggy state. As you try to go back to thinking about escape, again an odd feeling comes from your right foot. This time it seems that the sole of your sock has been stretched away from the sole of your foot, and then as you hear ripping sound, the terrible realization hits you. The earlier prick on the side of your foot was actually a knife cutting away the sole of your boot, and now with the sock ripped open, the bottom of your foot is completely exposed and facing up towards the orc. Before you have time to ask yourself why, you hear the orc's euphoric voice:
"Well look what we have here! It seems I hit a major jackpot today." As you hear her talk you feel the weight on your ankles shift towards your feet a little bit, as if she was leaning towards them to inspect her handy work. "I think I'm gonna have lots of fun with you girlie. Look at all those beautiful wrinkles".

As you hear her utter those words, you realize that you are reflexively scrunching your toes, making your already wrinkly sole even more wrinkly in the process. You relax your foot, but only for a second, as you feel a poke of a sharp nail in the middle of your arch. Giggle escapes you and you hear your captors satisfied giggle as well. Getting you here so she could tickle your feet, would seem as far fetched motivation as any, just half an hour ago, but at this moment, you have no doubt of it. Those glances at your feet, back in the forest, make sense now. She was teasing herself, knowing what she was after, even then. Also taking off your boot and sock in the middle of the forest, now looks like a much less smart thing to do, knowing that those hungry eyes were gazing at you all the time and were even more stimulated to come after you, after such an inviting display.

You are brought back from your thoughts as you feel a finger, starting at your heel, going over the arch and up resting on the ball of your foot. You fight hard to suppress further giggles, but your tormentor seems annoyed by your resistance and wriggles all five fingers of one hand all over your sole, getting you to laugh hysterically in the matter of seconds. Satisfied with the result, she pulls her hand away, but before you have time to thank the sky for that mercy, you feel something wet and hot traversing the same path as fingers, just a few moments ago. Starting at the heel, paying special attention to the arch, continuing over the ball of the foot and ending at the toe-pads. "Who would have thought that a sole can taste so good, after a long run. I'll have to keep that in mind' she announces as she goes for another lick, electing new stream of giggles out of you. "I love big wrinkly ticklish soles, and your sexy meaty tootsies are gonna keep me happy for a long long time", she announces as she goes for another lick.
1553322222222111111.title: The fun begins

choices: The orc rips open your second boot.
The orc drags you inside her hideout.
15533222222221111111.content:
You laugh helplessly as the orc continues to bathe your bared foot with her tongue. "What size are these beauties?", the orc inquires as you bang your fists into the ground. "Go to hell!", you reply, trying to muster up some degree of dignity. "Fine! I'll just tickle it out of you!", the orc said and immediately began licking the undersides of your toes with her tongue. This got you laughing really hard. Your toes spread out and wriggled wildly before curling up and causing the wrinkles in your sole to become much more pronounced again. This seemed to please the orc, who then held your toes curled over and set about directly treating your wrinkled sole with her tongue again. Finally, inbetween howls of laughter, you cried "eleven! they're size elevens!".

"Ha! *slurp* I knew it!", the orc said inbetween licks, "I knew they had to be a size eleven at the very least! *slurp*".
Soon, your entire foot became covered by the orc's saliva and you were on the border of passing out when...
15533222222221111111.title: The fun continues

choices: No use running, she is faster, you have to fight
She is way too strong, go through the window
155332222222211111112.content:
Suddenly the lickling stops. You can feel her get off you and then you feel yourself being lifted up. She throws you over her shoulder and starts walking. Soon you can hear the door slammed shut and you realize you're inside the hut. She takes another step and then you hit the floor. You feel the orc grab your damaged boot and brace yourself, but the tickling doesn't come, although she is definitely doing something to your boot. After a minute or so, your blindfold is removed. You survey your surroundings, but there's not much to see: no furniture of any kind except for one chair and a blanket in the corner.. Also in the middle of the room, on the floor, there is a heavy looking wooden hatch, leading under ground, obviously. All over the walls are grim trophies, pairs female shoes, saome completely solelles, others with soles still attached to them by the heel, like your boot. Also there are many ripped socks and stockings. Some are open at the toes, while others, much like your own sock, are just ripped along the sole. Suddenly your ankles are freed of their restraints and your hands are soon to follow. Quickly you jump up and turn around to face your tormentor, but she just stands still in the door frame smiling at you. Your boot has been taped around your foot using some kind of strong tape, so that the sole is holding in place, for now, even though a strong shake of your foot, reveals your toes under the flapping boot-sole. It was obviously fixed just enough to serve her current intentions, but can be easily re-opened at any time. You decide not to even think about that, as you wiggle your still dump toes inside your boot.

Then she speaks: "How do you like my collection", she asks, waving her hand at the walls. "I've had many, guests", she utters that last word with an evil smile on her lips. "Most, I had to go a long way away, to invite and few of them came to my doorstep, as you did. Some of them have some big and delicious tootsies, but it's been a long time, since I had a pair, quite like yours. I must admit. I'm looking forward to having my way with yours. But since I'm a good sport, I'll give you one chance to escape", she says. "If you can make it through this door, I'll give you one hour before I come after you, but if you can't...", she looks down at your boots and slowly licks her lips. Mere sight of that tongue, makes you shiver. She is certain that you can't defeat her, or evade her for too long, even if you manage to, somehow, get passed her. Based on your experience so far, she is probably right, you decide. You need to come up with a plan and you need it soon. "Come on now, you can't stand there forever, come and get some more coochie choochie coos", she starts teasingly wriggling her long fingers. Those fingers end in nails, perfect for extracting laughter from ticklish women, you think to yourself. Several feet left of the door, there is an open window, the only one on the hut. You have two options, either go at her and pray for the best, or try to jump out the window and make a run for it. As you are thinking about each option, she starts moving very slowly towards you.

you knock the wind out of her

You charge at her and try to throw a few punches, but she blocks them all. You can see however, that she is not smiling anymore. Another flurry of swings and again, neither of them connects with the target, but her face is even more serious. Well, that wasn't a very good idea. The orc woman simply grabs your leg by the ankle as you attempt to kick her in the stomach. Her self-confident smirk returns as she rips the taped on sole back off of your boot. Your eyes widen and you wriggle your red painted toes in the cool breeze. This serves to only tempt the orc's fetish even further as she promptly wriggles her fingers in the middle of your bare sole. You immediately burst out into a combination of giggles and snorts, barely managing to stand on one leg.

"Geez, you sure are dumb. Feet this big and ticklish shouldn't be trying to kick people", the orc woman taunted. However, you were in no position to retort since you were currently laughing uncontrollably. You began to pull upon your leg in an effort to free it from the orc woman's grasp. 15533222222221111111211.title: That was a pretty stupid move.
