15533222222222222.content:
You've been working hard at adventuring. Too hard. You're tired of all the running, and fighting, and sleeping in the rain. You need a vacation.

In your travels you've heard of the city of Kictle, a place of extravagance and merriment. It said that the citizen's drink, eat, and laugh to their heart's content, every day a festival. Speaking of festivals, you've heard of the city's most important event- the week long Feast of the Goddess. It is here that the citizens of Kictle and any visitors go all out in their revelries, in celebration to their patron goddess.

The thing is, you never listened long enough to find out what kind of parties these were, or what sort of thing their Goddess represented. And behind the revelries, more sinister forces may be at work... Things might get a bit... ticklish.

So then, do you travel to this place, to tickle or be tickled by drunken party-goers and mysterious strangers? Or do you have another place in mind?
15533222222222222.title: Too much pressure...

155332222222222222.content:
You're nobody. Your family was never rich. You have no connections to nobility outside of the tax collector. And you've never so much as glimpsed any of the great cities of Zenith.

But if the bandits who kidnapped you learn this you won't live to see another sunrise. The promise of ransom is the only reason they keep you. If they find out you're just another yokel you're dead or enslaved. Whichever one would please the sadistic bastards more.

Time is running out and your lie won't last forever. But you think you have a way out. There's another prisoner neither of you can escape without the other. You need their strength and prowess, they need your speed and wit.

Tonight is the night you break out of the bandit camp. There's just one problem.

Your fellow captive just happens to be a tickle dragon.
155332222222222222.title: Taken

choices: "Anything? Then you have a deal, girl."
"Anything? Then you have a deal, boy."
"Why should I lift so much as a claw for you?"
1553322222222222221.content:
You look down at your clothes, torn to rags now. Not that they were much to begin with, but after running from those bandits, and getting caught… well, the old things were bound to fall apart sooner or later. You look down at the chains at your ankles. You could escape into the night, but unless you get these chains off, you'll be easy enough to track down. As it is, you can't do more take more than a half-step in them, and they clink around enough to make you a belled cat. But there is one way to get them off…

You look at the overly large wagon, and the prize tightly tied down inside: the tickle dragon. A short coat of soft gray feathers covers its form as it lies curled up inside the wagon. It can barely fit in there, its long tail curled back against its body. You can see the fluffy tip, like a lion's tail… although that feathery appendage can do much more than anything a lion could do. A long forked tongue slips in and out of its mouth quickly, tasting the air. As you watch the darting, wet tongue you notice the tickle dragon's saliva, famous for being able to sensitize even the toughest of skin. Being licked by a tickle dragon is supposed to make one's skin as smooth and luxurious as a newborn babe's… and twice as sensitive, you think with a shudder.

The dragon is no more than twenty feet long, not including the tail, making it a relatively young specimen. If the rumors are true, that means the dragon will have much more energy, not bound to a lair like its full grown brethren. You can't tell if its male or female, but then again the distinction doesn't seem to matter. It's eyes are shut as if asleep, but you notice its catlike ears twitch. Tickle dragons are supposed to be intelligent, and you realize the thing is perfectly awake and attentive.

"Hey…" you whisper loudly, sneaking closer to the dragon. "I need to get out of here. Once those bandits realize I'm not of noble birth… well, I'm sure you can imagine." You pause before continuing, the dragon showing no signs of hearing you, its ears still idly twitching. "I can get those straps off you. I heard them talking earlier. They're going to sell you to some noblewoman down south. You'll be her prized pet, a jewel in her crown to brag about. Just thrown a ticklish prisoner every once and a while. You wouldn't want that, right? But if I let you out, and you break my chains, we can both get free… do we have a deal?"

You wait for what seems like an eternity, but must be no more than a minute. The dragon snorts dismissively, still not opening its eyes, making you crestfallen. "Please… I'll do anything! I need your help!" At this, the tickle dragon finally opens one eye, looking at you passively from the golden cat-like orb. It opens its mouth to speak...
1553322222222222221.title: We go tonight...

15533222222222222213.content:
“Troll spit.” You curse under your breath. “Because I can help you out of here. You scratch my back, I scratch yours, right? We can get outta here but we need each other.” The dragon remains motionless before snorting and rolling its eyes. “What do you want to be a prize to be gawked at? I thought dragons were free spirits. Did I get the one dragon in Zenith that wants to be a pet?”

The dragon snorts again with what you can only assume is disdain and a puff of smoke or steam, you can’t tell- you don’t remember if tickle dragons were fire breathers, billows from its nostrils and evaporates into the moonlit night. “You know nothing young human. I long since stopped caring where I was and who I was with.”

You slump back against a pole, stuck in the earth for gods know what reason and stare up into the night sky. Just your luck. An apathetic dragon. You look down at the chains that restrain your ankles and come to the same conclusion for the hundredth time. No chance- not on your own. Well that’s it then. Whatever borrowed time you’re living on will expire shortly. And then…

You try not to think about it and close your eyes as tears begin to well up.

“They took everything.”

You look across at the dragon as it stares at you. “Everything.” It says again. “They destroyed the nest. They slew my sire and my dam. They took my brother.” Its eyes darken and narrow. It occurs to you that this dragon must be younger than you thought. Or maybe tickle dragons spend longer as nestlings. But either way…

“You’re all alone in this world aren’t you?” You ask.

A mournful rumbling escapes the dragon in response to your question. “And why would you care human?”

You offer the dragon a sad smile before saying, “Because I'm alone too.” The dragon does its best to cock its head to one side as if in curious and urging you to go on. But you won’t. Not here. Not now.

‘Took my brother…’

A faint, stupid, crazy and unworkable notion works its way into your head. “Your brother? What was his name? Is he still alive?”

For a moment the dragon looks uncertain. Then, deciding that it wouldn’t hurt to share the information says, “Fenrir is alive. Of that much I’m sure. But the world is vast. And we are small.”

“What happened to the free spirit of the dragon the bards always sing about?” You ask. “You help me? I can make you a deal. Help me escape. Help me escape from these troll bags. And I’ll help you find him. No matter how far we have to go or how long it takes for us to get to him.”

Curious, the dragon examines you suspiciously. “And what do you get out of it?”

You smirk as if the answer were obvious. “Me? I never have to know what these flesh-mongers were going to do to me.” For a moment the dragon seems unsure- maybe it doesn’t believe you, afraid that once it cuts you lose you’ll bolt. “You scratch my back, I’ll scratch yours.” Once more the dragon snorts and once more a cloud rises from its nostrils. “Do we have a deal?”
15533222222222222213.title: "Why should I lift so much as a claw for yo...

155332222222222222131.content:
You breathe a heavy sigh of relief as a huge grin briefly dares to show on your face. Then it disappears as fast as it appeared. No use dreaming of freedom just yet you need to get free first.

You pick yourself up off the dirt, careful not to kick the food bowl you'd eaten out of for the last few days. The dragon isn't far from you but the distance between the two of you seems impossibly wide with your rattling chains. If only it had been rope...

There's no-one around that you can see but you can hear the bandits well enough. Beyond the line of sharpened poles is the rest of the camp. By the sound of it they struck rich today. Shouting, clashing blades, smashing glasses and singing- all the usual sounds of a party. But just below that you can hear low voices discussing something in private. Not all of them are so distracted. Which means you need to keep quiet.

You look down at the chain that binds your feet and realize that's so much easier said than done. For a second you think about clawing your way over with just your hands before thinking you could do without scraping the skin of your back off on the rough ground. Maybe if...

Spreading your legs wide, you take up the slack in both hands. You take a step that's almost silent then, carefully make your way over to the wagon. Bent over, you probably look ridiculous to anyone watching but it's just the dragon and that's lowest on your list of things to worry abo-

You bite down hard on your tongue as rock buries itself in your bare foot and pain shoots up your leg. TROLL SPIT! That hurt. Gingerly, you feel around this time before you lower your foot and do your best to keep your weight on the uninjured one. Carefully, one step at a time you make your way over, grimacing every time your left foot goes down. But then you're at the wagon and the dragon trussed up on top of it.

“I need you to help me first.” You say. Can you cut through this with your claw?” It’s awkward for the both of you but after a few minutes of shuffling, curses and suppressed chain clanks you manage to position yourself on the ramp attached to the front of the wagon so that its front claws can slice through the chains on either side. The shackles remain in place but you can worry about those later. For now you can move around without the tell-tale rattling and restricted movement and that’s all you need.

Now for the dragon. You examine the restraints attached to the wagon in the pale moonlight. The straps that hold it down are thick and the tension keeps them tight but-

"Bingo!" You grin just loud enough for the dragon to hear as you manage to release the first strap.

"It’s working?" The dragon asks, a hopeful undertone in its voice.

"It’s working." You utter back. “I’ll have you out in no time.” Well- maybe not no time. They’re faster to release than say untying knots. And some of them are old and worn, making them easier to release. But even so there are enough of them to make up for their quality. You've managed a few so far but there must be at least fifty more up and down the dragon's length. This could take a while.

And as the gate to your section of the camp opens your heart stops as you realize it's time you don't have.

You stand frozen still as wide eyes stare at you. "What are you doing?"
155332222222222222131.title: Unchained

choices: I'd rather be your slave than theirs, I will join you.
I'll join you, but only as an equal, not a slave.
No, I can't let you free it!
1553322222222222221311.content:
The two of you stare at each other in a moment that seems to stretch into an eternity. It's the serving girl, either coming in to clean up your prison or bring you some food, you can't be sure at the moment. The point is that she's here. Why did she come so late at night?

The girl is about your age, young with features from a foreign land that you can't identify. You've never known much about the places outside of your little corner of the world. Her eyes and hair are dark, both almost black, in a way that doesn't match the looks of any local. But her skin is as pale as yours, perhaps even more so, and a fair amount of it is visible from the meager clothing the bandits have given their wench. Then you notice the tattoo: just below the woman's exposed navel is a small rune that anyone in any land understands. "Slave." This girl was bought from a slave trader, either from the bandits themselves, or from someone they plundered. In either case, the woman is no more than property to them. Even if she were to escape, she'd have to hide the mark from everyone. An escaped slave has little rights in any land, and the authorities didn't take kindly to their emancipation.

"What are you doing?" the serving girl asks again. "You can't let it out! Don't you what that is?" Her voice is low and quiet, with a faint accent of somewhere exotic that again betrays her foreign origins. But whoever she is and wherever she's from, you're glad she's at least not shouting.

"It's ok." You tell her, trying to calm her down and reassure her. "It won't hurt anyone, it's just a tickle dragon…" you can hear the dragon bristling at being called 'just' a tickle dragon, but he doesn't press the issue, seeming to understand the situation.

"But… if it gets out… they'll be angry!" The girl retorts. "We'll all be blamed! You have to stop!" Her voice is starting to raise in volume, signs of alarm growing in her voice. You needed to get her on your side.

"Hey, we’re not so different. We're both their captives, right? Why don't you come with me?" You ask, and the woman looks at you curiously. "Help me get the tickle dragon free, and its promised to help me get away. You could come too! It's got to be better than being a slave for these bandits, right?"

The girl pauses, thinking about the possibility. You didn't exactly give the tickle dragon any say in this, but if it gets you both out of here, it can't object, right? Two women can undo the ties twice as fast as one. Your eyes look hopeful as she considers the possibility, before finally speaking:
1553322222222222221311.title: The wide-eyed serving girl gasps.

choices: It's well into the new day when the dragon finally lands
The dragon only has the strength for an hour or so of flight
15533222222222222213112.content:
"I- I'll join you." She says. "But if I do I'm nobody's slave anymore. Not theirs and not yours."

You nod, as a grin of relief sweeps across your face. "I never assumed you would be." You reply. "Now hurry- I don't think the next person through the gate will want to escape with us."

"And if they do," The dragon rumbles quietly, "I might not be able to take off."

The girl nods and quickly closes the gate behind her as silently as possible. You focus on the next strap as the footfall of her sandals get closer, trying to force the buckle prong clear of the hole in the strap and having to fight against the dragon's mass to do it.

"Breathe out." You hiss to the dragon. He exhales deeply as suddenly your job becomes that little bit easier. The strap comes loose and you waste no time in moving to the next one.

With the two of you now working to free the dragon your progress is much faster. Alone you might still have been here when the sun came up. Even so it's not an instant process and the closer you get to freeing the dragon the more you find yourself shooting glances at the gate, half-expecting it to swing open at any second. Your fingers fumble with the second to last and your end, holding down the dragon's head and as just as you finally undo it you hear a voice that makes your blood run cold.

"Where is she?" A bandit bellows from the other side of the wall. You know who she's talking about in a heartbeat.

"Where's who?"

"The bleeding serving wench you maggot!"

"Last I saw her-" Your fingers instantly attack the last buckle with desperate fervor knowing you're out of time. "-She went to-"

"I know where she went, I sent her! But that was quarter of an hour ago! Where is she now?"

Your heart pounds in your chest, slamming so hard against your ribs you're sure it's giving you away. Sweaty fingers wrestle and frantically attack the strap, fighting to undo the buckle. This one's so much tighter than the others- probably because it's over the dragon's skull, not the neck- and it refuses... to... give...

The dragon winces slightly as you keep pressuring it's head but you ignore it because there'll be time to apologize later once you're away and-

Yes!

And then the gods decide you've had enough good fortune for one day. As you move to the final strap over the dragon's snout the gates creak open. Slowly at first as one person comes through. And then they see what you're doing. They fly open with a speed that should be impossible as the screaming bandit bears down on you, screaming for help. Before you can even touch the final strap, she slams into you knocking to the ground hard and drawing a wooden short-bow

"You treacherous little harlot!" She sneers as you look up to see an arrow aimed down at your chest. Her eyes regard you coldly as if she's considering letting the arrow fly now and be done with you. "Did you honestly think you'd get away with my dragon, girl?" She asks coldly. Behind her, the gateway fills with bandits who heard or saw the commotion. Each one brandishes a vicious looking weapon, a tankard, or a musical instrument which, in any other circumstance you could have laughed at.

"And dear little Ilya." The bandit sighs as she notices the serving-girl. She'd been desperately trying to keep working unnoticed and by how far done she managed to get she was as close to finishing as you were.

"I thought we'd made progress- I really did. But it looks like I need to take you back to my tent for 'correction'. Isn't that right boys?" Behind her the bandits break into harsh laughter- they all know what that means. You can only guess but the way Ilya stares like a rabbit caught in lights it can't be good. Her eyes flick to make contact with your own for a second and she makes a pleading look as if she hopes you can help her. But if that's the case, her hope is horribly misplaced.

"And as for you- guess what?" A smile creeps into existence on her thin lips and she keeps the bow aimed at you. "My scouts got back today. No noble family in the land is missing a daughter. Imagine that? No long lost blood relatives. No orphaned heiresses. Which I suppose means you lied to us. And I don't like liars."

There was probably more. It was the perfect situation for a monologue- nobody coming to help, no time pressure and nothing to stop her. Except- well the fact that the dragon realized all that held it from freedom now was a single leather strap. The sound of it snapping barely has time to register before its head snaps to the side and its teeth clamp shut around the bandit's waist. The arrow flys and buries itself into the ground a foot from your arm as she drops her bow. She screams as the dragon throws her back towards her gang and roars with a thunderous snarl that echoes through the night. As impressive as the display is, the effort of throwing the woman clearly took its toll and you hope that bandits don't pick up on that as you roll over to grab the arrow then scramble to your feet, snatching up the bow and nocking it.

"Get on my back." The dragon growls. Not like you need any words of encouragement. You leap onto the wagon as the dragon pulls it's tail clear of the last straps and pull yourself onto it's back behind the shoulders. Ilya climbs on behind you and wraps her arms around your waist as you pull the bow over your head and clutch tightly at the dragon, tapping its back to let it know you're ready. It doesn't wait to hear the threats of the bandit as she picks herself off the ground.

The wings unfurl like sails in the wind and with an almighty whoosh the three of you are airborne and climbing higher and higher into the night sky.
15533222222222222213112.title: Many hands make light work

choices: The two of you gulp and you realize what that means (you're ticklish)
"So we find a herd of deer?" (not ticklish- don't know how tickle dragons work)
155332222222222222131121.content:
The sun is well into the sky by the time the dragon thinks about landing- and not a moment too soon. The dragon lands, back feet hitting the ground first and then running on all fours before coming to a stop to slump onto the ground exhausted from the hours of airtime. You pry Ilya’s hands from around your waist, her knuckles white from clenching tightly and roll off, hitting the soft grass with less force than you expected.

“Oh sweet and merciful ground, may I never leave you again.” You murmur with closed eyes and grabbing tufts of grass tightly in sweaty palms. The dragon rumbles, chuckling as he turns to look at you.

“First time flying little one?”

“And by the gods the last. From now on you’re walking from A to B.” That earns another low chuckle from the dragon that infects you and then Ilya. And before you know it you’re all laughing. No idea why- relief, the idea of the dragon attempting to sneak through a city unnoticed. Or maybe tickle dragons just have that air to them. Either way it’s a few minutes at least before you can stop laughing and push yourself to your feet.

The sky is bright and mostly clear with a few wisps of white clouds drifting lazily across the azure vastness. The knee-high grass brushes smoothly against your legs as you make your way around to the other side of the dragon. On this side of him, the grass continues for about twelve feet before ending abruptly with a steep slope of ferns and bracken. Down there is pine forest with a river that snakes through the middle of the valley and continues so far as you can see- a few miles before the valley turns to the left and out of sight. So far as you can tell it’s uninhabited which is probably for the best. The last thing you want is a farm running to the local militia and screaming about a dragon on its way to steal his sheep and burn his crops.

Quite the view you can’t help but notice. And it reminds you that you’re no longer chained up and no longer a prisoner. You’re free. Granted, there’s still the matter of the shackles, but hey, one step at a time right? After all your head’s still spinning from the flight.

“So.” Ilya says as she slips off the dragon behind you and makes her way over to where you stand. “What now?” In the light of day and now that she isn’t squeezing the life out of your lungs, you can see the ex-slave girl is quite pretty. Her hair, long and ruffled by the wind cascades over her back and shoulders like a dark waterfall. Her attire, though revealing, is in far better shape than the rags you wear. Her top is scarlet silk- close fitting and sleeveless with a plunging, gold-trimmed neckline that draws wandering eyes down to her cleavage. It covers nothing below her breasts, leaving her slender torso exposed, down to the rune on midriff. Her hips are wrapped with a short skirt, again of scarlet and gold silk, that covers so little that maybe the tailor should simply have moved onto a material that wasn’t rationed. Worn leather sandals care all that remain of her outfit, save for the collar and bangles on her wrists and ankles that somehow weren’t lost during the flight. Had she not been a slave, you’d wager she could have had any man or woman of her choosing.

“Well. I guess the dragon and I had a plan before you arrived. But-”

“I have a name.” He grumbles indignantly. Oh, right, yeah. Huh- you’d have thought you’d ask something like that before.

“And what is that oh great, noble and groundeduntilfurthernotice steed?”

He thinks for a second as if wondering how best to put it simply. After a moment or two of thought he does what you assume to be a shrug and gives it to you straight. “You cannot pronounce it with a human tongue. But the rough translation is Freefall.” The name earns a raised eyebrow from Ilya and barely covered smirk from you.

“Freefall?” You say. “Tell me that doesn’t reflect on your flying?”

“No. But dragons have a sense of humor that most humans don’t seem to appreciate.”

“So- what does it sound like in dragon tongue?” One unrepeatable noise later and you nod in agreement- human tongues can’t bend like that. You glance across at Ilya who looks equally perplexed. “All in favor of a new name?” you ask. Two hands in the air beats the one paw on the ground and the two of you start spit balling, recounting the name of every dragon you’ve heard tales of.

Some he simply shakes his head for, others outright snorts at in disgust which is a shame- he looks like an Eirón. Eirón would have suited him. Finally, you think it was Ilya who suggested it, he settles upon ‘Murtagh.’ More of a name for some roguish mercenary you think but, if he thinks it fits.

And what of your name maiden?” Murtagh asks you after rolling it off his tongue a handful of times. “Little-bare-footed-one does not seem ideal.”

“Teyla.” You reply. At least- that’s what you always your parents calling you. And that’s what you’ve called yourself up till now. So to change it to something like Rebekah now would be silly. “Anyway as I was saying. Murtagh and I agreed upon something before you arrived.” You continue, turning back to Ilya. “He lost his parents, but hunters took his brother. Somewhere out there is a tickle dragon named Fenrir and we’re going to find him.

“Of course, you weren’t part of that agreement. You’re free now and like you said, you’re a slave to no one. Next town we come to we can part ways.” Ilya thinks for a moment, looking between you and the Murtagh. And then, with determination in her eyes she meets your gaze with a grin.

“Sounds like an adventure. I hear that’s what free people do. Travel the world. Adventure.” Well you’ve been free most of your life and that wasn’t adventure. That was struggling to stay alive. But then you didn’t have a dragon at your side back then. “I’m in.”

“So it’s settled then.” You smile. Feeling as if you need to pose dramatically. You turn back to the slope, one leg in front and to the side of the other, one hand on a bent knee, the other on your hip. “The three of us are going to go out there. And whatever happens, wherever we go and whoever we meet along the way- we are going to find Fenrir. Even if we have to uproot all of Zenith to find him.” Epic music strikes up in your head as your hair is blown in the wind. Ilya and Murtagh must be giving you looks behind your back, but this is your moment damn it and you’re determined to enjoy it.

“But do you mind if we rest first?” Ilya asks as she wraps slender fingers around the skin of your waist and rests her head on your shoulder.

“I… yeah, sure, I guess.” You grumble, as you feel your moment blow away into the wind.

“Resting sounds good.” Murtagh agrees as he looks towards the two of you, eyes seemingly focusing on the exposed skin, of which you both have plenty. “And one more thing.” He adds. “I’m starving.”
155332222222222222131121.title: The fellowship of the tickle dragon

choices: It was just a wild animal
A couple of adventurers just passing by
Some of the bandits had managed to catch up with you!
1553322222222222221311211.content:
Glaring at the both of you with two slitted eyes, both you and Ilya gulped, wondering whether or not if you were going to be its next meal. Almost as if it were reading your minds, the dragon gave a low growl, almost like a chuckle. “Be at ease, human. Unlike other dragons of our kind, we tickle dragons care little for meat or fauna, for we have a very unique food source.”

“And what might you feed off, o-mighty-and-large-tickle-dragon-whose-name-is-Murtagh?” Letting out a snort at your attempt at humor, the latter only looked at the both of you equally as it gave its answer in a monotone voice.

“Laughter.”

Mouth ajar at choosing whether or not to believe him, your mind struggled to comprehend how the sound of laughing would feed such a large beast such as Murtagh. So astounded you were, you didn’t notice the fact that Ilya had gotten over her initial surprise, slowly creeping behind you with outstretched and wiggling fingers.

“Can you believe him Ilya? What kind of dragon feeds on lau-teeheehahhaaaa!” Caught off guard by fingers wiggling against your naked sides, you rolled to the ground, your arms wrapping around them by reflex as your companion cheekily started to prod at your skin with her fingers, sending you into another bout of giggles every time. “Since its laughter that he wants, I think yours will suffice quite well. Bon appetit, Mr. Dragon!”

Drinking in the sound of your laughter with a bemused expression on his face, Murtagh continued to watch as he lay down in front of the two of you, resting his head on his front crossed front paws. Laughing as you weakly tried to push Ilya away, the servant girl wore a mock annoyed expression on her face, playfully clicking her tongue at you as her nails skittered across your ribs. “We have a tickle dragon to feed, so let out those giggles! Or will these fingers have to explore further to get it out of you?”

Already a giggling mess, you already knew what would happen if you let your playful companion roam any further to where your underarms were. Grabbing her naked feet, you promptly held them with the crook of one arm as Ilya made an alarmed expression. “If I’m going to laugh, so are you! Coochie Coo!”

Sparing no expense of her soles, you raked your nails along her surprisingly creamy arches, earning Murtagh another source of laughter other than your own. “Pleehehheehheease! Not my feet! I’m too ticklish there! No more-eehehheeheee!”

As both you and the tickle dragon drank in Ilya’s girlish laughter, the momentary pause gave Ilya all the time she needed as she took advantage of your lapse in attention to grab at your foot, one hand holding onto your ankle with an iron grip. With a playful smirk on her face as well, along with the wiggling fingers of her other hand, you already knew you were in for a few laughs. “Oh no you wouldn’t…”

“Oh yes I would. Shall we start from the beginning? This little piggy went to the market…” Wiggling your biggest toe with her hand, you fought the urge to giggle aloud, not wanting to give her the victory so easily.

“This little piggy stayed at home…” Stroking the base of your second toe, your face grimaced with the effort of holding in your laughter, a wide grin plastered on it.

“This little piggy had roast beef…” Giving your third toe a small lick with her tongue, you let out a small chuckle disguised as a cough, not expecting the unusual tickling instrument on your toes at all.

“This little piggy had none…” One nail slowly scratching the undersides of the fourth toe in, you held in your suspense as Ilya dragged out the words, tormenting you with each passing second.

“And this little piggy… Laughed wee wee all the way home!” Wiggling your smallest toe before running her fingers like a rake along the length of your soles, you finally burst out in laughter, head thrown back with girlish giggles as the digits continued to dance over your foot. If you didn’t know any better, you would have said that whoever was tickling your foot has had years of experience at it.

Giving you a much needed break in between laughing your head off, the other girl seemed to have forgotten that you still held her feet in your arms. Grinning as you did the same thing to her what she did to your poor foot, the poor girl letting loose with her laughter, you heard a low rumble coming from your side, the tickle dragon gazing into the darkness of the night.

“Human, cease your activities at once. We have company.”
1553322222222222221311211.title: The two of you gulp and you realize what that m...

choices: "Help feed our friend, the tickle dragon?"
"Tell us all you know about your ilk!"
15533222222222222213112113.content:
“So that’s where you went, you wench! Escaping with the prisoners, aren’t we?!” As you stopped tickling Ilya, the latter taking the few seconds to suck in sweet air into her lungs again, both you and Murtagh casted your gaze towards a nearby hill, where a lone female bandit stood, her tired horse next to her. You assumed that she must have tired the poor animal out, forcing it to travel the long distance just to chase after the three of you.

Dressed in only a worn out cloth top which stopped at her ribs and a pair of torn leather pants, the raven-haired bandit had an absolutely livid look on her face as she stalked to where the three of you were camping, Ilya gave a terrified whimper as the bandit drew her dagger, a loop of rope in her other hand. Warily stepping aside for now as she brandished the weapon at you, you exchange a glance with Murtagh, knowing that if she tried anything, the both of you would be ready.

“You dare to escape from us, slave?! When we get back I’ll be sure to ask leader to give you the special punishment of a whole day in the stocks. We’ll see if you still want to escape after that!” Grabbing a handful of your Ilya’s black hair as the latter let out a frightened shriek, you knew that you had to act now.

“Heh, not so tough now eh, slave? When I come back with the tickle dragon, the ransom target and our slave, the boss is sure to give me a promo-Hey!” Using the dark of the night to make your movements as inconspicuous as possible, you closed the distance enough to grab the bandit’s wrist, giving it a small twist as she winced, dropping her dagger in the process. Furiously turning her attention to you, you felt her other hand wrap around your neck lifting you up, feeling your breath literally being squeezed out of your windpipe.

“You little whore, when we get back I’ll be sure to send you to the stocks as we-” As a loud roar cut off whatever she had to say, you saw Murtagh give what passed for a smug grin for a dragon as the bandit’s horse ran off in the distance, frightened by the rumbling bellow coming from the tickle dragon. Face almost going red with anger, the bandit starred daggers into your eyes as you felt a bead of nervous sweat forming on your face.

“Just great, now how am I going to go back?! Why don’t you help me convince your friend over there to carry us all? I’m sure that if I threaten to make few scars on your face he’ll comply.” However, as the female bandit was about to retrieve her dagger, she let out a surprised cough as something tackled into her back.

“You again, slave?! Get your filthy hands off me!” Kicking Ilya square in the stomach, even you had to wince as your friend tumbled into the grass. However, letting out a cough as she got back up, proudly displaying a leather boot which suddenly appeared in her hands, you could swear that the bandit’s anger raised a few notches, her now bootless foot exposed to the cold air.

“Why you little-HEY! I can’t see!” Wrapping his tail around her eyes, you silently thank the tickle dragon for the much needed aid, slipping out of her grip as you grabbed her other boot as well, giving it a hard tug as it flew off, both her feet now vulnerable and bare.

Finally managing to pull the feathery tail off of her head, the bandit let out a snarl as she saw the rope she previously had on her body now appearing in your hands. As both Ilya and you slowly walked towards her with a sly smirk on your faces, a crack appeared in your captor’s mask, the realization that she might be beaten slowly coming to her. “Now now, how about we just go back peacefully, and no one has to get hurt?”

“How about we tie you instead with this handy rope you brought?” Grinning as you both dived towards the bandit, the latter didn’t have time to fend off the two of you as she shot her hand out, grabbing the first thing that she could reach. As you felt fingers giving a hard squeeze to your sides, you let out a surprised yelp, covering your mouth quickly. However, a sudden epiphany came to the female woman’s face as she realized what had just happened, a sadistic grin quickly creeping onto her mouth again.

“Oh, ticklish are we? Let me see if I can convince you to come back with me!” Dashing past Ilya with lightning speed, you felt her hands grab at your own as the both of you fell to the ground, wrestling for the advantage. Using her larger body and weight against you, the bandit quickly came out on top, both your hands still locked in hers. Slowly pushing them above your head as she held down both your hands with only one of her own, she menacingly wiggled the digits of her free hand as you gulped.

“Now, let’s see where else are you ticklish, you cheeky girl! Coochie Coo!” Digging her fingers into your hollows, you couldn’t help but let out peals of girlish laughter, the sudden sensation proving too much for you to handle. Kicking and screaming amidst your laughter, the bandit used the larger frame of her body to pin you down, not relenting in the slightest.

“That’s what you get for disobeying us! If you’ve learnt your lesson, let’s-pffffttt!” Letting out what sounded like a strangled cough, you saw through your closed eyelids that Ilya had tackled the larger female off you, the bandit trying to push the other girl away as your companion clung on for dear life, both her hands wrapped around the other’s torso. “How about you learn a lesson, on what happens to mean a person like you who takes other people away from their homes!”

As her fingers started to claw at the female bandit’s bare sides, you saw a lopsided grin appear on her face as even you could tell that she was trying her hardest not to laugh, her hands still trying to push the other girl away. “Get off me you little bitch! I’m not ticklish, so stop it!” Not missing out on the fact that your dragon companion was trying to help, the bandit grabbed a pouch from her waist before throwing it into the larger creature’s face, the latter growling with displeasure as it tried to remove the powder which burst forth onto his maw with his paws, temporarily blinded.

Surprised that your captor would be ticklish, you followed Ilya’s lead, realizing that you were the only one that was physically able to help her. Jumping at the larger woman’s chest, you wrapped your arms and legs around her in a bear hug, blinding her face with your own chest. “S-Stop it! I said get off me! If you think the same trick is going to work, think again!”

Digging her fingers into your sides to get you to let go, you did the same as Ilya as you hung onto dear life, laughter pouring freely from your mouth. However, with her task unhindered, your companion grinned as she mischievously squeezed hard on the bandit’s bare sides, giggles and snickers finally escaping from the latter’s throat.

In just a few minutes, you felt your adversary starting to visibly weaken, the toll of Ilya’s tickling clearly having an effect on her as you no longer felt digits digging into your sides, leaving you free to return the favor, slipping your hands into the crook of her underarms. Guffawing with laughter, the bandit finally fell to the ground, arms clamped to her sides with hearty laughter as both you and Ilya followed suit, not letting up the tickling for even a second.

Grabbing the rope from the grass, you coiled it around her hands before tying a tight knot, pulling her arms above her head even as she cursed and swore in between her laughter. Still prodding and poking her belly, Ilya gave you a smirk as well before bending down in a raspberry, the shrill sound of shrieking laughter already telling you how effective it was.

Sitting on her arms while grabbing one end of the rope binding her hands, you gave your previous captor an evil grin, the fingers of your free hand wiggling menacingly in the air. “It seems we’re not the only ones ticklish. Why don’t you…”
15533222222222222213112113.title: Some of the bandits had managed to catch up wit...

choices: Time to be the responsible one
1553322222222222221311212.content:
You look from Murtagh to your bow and arrow. Then to the dragon again. Then to the arrow.

Yeah- no. That’s not gonna work.

“Sorry big guy. I’ve got one arrow and I don’t want to lose it by sticking it in a deer. You’ll have to hunt your own food.” Not that you couldn’t try, but while an arrow might outright kill a rabbit, you’d have to be very lucky to do the same to a deer. And given the track record of your life so far, that’s not likely.

You expect him to be dejected, or something like that. Instead his body shakes with a low rumble, which you interpret as a chuckle.

“Now.” He says, pushing himself to his feet and walking over to where you and Ilya stand. “Why would I go out hunting? When I have two tasty morsels right here?”

Your heart stops and your blood runs cold as the words reverberate through your mind. Beside you Ilya tenses and stares with an equally horrified expression at the feathered dragon as it comes closer.

“Wait, wait! I thought we had a deal! I’d help you find your brother and-“

Murtagh pauses, the smirk on his face wiped and replaced with confusion. “We- we still do, don’t we?” He asks, puzzled.

“Not if you eat us we don’t. And that goes for Ilya too.” You reply stepping in front of her as to protect her- like you could protect her from a hungry dragon.

Murtagh stares intently at you for a second, as if trying to see what he’s missing here. Then his expression changes so suddenly you swear you can hear the switch click. “No, no, that’s not what I meant at all. I don’t eat- You thought I’d- No.” His voice sounds offended, like he could hardly believe that two girls like yourselves with one arrow between you, could seriously think a giant, sharp toothed reptile like him would even think about eating you.

“I take it neither of you know what a tickle dragon feeds on?” He sighs.

“Well, up till now I thought livestock, princesses, knights in shining armor- us.” You reply. “But I’m hoping you’re about to correct me.”

Murtagh snorts softly and two rings of smoke drift up out of his nostrils. “I suppose you’d be right in thinking that. But tickle dragons don’t require food like most other creatures of this land. We feed off mirth- laughter.”

You know that explains a lot actually- and there you were thinking the tickling was just a party trick. There’s still a problem though. “I hate to break it to you big guy but we’re not ticklish.” You tell him.

“Not ticklish?” He asks with a skeptical grin.

“Not ticklish.” You reply. You guess you could- find someone for him to feed off, but then people might not take kindly to you plucking them up and whisking them away to tickle. Maybe telling a funny joke would-

Your train of thought is cut short and fingernails skitter down your naked sides, dancing along your ribs. On anyone else it would have reduced them to a giggling mess. But you just turn around to Ilya with a blank expression as she looks at you sheepishly. “She’s not ticklish.” She mutters to Murtagh.

“Of course I’m not.” You shoot back as she withdraws her fingers, taking a step back away from you. Almost like she expects a counter- “Are you?” You smile sweetly.

She doesn’t have time to cry out as you leap at her, tackling her to the ground and skittering your fingers around her ribs. Instantly she screams with ticklish laughter. And just like that, dragon hunger has been eradicated. “Aww.” You tease as she tries to push your hands away from her belly. “You’ve got such a cute giggle.” She tries to retort, cute as it is she tries, but your fingers wandering along her sides are too much for her and she can’t hold back the high-pitched squeals. “How does that taste Murt?” You ask, turning to the dragon.

“Soft and tender.” Murtagh nods. You half-expected something like a glowing aura around him, but no, same old dragon.

With the whole dragon food problem outta the way you guess it’s time to go and find something for you and Ilya to eat but- troll spit, she is really ticklish. A bit longer tickling an insanely ticklish and half naked girl like Ilya couldn’t hurt, right?
1553322222222222221311212.title: Dragon munchies

15533222222222222213112122.content:
You really should figure out how the two of you will get something to eat. You should really start figuring out where it is you’re going next, and for that matter where it is you are right now. But troll spit, Ilya is a lot of fun to tickle! She has such a cute, adorable giggle that it makes you want to laugh sympathetically. Her tickle spots are all exposed, and her skin is incredibly smooth. With her taut tummy and firm, smooth legs… you just can’t help running your fingers all over her. Besides, the big tickle dragon can’t be full yet, right?

“Koochie koochie koo, Ilya!” You tease, grinning down at her as your fingertips spider over her belly. “C’mon, somebody needs to feed Murtagh!” She sputters in protest, but can’t say anything coherent as one of your fingers worms its way in her bellybutton and wiggles playfully. It makes you wonder how often Murtagh needs to ‘feed,’ and part of you hopes the answer is ‘often.’ You could get used to this, especially with that excuse. Your fingers dance their way up Ilya’s sides, and right into her exposed underarms. Ilya lets out a gasp and a new stream of giggles, wiggling in your tickly grasp. “Ooh, is someone ticklish under here? Huh?”

“Nohohohoho!” Ilya protests, completely unconvincingly, shaking her head and whipping her hair side to side. She tries to turn around and tickle back, reaching up to run her fingertips over your own bare belly. But nothing doing, you just aren’t ticklish, making for one mischievous and evil tickler!

You wiggle you fingertips even faster under her arms, making her squeak girlishly and try to clamp her arms to her sides, not that it gets your tickling fingers out of there. All the while, Murtagh is off to the side, watching your antics. He doesn’t do anything to stop it, and dragon facial expressions are nigh impossible to read, but if you had to guess the big guy definitely seemed ‘smug and satisfied’ by the playing.

You keep it up for a couple more minutes before finally letting Ilya go, not wanting to push things too far. She lays on the grass next to you for a minute, giggling and slowly catching her breath, her hands trying to rub the lingering ticklish feeling out of her skin. The girl really was wonderfully ticklish. “Hehehehe… ooh, somehow I’m going to get you back for that!” Ilya tell you, giving you a playful shove. She doesn’t seem upset, which is good. “But come on, we should really figure out how we’ll get food.”

Murtagh rumbles his throat, speaking up. “Mmm, thank you for your laughter, Ilya. It was excellent.” Then he turns to you, staring at you with his big eyes. “But don’t think you are immune to me, should I have need of you…” He says with a slightly suggestive rumble, which you can only blink back at him. You aren’t ticklish at all, never have been. Maybe he does have some funny jokes after all? But Murtagh continues. “Since you two have just given me such a delicious meal, it’s only fair I return the favor. Make a fire, little ones, and I will bring you food.” And with that, the tickle dragon bounds off into the trees, leaving you to look at each other with a shrug, and start to gather sticks and leaves for the fire.
15533222222222222213112122.title: Koochie, koochie, koo...

155332222222222222131121221.content:
You and Ilya begin picking up dried sticks and leaves for the fire. Thankfully, the area doesn’t seem to have had rain in some time, and dry wood is plentiful. Before long, you have a nice pile of wood, and thankfully you do know how to make a fire. As the evening air starts to cool, the two of you huddle by the warm fire.

“So, where do we go from here?” You ask Ilya. “I don’t really know any place far from my village, so I honestly have no idea. Are those bandits going to keep coming after us?”

“Yes, we probably already have a bounty on both of our heads.” Ilya said, nodding gravely. “I’m an escaped slave, and you stole a slave and a tickle dragon. If they catch us, well… you’ll be as worse off as me, I think.” You shudder, realizing you’ll have a similar slave mark if those bandits catch up with you. “We’re in danger anywhere in the northern kingdoms, those bandits roam all over them. Besides, if there were another tickle dragon in the northern lands, those bandits would’ve heard about it.”

“So, south it is!” You say, realizing at least that much. “Do you… know what anything is like south of here?”

A cool breeze wafts by, and Ilya cozies up next you by the fire. The semi-cuddle by the beautiful girl makes you blush a bit, which hopefully isn’t visible in the firelight. Ilya nods at your question. “You learn a lot listening to drunken bandits boasting by the fire. Southeast of here is the Kingdom of Coninze. It’s very civilized, and roving bandits don’t dare go there. The royal family is quite popular, and supposedly very benevolent. It might be a good place to go, but I’m not sure how they’d react to a tickle dragon in their midst.”

You nod, having at least heard of Coninze. “They say the Queen is beautiful and kind, but… that’s all I’ve heard, and who knows if tales are accurate this far away. What else is south of here?”

Ilya thinks for a moment. “Well, I’m not exactly sure where we are, but I’d know if I saw a roadsign. I think due south of here is the Duchy of Uzien. It’s a major port on the Great Southern Ocean, so we might hear rumors from all over. I’ve also heard there’s a new young duchess there, who has been acting ambitiously. If we could get an audience with any of that Royalty, that might be the best way to hear about Murtagh’s brother.”

You think about that for a moment. “How are the two of us going to get to speak to queens and princesses and duchesses? I’m just a peasant, or ex-peasant at least, and you’re an ex-slave. We’re not exactly influential.”

Ilya grins in the firelight. “No, but he is. I bet even royalty might be interesting in meeting a tickle dragon. Those bandits were trying to get Murtagh sold to some kind of noble in the first place.”

“Hmm, I guess that makes sense. We can at least try. Anyplace else we might go?”

Ilya thinks again, and cuddles a little closer to you in the process. “Oh, to the southwest is an elven forest. Wood elves live there, and elves are supposed to know a lot about magical creatures like dragons. But… humans and elves are kind of like oil and water. I doubt they’d want us in their lands.”

“Hmmm… but they would accept me!” You hear in a low voice, and the two of you turn and jump to see Murtagh standing behind you. Apparently he can be as quiet as a can when he wants to be. At his feet is some kind of small boar he seems to have caught. Or at least you think it is, you hope he didn’t steal a pig from some farmer. But beggars can’t be choosers, and you have plenty of food for tonight. “Elves have always been friendly to my kind, and you saved me. I would vouch for you, if we entered the forest.”

“Murtagh, how long have you been listening to us?” Ilya asks, a little suspiciously.

The dragon only grins, “I have excellent hearing. All the better to hear your laughter. I cannot sense Fenrir from here, and know little about human ways. I will go in whatever direction you wish, as long as you think it might lead us to him.” Murtagh lifts the boar with his teeth, and manages to gingerly put it on the spit for you, roasting the beast over the fire. You can already start to smell the meat cooking. But the question remains, where to set off to tomorrow?
155332222222222222131121221.title: Plan your next move

choices: Catch up on some much needed sleep
1553322222222222221311212213.content:
As much as you’d prefer to stick to human company, something tells you that if a dragon was in either Coninze or Uzien one of the bandits would’ve mentioned it. Your experience with anyone in power is that if they have something that marks them out above the commoners they’ll put it on display for all the world to see. A noble with a tickle dragon? Fenrir’s probably being measured out for golden dragon armor right now. Maybe it’s a case of news traveling slow, but your gut tells you that they’re not the places to start looking. And without a lead there’s only so much ground the three of you can cover.

The elves on the other hand- since magic users are the rule, not the exception, there has to be one out there that can cast a spell to track dragons, or knows how to skry far-away places. The main problem with choosing the elves is that is Ilya’s right, and you’ve heard enough stories to think she is, they won’t take too kindly to your intrusion. On the flip-side of that any bandits on your tail won’t be able to follow you once they reach the borders. On the flip-flip-side, what if they’re willing to let Murtagh in, but not the two of you?

But at this point you decide you’re overthinking it. You run the idea past Ilya and Murtagh but clearly they were willing to go along with whatever you decided on, because they both nod in agreement and raise no concerns.

“Besides.” Ilya says after a moment of thought. “I’ve always wanted to see an Elven village.”

It doesn’t take long for the boar to cook and after some help from Murtagh the two of you dig in ravenously. After your time in the bandit camp, you can’t wolf it down fast enough, but Ilya gives you a run for your money. She doesn’t so much eat the meant as she does inhale.

There’s not much to clean up afterwards and the three of you…
1553322222222222221311212213.title: We have our heading

1553322222222222222.content:
In hindsight, that deal was a really bad decision.

When you made that deal with the tickle demon, you thought the power granted would more than make up for whatever price they cryptically hinted at. And so you used that power to bully your way to the top, stepping on those smaller than you in your quest for total domination. One after another you defeated your enemies, breaking their spirit and taking their belongings, moving ever onward. But cruel beings meet cruel fates. Lured into a trap, you found yourself surrounded, skewered on all sides by your enemies's blades.

And then the demon came to collect it's debt.

You found your soul dragged down into the depths of the underworld, forever condemned to a fate unimaginably cruel. And how cruel it is...

Tentacles that tease ticklish soles. Demons that taunt and coo as they slide their devious fingers over sensitive bellies. Machines made of viscera that bring feathers to ever inch of sensitive skin on their captured sinners. You have spent what seems like weeks already being broken in by the many caretakers of this realm. You've spent hour upon hour screaming, begging, crying, wiggling, and squirming, but no mercy comes for you. But now...

You have a plan. It's a long shot, but you have to get out of here. Return to Zenith, live a full life, escape this ticklish nightmare. But this will certainly be no easy task. You must dodge tickle hungry demons, horrific tickle monsters, feathery traps, and all of the other perils of this place. Do you have what it takes to escape Tickle Hell?

Or would you prefer something less... dark.
1553322222222222222.title: Tickle Hell

choices: What type of tickle torture are you about to undergo?
15533222222222222221.content:
Every moment you spend in this wretched hell in which your thoughts are not being interrupted by tease and tickling, you think about escaping from the vast place. Your intellect was one of the sharpest on Zenith, back when you were among the living, and death fortunately has not dulled it.

There is no sleep in Tickle Hell. The only relief from endless tittillation a resident will get is the short break of being marched to yet another in a series of seemingly infinitely varied torments. They (for you at least) have varied from being pinned down by hulking demons and tickled for days, to being caught and immersed in moving, living tickle slime, to being swarmed by dozens of malevolent little dark fairies. And many more heinous traps await you.

When coated in sweat and dirt, groups of succubi or imps hose and ticklishly scrub you down. If you collapse, some demon will quickly infuse you with more strength and then punish you with tickles.

You continue thinking as the demonic guardians march you to your next tickle torture.

It seems that the great being that rules the realm (what little talk there is between fellow wretched prisoners confirms that no one knows who or what it is) prefers to have a constant eye on all subjects, and thus has a large force of demonesses patrolling the various tortures to report unusual activity back to the Ruler. Any attempt at resistance will be noted by these fast flying enforcers, and infractions severe enough will require a subject be sent to the ominous "Tanks", where the tickle torture is the most concentrated. Each time one enters them a brand new torture is devised suited to tickle them most. You already have spent some time in one, an experience which you would never in your life (er--death) care to repeat.

Unfortunatly, the Tanks are the central focus of your escape plan. As they are located in a dark chasm away from much of tickle Hell, you might be able to overpower your guards there. Then you would need to cut through the rest of Tickle Hell to the other side of the realm, perhaps by disguise or subterfuge, to where the Great Gate which serves as an entrance and exit is located.

It's a long shot, but what happens if you fail? Not like you're gonna get much less tickle torture by just standing around. All you'll need to do is piss off an official enough, and you'll be off to the Tanks. You should probably do this during the next station of tickling.

You approach your new torment
15533222222222222221.title: Escape from Tickle Hell

15533222222222222222.content:
It's been a full year since you were appointed as an Acolyte at the Temple of Surasuri. The townsfolk have come to trust you, despite your relative youth. The local village you were assigned to was a peaceful one, and your time has been spent giving advice, praying for a bountiful harvest, and cleaning the temple grounds. At least, until recently.

A hot summer wind has been blowing out of the south the past week, an unusual occurrence in this valley. The villagers, superstitious folk that they are, consider it an ill omen. Some of them have come to you with reports of seeming a ghostly figure of a young woman wandering the temple at night. You've tried to convince them that it's just a trick of the shadows, or their eyes playing tricks on them after spending too much time at the tavern.

But despite your efforts, rumors are starting to spread. Some whisper that the ghost was your predecessor generations ago, and she's not satisfied with your work. Others say the ghost was blown in on the southern wind, and has come to spread misfortune from whatever land she came from. Still more rumors claim that this ghost was locked away deep inside the temple, but the old charms are slowly losing their potency.

You've never been one to believe in ghosts or phantoms, despite taking a religious vocation. However, recent events have made even you unsure. You've been hearing strange noises at night: the sounds of someone walking in the temple, giggles, repeated whispers of something you can't make out. Combined with the sightings, it's gotten you spooked. And now you've decided to try and do something about it. As the defender of the Temple of Surasuri, it's your duty to protect it and the villagers from any bad spirits.

You've decided to try and communicate with this ghost, maybe even exorcise it. You decide to put on your ceremonial clothes, and stay awake tonight, and see what's really going on…
15533222222222222222.title: Ghost Stories

155332222222222222222.content:
Legends speak of a vast treasure horde that holds enough wealth in gold, magic items, ancient tomes and who knows what else to cater to a dozen families for a hundred generations. The only problem? The wizard who it belonged to, hid it. Saying that one must undertake a long and dangerous journey across the continent to follow the clues that will eventually lead them to the treasure. While many attempted to find it, all have either come back claiming it was too difficult to traverse or have never come back at all.

You are ______, an adventurer who has decided that they will be the one to find it. However you are not so foolish as to believe you can pull this off alone. You will need a team of similarly talented people with different skills in order to take the journey. You made it to the giant obelisk of stone where the wizard carved the first clue (which people then settled around, forming an average sized town). You have ascertained its meaning and know where to travel. Now the difficult part. Finding people to assist you. However there are plenty of settlers and travelers around who are also interested in the treasure. While there was a good chance you'd find more people on the way, you should probably leave with no less than four people. Yourself included.

Is it off to find your soon-to-be companions? Or do you hold a different fate?
155332222222222222222.title: The Treasure Hunt of the Ages

choices: Ask the barmaid in the inn if she's heard of any possible companions
Read the job posters by the Town Hall to find if anyone in town is needs work
1553322222222222222221.content:
After two weeks of inspecting the stone obelisk, you've finally discovered the first clue. You'd spent so long in the center of that small tropical town jotting down notes and inspecting it with your tools that the townspeople had started to look at you funny, but you didn't care. Every night you retreated to your rented room at the inn, and at dawn each day you would have your first meal from a market stand and go back to the obelisk to inspecting the treasure. Now, with the first twenty or so pages of your leather journal covered in notes, you have gathered enough information to find where the next "clue" is located. While you are rusty on your knowledge of glyphs, the pillar seems to point towards the ruins of a palace high on the jungle mountain Kilia to the west. It makes sense, since the great wizard was known to have visited all across the known world in his lifetime.

However, you can't do this alone. Though you've been able to get this far by paying the right people with the gold from your inheritance, you know the path ahead is fraught with more danger then a small-town adventurer like you could ever imagine. No doubt you will face ticklish trials put in place by the wizard himself, beasts and beings guarding the paths you follow, and even rival treasure hunters intent on making away with the treasure. Your skills like in organizing and leadership (you hope!), so you'll need some help for other tasks. You make a quick mental note to search for:

- a capable ranger to both guide you and fight for you

- a competent and well educated mage with knowledge of casting, decoding, and ancient lore

Clinking your last few dozen gold coins around in your coin purse, you know that they won't be enough to pay your fellow companions. They'll need to be convinced that the journey is promising enough to go on without payment up front. With luck, your skills at rhetoric and the possibility of undying wealth can show them the light.
1553322222222222222221.title: Time to hire some adventurers

choices: He points to the back door "They took her to the stocks outside"
He points to the maid washing tables "She had to do all their cleaning for them"
15533222222222222222211.content:
You put your journal back into your knapsack and walk back to the tavern as the sun begins to set. A two-story establishment by the distinguished name of The Pillar's Dregs, it serves as the only watering house in the town, capable of providing a mug of ale to any passing traveler or seasoned drunk. And it serves many of both types, as is usual on warm late evenings like this one. You walk up the steps (like many of the other tropical area's buildings, it is built on short stilts) and walk through the saloon doors cautiously, for as any other place filled with so many people, you never know what mischief may be about.

The inside of the tavern is choked with people, locals and foreigners, so you push your way through the throngs to reach the flight of stairs in the corner leading up to your room. You dodge a flung pewter mug narrowly, and inch around a tenderly kissing couple, both spidering their fingers in each others' armpits tenderly as they kiss. As you make it to the stairs, a lewd barmaid with her cleavage hanging down elicits a shriek from you as she digs her fingers into your hips playfully from behind. You wriggle out of the ticklish embrace and tiredly walk up the wooden staircase to the quieter hall above.

The door to your room is the furthest one on the left, and you swing it open then lock it behind you. It's sparsely furnished, with a straw-mattress bed, a chair, and a slightly crooked dresser. You fling your knapsack on top of your chair and promptly jump onto the slightly thin but still comfortable straw mat. Tired from studying and thinking all day long, you quickly fall asleep.

In the morning you wake up to find the barmaid you'd been looking for. Talk of the town was she was the one to go to if one needed information. First, you'd need to locate her. You crack open the door and walk downstairs to see that the tavern is quite a bit less crowded than last night. Only one person sits nearby at the bar, and a single maid hunches over a table with a soapy rag. Most people are probably more interested in breaking their fast at home or from a market stall than inside the bar. You walk up to the bartender, Trevor, who you understand is a trustworthy, if gruff man.

"So tell me, Trevor," you venture, "Word is you have a wench in your employ who knows who I can hire for...a trip I want to make."

He nods, knowing it's none of his business knowing where or why you are journeying. "You'll be looking for Isobel, then. She always knows about these kinds of opportunities, such as who's offering their services for hire an' the life. I heard she lost a dare to the other barmaids last night...."
15533222222222222222211.title: Ask the barmaid in the inn if she's heard o...

choices: Try to hire Cara the ranger
155332222222222222222112.content:
You look over to see the woman hunched angrily over a table, swabbing at beer stains with a coarse rag. Thanking Trevor, you walk across the hall over to her.

"What do you want?" asks Isobel petulantly. Her long black hair is stuck to her dress, wet from sloshing around water and soap. She's obviously sour from losing her bet with her co-workers.

"I've heard you know who I can go for to find hired help," you say simply. She looks and nods, evidently many people have asked her the same thing. She puts down her cleaning equipment on the freshly scrubbed table and stops slouching, facing you.

"Aye. You're in need of protection and a guide, I can guess" she deduces. You tell her that you need a good ranger and a spellcaster to help you on your journey. Isobel thinks for a minute and nods. "I've got just the people, but it'll cost you."

You've been expecting this, nobody in this town or anywhere else does anything for free. Unfortunately, this means you'll only be able to afford one companion for your journey if you pay this bar wench. And even then you'll have to entice them with promises of more treasure to be found. Grudgingly, you shake some of your remaining coins into the wench's greedy hand. She takes them and then looks at you.

"Fine. Try Johanna if you want a good mage. She's pretty well versed in the 'arcane arts and lore' but also one of those uptight scholarly types. Just a warning: she sometimes likes to experiment with spells on other people," Isobel adds helpfully.

"And then you've got Cara, the town's foremost ranger. I don't like to familiarize myself with her kind," the barmaid sniffles, "she's got a reputation of being greedy and coin-hungry. But that could be used to one's advantage, and if you need a smart, free-thinking, and capable guide, Cara's your girl. By the way, you can probably find them both in the market this time of day." Isobel finishes, and goes back to cleaning her tables.

You finger your bag of money, thinking about which companion you want on your journey.
155332222222222222222112.title: He points to the maid washing tables "She h...

1553322222222222222222.content:
1. You are the grand vizier of an Arabian city, scheming to take the throne for your own. With your powers of shadowmancy and your high level powers of sorcery, it looks like it might come easy.

2. You are the ruler of a land that's of several eras (Ancient Egypt, Ancient Greece and RomeFeudal Japan, 1001 AD Arabia, Middle Ages, Wild West, and even a 2090s era) that you've conquered with help of several nefarious villains and some of your own minions. To entertain yourself, you have your consort of tickle slaves.

Or not, if you don't think that big.
1553322222222222222222.title: A different fate...

choices: So many monsters to choose from...
155332222222222222223.content: You are a initiate of a old monster hunting guild, unlike many others in this world you are well aware of the ejoyment many of the monsters of this world gain from tickling and your mission before you are made a full member of the guild is to tickle a monster that is larger than you into submission.
155332222222222222223.title: Something else.

1553322222222222222231.content:
After a short week of lectures you are sent off more or less untrained, if you can't handle one monster you would never fit among the ranks of the guild. They did have enough care to give you a run down on three monsters and their weak spots:

Lamia: strong muscles in tail allow them to jump/lunge over 15 ft and gives them a nigh unescapeable graple. A one v one battle relies on the non-lamia party having great endurance, as the lamia will not release its target till it grows bored or is forced to. Weak spots are the non scaled sections of waist & breasts.

Harpy: save for its chest and stomach this creature is entirely covered in feathers. Loves tickle fights so getting into a match is as easy as finding one.

AntFolk: the drones don't have a concept of tickle, but if you manage to get to the queen and some how beat her, she may give you a trophy. Obviously breeding season is over or else her teritorial pheremones would have your head on a spike before you even get near.
1553322222222222222231.title: So many monsters to choose from...

choices: A few harpy feathers would be a good introduction!
The queen needs to be stopped.
15533222222222222222312.content:
Going after something standard may be the safest option, but you are doing this in an attempt to join a guild where you will have to fight a variety of incredibly dangerous monsters. If you can't handle anything more then a common lamia, then why even bother joining the guild?

You can think of two places nearby where you may be able to find uncommon monsters, the Harpy nest, and the Ant's hive:

The Harpy's nest is built near the peak of a cliff and houses a multitude of small groups of Harpy who come and go. Chances are at most you will find 3 or so at any one time, but given their love of tickling even 3 of the light-weighted creatures may be able to tickle you into submission with their feathered bodies. However a few of the rare feathers from the Harpy would be a great gift to give to the armory and get you on the good side of the supply branch of the guild. Or you may decide to keep them for personal use.

The area around the Ant hive has all but been abandoned due to the recent surge in the giant ant population. You've heard from hear-say that the Ants humanoid queen has taken a shining to the art of tickling and has begun to train her lesser drones in the skill. Killing her would result in a massive siege on nearby towns by all of the nearby ant hives, but she must be stopped before you have thousands of 2 feet long monsters running about tickling people. Making her aware that the guild is watching her would be a good idea, and giving her a good tickle wouldn't hurt either in convincing her to pull back from her rapid expansion.
15533222222222222222312.title: Something exotic!

choices: I'll wait for them to come to me!
155332222222222222223121.content:
Packing only the allowed cold weather clothing and climbing gear, you begin your journey to the Seventh Cliff, named so after a desperate defense by 7 warriors held off a band of bandits 7 times larger for long enough to assemble a militia and drive them off. As you start the hiking portion of your journey you begin to go over everything you know about Harpies before you have to begin your battle:

The creatures are pretty much just intelligent birds, besides mostly looking human when they aren't tickling passerby they are either hunting, sleeping, or exploring. Their feet and bent more then the normal man's but when resting its only moderately noticeable due to their lack of clothing, when they are actively perching they are able to use several special muscles and a very odd bone design to curve their feet almost 40* more, making for quite the odd sight. From head to toe they are covered in poofey feathers save for their chest, stomach, and part of their waists. While the wings of the creature are quite weird an even odder feature of the Harpy is that they completely lack genitalia yet in some form or other they all have breasts. This lead to much debate on how the species propagated until a particularly lucky inquisitor discovered what appeared to be a chamber built into a cliff that had signs of summoning and transformation magic, this lead a few scholars to believe that this chamber had been used to summon crudely human creature which a group of mages transformed into the bane of travelers they are known as today. These suspicions were confirmed when it was later found that runes carved into the circle included several marks for the property of feathers, bone alteration, and eye sight sculpting.

Once you think you got a crude image of their form in your mind you begin to strategist. If they manage to surround you then they may have enough power in their wings to lift you into the air where you couldn't effectively struggle free. At the same time they tend to use their wings as a preferred tickle implement, these wings are known to be difficult to grapple with due to the many points where they can turn or rotate combined with their tough frame.

All in all this won't be a fair fight, but you were looking for a challenge and this battle will present that a-plenty!
155332222222222222223121.title: A few harpy feathers would be a good introduction!

info.brief_description: A world of swords, sorcery, monsters, and tickling!
info.description:
Welcome to the world of Zenith!

Set in a typical medieval fantasy atmosphere, this story involves YOU adventuring the world for whatever you want. Seeking gold and treasures in a dark cave? Trying to woo the locals in the tavern? Perhaps even serve royalty in a war? While the choices are yours, beware that there are many dangers for someone as ticklish as yourself... and many ticklish beings that would do well to avoid your skilled fingers...


General Rules:

- This is second-person narrative (eg: You are the character). PLEASE try not give yourself a name or use a description that gives yourself a sex. All should be able to enjoy this. But...

- HOWEVER, should you want something unique to happen to a certain gender, then add a Male and Female story branch so that you can use specifics in one path.

- The focus of this story is tickling. You may have battles, romance, dangerous exploration... but they should eventually lead up to a tickling scenario.

- The ticklers/ticklees you encounter may be female, male, or neither!

- Don't feel nervous or shy about adding a chapter to a scene. Just because someone started an intro or wrote one page of tickling doesn't mean they'll be upset if you continue it.
